loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
Sarmila S. is a resident of Thecho, Lalitpur. The majority of people living in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Sarmila S. has four members including herself in her family. Her son is studying in grade 3 and her daughter is in pre-school. 
Her husband's name is Dev Krishna S.. He is a carpenter and opened his furniture shop 3 years ago. Her husband makes different varieties of furniture like beds, tables, chairs and wardrobes.  The family totally relies on shop income. Therefore Mrs. Mali seeks a $375 loan to buy timber to make enough furniture.

loans.use: To buy tumber

loans.name: Sulochana

texts.en:
Mrs. Sulochana K. is a 40 year’s old lady who lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses like grocery.  Her son works in his own grocery store and her daughter works in a private office. 
Mrs. K. makes different varieties of pickles. She took 3 months training for this job. She sells her product in grocery stores and department stores. 
Now she is requesting for her first loan of $150 to buy food material for her work.

loans.use: To buy food material for her work

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
K. Paul, 40, is married with 4 kids of 15 – 7 years old, and he cares for 1 niece.

He has a strong entrepreneurial spirit. He owns a taxi (14 passenger seater) that operates on Iganga – Jinja road and he has hired someone who makes daily reporting to him. Paul is also involved in car hiring (tourism) whereby he moves tourists around to their destination, at times for weeks, and most of his customers are Germans, Americans and the Dutch people. Paul’s business is fun to say even the way he changes his accent at the mere mention of the word. He has had his business for three years and has been a member of Baligenwa lending group for three years.

He needs a loan to buy a spacious van of six seats to stop renting costly vans once he gets clients in a group. However, he says this is an off season with few tourists, but there is to be much business in July throughout November. He has made enough savings to top up with the loan for the purchase of the van.

loans.use: Kyangwa Paul needs a loan to top up with his savings to buy a spacious van.

loans.name: Kiwamirembe Women's Group

texts.en:
N. Jalia’s story is one that cannot go unnoticed. She is the treasurer of Kiwamirembe Women’s group in Mukono and has a retail shop in Kigombya that deals in selling clothes; Bitenge, the Nigerian wear, and suits for ladies that she buys from Kampala mostly on Thursday and Sunday. Her shop also has a fridge for selling sodas and beers.

Jalia is a widow with 4 children of her own as she cares for 3 orphans that have since become her own. These orphans are of no relation to her but she has decided to take them in after their parents (fathers), with the support of their stepmothers deserted them for death, and she does this with the awareness of the Police and the local authorities. She says she does this not for material gains but to help those in need considering what she went through as a child. This is not a story to bring sympathy but to let the world know that such big and kind hearted people still exist. The little she has is shared among themselves as she also pays for their school fees, except 2 children who are still 3 years old. This story is what inspires Jalia to work so hard and she would like to start up an orphanage since child neglect cases are so numerous in her area, and her husband left her enough land for that.

She would like a loan to help with buying 15 crates of soda with half of her loan and the other half for buying suits and bitenge for the shop.

loans.use: Namusoke Jalia  would like a loan to help with buying 15 crates of soda with half of her loan and the other half for buying suits and bitenge for the shop.

loans.name: Helina

texts.en:
Helina Y. sells rubbers and plastic items. She is married and has 5 dependants. Her husband is a farmer. Business is doing very well but she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

She is asking for a loan of $200 to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Oun Sam Group

texts.en:
Four residents in Prey Taing Thnong Village make up one group in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. O. S., the group leader is a farmer and sells cakes in her village. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are farmers. The other two are studying at the state school. In September of last year, three of her children contracted malaria. Mrs. O. S. obtained a loan of $325 to purchase medicines to cure them of the disease.

She usually buys ingredients to make the cakes for resale. This requires a positive cash flow and because many villagers purchase on credit, she is unable to purchase the raw ingredients in a timely manner. Mrs. S. would like to sell her cakes in a primary school and increase her cash flow. She is requesting a loan to achieve this goal.

One group member, Mr. Ruon Y., is not in the picture but his wife represents him.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make cakes for resale

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. sells used clothing and cosmetics. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a driver. Business is doing very well but she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.
	
She is asking for a loan of $500 to buy more clothing for sale.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A.  sells used clothing. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a driver. Business is doing very well but she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.
	
She is asking for a loan of $500 to buy more used clothing for sale.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex F.  sells used clothing. He is married and has 1 child. Business is doing very well but he wishes to increase sales. He is running out of stock.
	
He is asking for a $500 loan to buy more clothing for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Von Kev Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Von K. is 58-years-old and the mother of two children, both of whom are employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Man Nut, is a farmer.

Mrs. Von K. is the group leader of four in Prey Taing Thnong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and sells cakes to her fellow villagers. Mrs. Von K. sells her cakes on credit to her customers and thus does not have a strong cash flow. She would like to start a new business selling cheese and is requesting a loan to purchase cheese for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cheese for resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs.  Victoria I. is 54 years of age, she lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with 6 children and she sells Provisions, which is what she learned from her lovely  mother. She is requesting a loan of $875 to enable her improve her business and  has been in LAPO for 10 year as a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy more provision for sales

loans.name: Bunmi

texts.en: Mrs. Bunmi I. is 34 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with 4 children. She started selling provisions 2005, and she is soliciting for a loan of $450 to enable her buy more provisions to sell to improve her business. She has been a dedicated LAPO client for 7 years.

loans.use: To buy more Provisions for sales

loans.name: Osaretin Aikhaje

texts.en: Mrs. Osaretin Aikhaje I. is 33 years of age. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with a child, she sells provisions which she learned from her mother and started in 1997. She is soliciting for a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more provisions for sales and to improve her business. She has been a dedicated LAPO client for 10 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sales

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Mrs. Bridget A. is 35 years old; she lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with 3 children. She learned to sell clothes from her sister and started selling clothes in 1994. She is requesting for a loan of $1200 to enable her to buy more clothes for sale. She has been a LAPO client for 8 years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sales

loans.name: Faozia

texts.fr:
Born in 1990 in Kpalimé in the prefecture of Kloto, situated 120 km from Lomé, Mrs. Faozia A. is unmarried. Her main business is the purchase and sale of generic drugs and basic need goods in the Hédzranawoé area in Lomé. After ending her education due to a lack of material and financial means in 2000, she immediately embraced this small business as a way to make a living.

This loan, her first, will allow her to buy five (5) boxes of generic drugs, comprising mainly nivaquine, paracetamol, and aspirin.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1990 à Kpalimé dans la préfecture de Kloto située à 120km de Lomé, Madame A. Faozia est célibataire. Elle a pour activité principale l'achat et vente des produits génériques et des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Depuis qu'elle a cessé les études faute de soutiens matériels et financiers en l'an 2000, elle a immédiatement embrassé le petit commerce pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins.

Ce premier crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter cinq (5) cartons de produits génériques constitués essentiellement de nivaquine, de paracétamol et d'aspirine.

loans.use: To buy and sell generic pharmaceuticals

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Nosakhare

texts.en: Mrs. Nosakhare Omonuyi is 41 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria and is married with 3 children. She learned how to make weavons from her sister and has sold them for 5 years. After being in LAPO for four years, she is now requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more weavons to sell.

loans.use: To buy more Weavons for sales

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Mrs. Rita A. is 40 years of age and is married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.  She works at her mill and she will use the loan to purchase a new grinding machine so she can boost her output to meet her customers demand. She has been a LAPO client for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy an additional Grinding Machine

loans.name: Komi Gaston

texts.fr:
Mr. Komi Gaston A. was born on 31 December 1982 in Tékponou in the prefecture of VO. He is married and has two (2) children. In 2000, he started a business buying and selling shoes in the Hédzranawoé market. He buys from his suppliers who are at the Port. The business of selling shoes is flourishing for Mr. A., and he would like to increase his stock by buying fifty (50) pairs of shoes with this loan, his first.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Komi Gaston est né le 31 décembre 1982 à Tékponou dans la préfecture de VO. Il est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. En 2000, il a mis sur pieds, une activité d'achat et de vente de chaussures dans le marché de Hédzranawoé. Il achète auprès de ses fournisseurs qui sont au Port autonome. La vente de chaussures devient de plus en plus florissante pour Monsieur A. et il désire augmenter son stock par l'achat de cinquante (50) paires de chaussures avec son premier crédit qu’il sollicite

loans.use: To buy and sell shoes

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Mrs. Alice E. is 47 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City , Edo state, Nigeria. She has been selling bead and jewelry for three years. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more materials so she can make more beutiful jewelry.

loans.use: To buy more Bead for sales

loans.name: Osawe

texts.en: Mrs. Osawe I. lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She is interested in fashion design and studied it for 3 years before starting her business in 1992. She is requesting for a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more tailoring materials and clothes for sale. She has been a LAPO client for 2 years.

loans.use: Fashion designing and sales of tailoring  Materials

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Mrs. Bola O. is 40 years of old, and she lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She is married with 6 children.  She sells provisions and clothes in her supermarket.  She learned the business from her mother and started in 2000.  She is requesting for a loan of $1200 to enable her to buy more provisions and clothes to sell. She has been a LAPO client for 6 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and clothes for sale

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: A. Mabel is 38 years old and married with a child. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She started her own business and has sold provisions and drinks since 2007. Now, she needs a loan of $450 to buy more provisions and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate O. sells provisions and drinks to people in her community. She is married with five children and she is 39 years old. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 1987. She has been a LAPO client for 4 years. She needs a loan of $875 to buy more food, drink and an engine for grinding cereal, tomatoes, etc.

loans.use: To buy food for sale and grinding machine

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 32 year old butcher, who is married with four children. He and his one worker have been working in his butcher shop for 9 years. He buys a cow from the abattoir every couple of days for $235, sells half of it straight away for $135 to another butcher making him $18. The other half he takes back to his shop and butchers the meat to sell by the kilo. Aside from the head, which he leaves at the abattoir, he sells every part of the cow. He makes around $30 profit on the second half of the cow.

He is looking for a loan of $600 to buy some new scales, new machetes and to help him buy a fresh cow as he has recently used his profits to pay for the children's school fees.

loans.use: Moses is looking for a loan to use in his butcher business.  He wants to by some new scales, new machetes and to help him buy a fresh cow as he has recently used his profits to pay for the children's school fees.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris I. is 46 years old, married and has seven children. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks and snacks. This was a business she learned from her mother. She has been a member of LAPO for 5 years. She hopes to serve her customers better so she is requesting for a loan of $875 to enable her to buy a grinding machine and a generator. She said that this will enable her to make a larger profit. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy a grinding machine and a generator

loans.name: Silas

texts.en: Silas B. is 53 years old and married with seven children.  As a teacher, with a salary of less than $250, it is not easy to provide all the needs of the family members.  Silas has 5 of hectors farmland but cannot cultivate them all due to lack of farm supplies and labor assistance..  He would like expand his farming activity to produce more rice, beans and cassava for the family.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $700 to purchase fertilizer, seeds and to hire labor.

loans.use: Purchase farm supplies and topay for labor..

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Silas

texts.en: Silas is 53 years old and married with seven children.  As a teacher, with a salary of less than $250, it is not easy to provide all the needs of the family members.  Silas has 5 hectors farmland but could not cultivate them all due to lack of farm inputs.  He would like to expand his farming activity to produce more rice, beans and cassav for the family.  He is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000 to purchase fertilizer, seeds and hire labour.  Silas will repay the loan from his monthly salary.

loans.use: Purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima A. sells foot wear and provisions. She is 28 years old and is married with two children. She hails from the western part of Nigeria and resides in Edo State. Fatima started her business on her own in 2003 and has been running it ever since. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more provisions to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provision for sale

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is a 47 year old widow who makes handicrafts (mostly bags and tablecloths) which she sells at a stall in her village. Just over one year ago, Gertrude started sewing alterations to ladies' dresses. She purchases linings and trimmings to decorate gomesi - the traditional dress worn by most older Ugandan women. This is taking over from the handicrafts as her main source of income, as there are so many ready-made items available for much cheaper than she can afford to make by hand.

Gertrude has been borrowing with this group for two years and she says the group has been 'like a mother to her' as she had lost all hope after her husband died, but here she receives support from the other women in the group.

Gertrude has ten children, four in school and six already working. She also has three grandchildren who are supported by their parents.

loans.use: Gertrude is looking for a loan to purchase more haberdashery for her craft business

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy O. is 42 years old and  married with six children.  She sells timber (logs) and plant. She has been in business since 2004 , which is when she learned this type of work from her friend Mrs. Ehigiator. She needs a loan $1200 to buy more timber so that she can sell it in order to make money to provide her family.

loans.use: To buy more timber(logs) for sale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen S. is 32 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells planks and has been in business since 2003. She has learned for three years from a friend, Mrs. Eboigbe. She is requesting for a loan of $1,200 so that she can buy more timbers that she can then sell.

loans.use: To buy more timber for sale

loans.name: Martin Ayantayo

texts.fr:
Mr. Martin Ayantayo A. was born on 7 October 1970 in Aflao-Adidogo in the prefecture of Golfe. He is married and has three (3) children. He started his own shop selling haberdashery products (ETS RIGHTLINE) in 1997 in the Kodjoviakopé area. His longstanding presence in the area and his excellent customer service have given him the means to gain the confidence of his clientele. This loan, his first, will allow him to purchase fifty boxes of sewing thread, ribbons, and satin.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Martin Ayantayo est né le 07 octobre 1970 à Aflao-Adidogo dans la préfecture de Golfe. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il a crée son magasin de vente de mercerie (ETS RIGHTLINE) depuis 1997 dans le quartier de Kodjoviakopé. Son ancienneté dans le quartier et sa meilleure façon de servir ses clients sont pour lui un moyen de gagner la confiance de ces derniers. Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra cinquante cartons de fil à coudre, des rubans et des satins.

loans.use: To buy and sell haberdashery products

loans.name: Ogbeide

texts.en: Ogbeide I. is 27 years old, still single and has been in business since 2006. She sells wine. She learned this business from her mother. She is from Edo state, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more wine for sale. This will help her to serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more wine for sale

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda O. is single and 23 years old. She has sold drinks, clothes and coolers since 2005. She is a LAPO client. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She is in need of a loan of $450 to buy more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all those who will make the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and drinks to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Meg O. is married with four children. She is 39 years old and hails from the western part of Nigeria. She resides in Edo State. She has been in business since 2002. She sells provision and foodstuffs, and she also sews clothes. She is in need of a loan of $600 to buy more provision and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provision and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ayélé O. was born on 2 November 1974 in Zinder, Niger. She is Togolese and is married to a Mr. AVOUDJIGBE, an electrician. She is a midwife nurse in a clinic that she herself created in 2003 in the Gbényédji area in Lomé. She has two people in her care. She also sells pharmaceutical products in her clinic to reduce the patients' transport costs, which she does by making a profit on her sales. This, her first loan, will allow her to create a supply of tablets and sets of bandages.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame O. Ayélé est née le 2 novembre 1974 à Zinder au Niger. Elle est de nationalité togolaise et s’est mariée à Monsieur AVOUDJIGBE qui est un électricien. Elle est infirmière accoucheuse dans une clinique qu’elle-même a crée depuis 2003 dans le quartier de Gbényédji à Lomé. Elle a deux personnes à charge. Elle vend aussi des produits pharmaceutiques dans sa clinique pour réduire le coût de transport aux patients et en retour gagner un bénéfice sur les ventes. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire l’approvisionnement des comprimés et des sets de pansement. .

loans.use: To buy tablets and sets of bandages

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate C. E. is  married with five children. She is forty years old from Delta state, but resides in Benin City, E. State Nigeria. She sells female wears and other clothes, which is one of the services people in her community enjoy. She has been in the business for fifteen years and needs the loan of $450 to buy more clothes so that she can sell them.

loans.use: To buy more female clothes for sales

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther I. is 42 years old, married and has three children. She owns an apothecary where she sells drugs.  She has been a member of LAPO Microfinance for three years. She is requesting for a loan of $1,200 to enable her buy more drugs to sell. With this she said she would be able to serve her customer better. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Maimuna's Makuti A Group

texts.en:
Maimuna H., 51 years old, is a widow with four children (ages 28, 26, 24 and 20). She has operated two businesses - a retail shop and used clothing sales - for two years now. Working from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $95. Maimuna took out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to start the used clothing business. She now hopes for a new loan to increase capital for both businesses. In the picture, Maimuna is third from right middle row with a black scarf.

Maimuna will share this loan with her loan group, which totals 18 members. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase capital for both businesses.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a skilled, hard-working entrepreneur from Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. She is married with one child. Anna opened a store in the central market of her home town about six months ago where she sells women’s clothing. She is an organized and effective manager with an excellent reputation among other entrepreneurs. Presently, she has about $5,000 in turnover capital, and her profit exceeds $500 a month.

Anna has requested a loan of $525 to purchase additional inventory. With the increased profits she expects to earn, Anna plans to continue expanding her trade and provide service that is second to none. She masterfully uses unique skills that she has learned and cultivated while working. We believe Anna's willingness to keep her reputation as a trustworthy and professional entrepreneur will help her reach even greater success in this business.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila runs a small business selling women’s clothing at a huge market in the city of Simferopol, Ukraine. She has been in business for seven years and has developed an effective business strategy of having a good selection of products and pricing her inventory just a little lower than her competitors. Her current sales location is in an especially busy part of the market. In the next three or four months, she plans to move to a new area of the market where small booths are being constructed for vendors.

Ludmila is divorced and has a daughter who is 24. They live together in a small apartment on the top floor of their building. The roof has a consistent problem with leaks. Ludmila hopes to earn extra income from her business to have the leaks fixed.

Ludmila has requested a loan of $1,050 to help purchase new inventory and increase the assortment of clothing she has for sale. We are grateful for the opportunity to assist this hard-working entrepreneur with her business and look forward to her continued success.

loans.use: To buy new clothing inventory

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
For the past seven years, Yelena has operated a clothing kiosk in the central market of Ordzhonikidze. Determined, hard working and enterprising, Yelena has successfully grown her business to provide a stable and consistent income. Currently, she earns over $1,000 per month in profits. Yelena is divorced and her business is a valuable source of income for her.

Yelena wants to continue investing in her company. She is a long-term client at Nadiya Ukraine and has successfully used the support of microloans to expand her business and generate additional income. Currently, Yelena is seeking a loan for $525 to increase her inventory. With additional profits, Yelena plans to continue developing her business and become a more successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Olesya

texts.en:
Olesya is a sharp young entrepreneur who lives in Simferopol on the Crimean peninsula in southern Ukraine. She owns a profitable women’s clothing business located at the bustling Central Market. Unlike many other clothing vendors, who purchase clothing from wholesalers in Odessa, another city in Ukraine, Olesya purchases inventory from Turkey, which allows her to have a better assortment to sell. Olesya is single and lives with her mother and step-father. Her mother is also an entrepreneur who sells clothing in the market.

Olesya has requested a loan of $1,050 to help open a new sales location. She and a partner are working together on it. This loan will free up some of Olesya’s working capital so she can pursue this business expansion and work to increase her income.

loans.use: Help open a new sales location

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with two children. She is an entrepreneur who lives in the city of Ordzhonikidze, where she owns a small business selling footwear in the central market and in neighboring villages where she travels periodically. Natalya chose this trade because demand is stable. She started her venture 11 years ago and it has brought her a good income ever since that time. Presently, Natalya has about $9,000 in working capital. Her monthly net profit is about $1,100.

Natalya is hoping to use a loan of $525 to purchase assorted inventory and boost her sales. This will help her generate additional income. Natalya has an extensive and good credit history and is known as an entrepreneur of integrity. We believe her good record and honest approach in the matters of business will guarantee prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy new inventory

loans.name: Tessy

texts.en:
Tessy O. is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She resides in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells women's clothing and baby clothes in an open market place. She has been in this business since 2005.

Tessy is a LAPO client. She needs a loan $450 to purchase more inventory for sale.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe I. sells traditional women's clothes ( known in English as a wrapper). She is 41 years old and is married with four children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. Phoebe has been in this business for the past 6 years. This she learnt for 5 years as an apprentice.

Phoebe is a LAPO client. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more inventory. This will help her to better serve her costumers.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana runs a business selling clothing in the city of Simferopol, Ukraine. She currently sells from two locations in different parts of the city. One location is well established and she is developing the other one. Svetlana is able to buy clothing at good prices from European distributors, which helps her make a better profit. Svetlana is married, and lives with her husband. One of her goals is to do some remodeling of their apartment.

Svetlana has requested a short-term loan to buy additional inventory for her business. This is her first loan from Nadiya Ukraine. We hope it is the beginning of a good partnership with her that will help her continue to be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy new inventory

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene A. is married with five children. She is 44 years old and sells timber in her community. She has been in this business for five years. She hails from Edo state, Nigeria.

Magdalene needs a loan of $700 to buy more timber for sale. This will help to boost her income.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Egharevba

texts.en: Egharevba E. trades in wood. He has been in this business for the past 8 years. He is 46 years old and is married with two children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is a LAPO client and needs a loan $600 to buy more timber for sale.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick E. is single and he is 28 years old. He is a carpenter who produces furniture and woodwork. This is a trade he learnt for 3 years before starting his own business in 2003. He is able to make different types of furniture such as chairs, tables, etc. He is from Edo State, Nigeria.

Fredrick needs a loan of $450 to buy a generator for his equipment when there is a power outage.

loans.use: To buy a generator for his business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. sells local gin. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Esther is 51 years old and married with three children. She started this business in 2003 on her own and the business is lucrative for her. She goes to the local market to sell every fortnight. She is a LAPO client who needs a loan of $450 to buy more gin for sales.

loans.use: To buy more linventory

loans.name: Caro

texts.en: Caro J. is 35 years old and married with three children. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria, and she sells women's and baby clothing. She has been in this business since 1998. Caro has been a LAPO client for the past six years. She now needs a loan of $700 to buy more clothing for sale. This will help her to raise her profit level.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Gbadebo

texts.en: Gbadebo S. sells bags such as traveling bags, school bags, and handbags in Oka community, Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 38 years old and married with four children. She learnt this business for 3 years and started her own in 2005. She is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more bags for sale.  She is from the western part of Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more bags for inventory

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty P. is 36 years old and married with seven children. She sells plastic household utensils including coolers, bowls, spoons, etc. She has been in this business since 2004. She is from the eastern part of Nigeria and resides in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Mrs. Kemi O. is 41 years of age and lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs and drinks, a business that she learnt from her mother. She is requesting a loan of $875 to enable her buy a deep freezer and drinks so that she can improve her business. She has been a LAPO client for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer and drinks

loans.name: Les Revellons Group

texts.en:
Mytilene lives in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti, with her 4 children. Everyday she fills several barrels with gasoline, and sells it from the street to cars and motorcycles passing by. With this loan she will buy more gasoline and new containers to hold it and make it easier to transport. She says that her biggest challenge right now is paying for her children to go to school, but she hopes that over the next 6 months her profits will increase.

This is a new “Bank of Hope” for Esperanza, and we want to thank all Kiva lenders for partnering with us to support these talented entrepreneurs. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy gasoline and containers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth A. is 38 years of age and she lives in Benin City. She is married with 5 children. She sells local soap, a business that she learnt for 1 year and then started on her own in 2006. She is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more materials to produce and sell the soap locally known as soda. She has been in LAPO for 1 year as a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy more Materials for the production and sale of soap

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Mrs. Vero O. is 35 years old and she lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She is married with one child.  In her beauty salon she specializes in weaving and plaiting hair, skills that she studied for 8 months before starting her business in  2000. She is requesting a loan of $300 to buy more inventory, including weavings. She has been in LAPO for the past 7 years.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Lynda

texts.en: Mrs. Lynda E. is 34 years of age and lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with 3 children and she sells general provisions and foodstuffs in a business that she learnt for 3 months and then started in 2003.  She is requesting a loan of $875 to buy more inventory and thereby improve her business.  She has been in LAPO for 3 years as a dedicated client.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther N. is 50 years of age and lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with 6 children.  She sells dried river fish, a business that she learnt from her mother and started on her own in 1985. She is now requesting a loan of $1,125 to expand her inventory. She has been a dedicated LAPO client for the past 10 years.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Altiplano Group

texts.es:
Every 15 days the Altiplano association meets in the Pro-Mujer center. With much responsibility they have completed their 4th year working with Pro-Mujer. The majority of members are married with families. For example, Mrs. Domi has 8 children in her care and even when she is ill, with her family’s help, she sells cakes, cookies, desserts and other products in order to obtain a little money in order to meet her family’s daily needs. The primary activity of this group is selling food. They offer breakfast, lunch, dinner, and as we have mentioned, various baked goods. They need capital to purchase supplies and be able to rent adequate space to sell their exquisite dishes, with the hope of generating greater income for the well-being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Cada quince días la asociación Altiplano se reúne en el centro focal de villa exaltación, que pertenece a Pro-Mujer. Con mucha responsabilidad ya cumplen su cuarto año de trabajar junto a esta entidad. La mayoría casadas con familias numerosas tal es el caso de doña Domi con 8 hijos a su cargo y aun encontrándose enferma, con la ayuda de su familia se dedica a la venta pasteles, galletas, bizcochos y otros, para poder obtener un poco de dinero que pueda sustentar a su familia diariamente. La actividad central en la asociación es la venta de comida, ofrecen desde desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, además como ya habíamos mencionados de variadas reposterías. Ellas necesitan mayor capital para proveerse de insumos y poder alquilar lugares adecuados para vender sus exquisitos platillos, con la esperanza de generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias.

loans.use: They need capital to purchase supplies and be able to rent adequate space to offer their products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Pro Mujer Bolivia - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs.  Stella O. is 48 years of age and  lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.   She is married with 6 children.  She sells beans and rice in the market, a business that she learnt from her brother.  She is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her buy more inventory. She is a trader and has been in LAPO for the past 7 years as a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Aziz

texts.fr:
Born November 12, 1967 in Baguida in the Golfe Prefecture, Mr. Aziz A. is married and has two children. In 2005, he set up a store selling essentials in Lomé’s Bè neighborhood. Since he began this business, he has managed to gain an important share of the market as he always keeps a warm welcome for his customers. Most products are available in his store. To this end, Mr. A. is making a first-time request for a loan in order to get supplies such as: 5 cases of milk, 50 cases of olive oil soap, and pasta. Besides these provisions, he also wants to buy phone cards as he has two pay-phones.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 12 novembre 1967 à Baguida dans la préfecture du Golfe, Monsieur A. Aziz est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. En 2005, il a crée un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier de Bè à Lomé. Depuis qu’il a commencé cette activité, il arrive à gagner une part de marché important car il réserve toujours un accueil chaleureux à ses clients. De plus la plupart des produits sont disponible dans son magasin. A cet effet, Monsieur A. Aziz sollicite pour la première fois ce prêt pour faire l’approvisionnement des vivres telles que : Cinq (5) cartons de lait, cinquante (50) cartons de savons de Marseille et des pâtes alimentaires. En dehors de ces vivres, il désire également acheter des cartes de recharge car il dispose également des cabines téléphoniques.

loans.use: To buy and sell essentials

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella F. is 52 years of age and lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with 6 children.  She sells general provisions including cooking oil, a business that she learnt from her sister and started on her own in 1998.  Now she is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more inventory. She is a LAPO member.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella A. is 54 years of age.  She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria, and is married with 6 children.  She sells drinks and is a hairdresser, a skill that she learnt for 2 years and then started her own business in 1980.  Now she needs a loan of $700 to purchase supplies for her salon. She has been a LAPO client for the past 6 years.

loans.use: To buy salon supplies

loans.name: Señor De Lagunas Group

texts.es:
The “Señor de Lagunas” group has worked responsibly with Pro-Mujer for 10 years. Almost all the members have businesses selling supplies and food, which they acquire at wholesale prices to resell at retail prices. They need capital to rent stores on the Raúl Salmón street in El Alto, as this is a commercial zone suitable to selling these products, thereby guaranteeing greater income in order to support their families. For example, Mrs. Catita, a widow, is alone and responsible for 7 children, so she works with all her might to earn sufficient income for the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Señor de Lagunas es la denominación que adoptan 19 socias que trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer .Dicha asociación es una de las más antiguas con 10 años de trabajo responsable. Casi todas se dedican a la comercialización de víveres y comestibles , éstos adquiridos al mayor para respectiva venta al por menor, Ellas requieren capital para alquilar tiendas en la calle Raúl Salmón, de la Ceja de El Alto, ya que es un zona netamente comercial para este tipo de productos, con lo que garantizarían mejores ingresos para sustentar a sus numerosas familias, tal es el caso de doña Catita que lamentablemente quedo viuda, teniendo que ser responsable ella sola de 7 hijos, por eso ella trabaja con todas sus fuerzas para generar ingresos suficientes para el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Capital to rent stores in the commercial area of Raúl Salmón street in El Alto

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Mr. Enrique lives with his mother in a rented home on Buenos Aires Avenue in La Paz city. His business is providing sound amplification at social events, such as weddings, birthdays, etc. The loan he is seeking will be used to buy a sound system that will improve the quality of sound so that he will gain more contracts and improve his income. Because of his good credit history he can obtain a new loan for this purchase.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Enrique vive en anticrético con su mamá en la Av. Buenos Aires de la Ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza para generar sus ingresos es el servicio de amplificación en acontecimientos sociales, como ser matrimonios, cumpleaños, etc. El crédito que solicita es para comprar un equipo con el cual puede mejorar la calidad del sonido de tal manera que pueda tener mayores contratos y mejorar sus ingresos. Por su antecedente histórico puede obtener un nuevo crédito ya que su historial de pagos es muy bueno.

loans.use: Buy a sound system for his disc jockey business

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Mrs. Glory A. is 42 years of age. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria, and is married with 4 children. She sells provisions and is a hairdresser, a profession that she learned in 2 years.  She is soliciting a loan of $300 to buy drinks and other supplies for her salon. She has been a LAPO client for 3 years. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy salon supplies

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John B.  is a manufacturer of a local Gin (drink). He is married and has 3 children. Business is doing very well but he wishes to increase production and  sales.  

He is asking for additional capital to buy more raw materials for production of a local drink.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for production of a local drink.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Mrs. Emiliana lives in her own home with her husband and children on the Jaimes Freyre street in the Sopocachi area of La Paz city. She earns her income by selling food in a food stand she has in the door of her home. She had a previous loan from Kiva and she repaid it well.

The loan will be used to buy food supplies as the products she need go up daily and what she would like to do is buy in quantity so as to not lose customers.

Her credit history is good and qualifies her to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Emiliana vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus nietos en la calle Jaimes Freyre de la zona de sopocachi de La Ciudad de La Paz; ella genera sus ingresos con la venta de comida en un puesto que tiene en la puerta de su casa; anteriormente ya solicitó un préstamo de Kiva y pagó muy bien.

El crédito que solicita es para compra de insumos ya que los productos de primera necesidad suben diariamente y lo que quiere es comprar en cantidad de tal manera no perder clientela.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Buy food supplies for her food stand.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela works in a law firm as a secretary and transcriptionist. Her home is located in the Villa Copacabana Sector Pacasa are of La Paz. She is single, lives with her parents, and her food, education and other expenses are covered by her job as she is an adult. This is the first time she is seeking a loan from Impro, and the loan will be used for a deposit on a room with the objective of saving money in order to live independently. Her work and desire to succeed enable her to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Marcela trabaja en un estudio Jurídico como secretaria y transcriptora. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Copacabana Sector Pacasa de la ciudad de La Paz. Es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres y los gastos de alimentación, educación y otros los cubre con su trabajo ya que es independiente. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para anticrético de una habitación con el objetivo de Ahorrar y también vivir independiente. Su trabajo y las ganas de superación le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Pay a deposit for a room in order to live independently and save money for rent payments.

loans.name: Virgen Del Socavon Group

texts.es:
The “Virgen del Socavón” association has been with the Pro-Mujer family for approximately one year, completing 3 loan cycles. The association is located in the Senkata area of El Alto city. To date there are 20 members and they have demonstrated to be an organized group in repaying their loan payments.

Inside the group the majority are married with children, also all of whom are school-aged. There are a few cases where, because of lack of resources, sadly the children had to abandon their studies in school in order to help their parents in their small businesses and take care of their younger siblings.

There are different businesses within the association such as: selling chickens, carpentry, selling undergarments; but the primary activity is the sewing of athletic suits, which once produced, are sold in the La Paz markets and distributed as ordered to some schools. The Virgen del Socavón association affirms that they need capital in order to buy better quality fabric, thereby enabling their products to be of better quality and gain more customers resulting in more earnings with the sole objective of improving their economic situation and offering their children a better standards of living and an education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La asociación denominada “Virgen del Socavón ” pertenece a la familia de pro-mujer hace ya un año aproximadamente cumpliendo con 3 ciclos de crédito, esta se encuentra en la zona de Senkata, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 20 socias activas y han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.

Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar, existiendo algunos casos que por falta de recursos lastimosamente sus hijos tuvieron que abandonar sus estudios ya que estos deben ayudar a sus padres en sus pequeños negocios y cuidar de sus hermanos menores.

Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de carne de pollo, la carpintería, venta de ropa intima pero la actividad principal es la costura de prendas deportivas que una vez producidas las venden en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y la distribuyen a pedido en algunos centros educativos. La asociación Virgen del Socavón afirma que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de telas de mejor calidad de esta manera sus productos también tendrían mejor calidad y así obtendrían mayores clientes y por consiguiente mayores ganancias con el único objetivo de mejorar su situación económica de esta manera ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor forma de vida principalmente en su educación.

loans.use: Capital to purchase better quality raw materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Pro Mujer Bolivia - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy I. is 35 years old and married with two children. She hails from the Oka area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has a cold room for selling various types of fish. She has been in this business for the past four years. She needs a loan of $875 to buy more fish inventory. She thanks Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luís works as a construction contractor and he has a small grocery store in his home. His wife is a housewife and has three children, one grown and two who are studying at the state university. His home is located in the Llojeta area on the western side of La Paz.

This is the first time he is seeking a loan from Impro. The loan will be used for the installation and operation of a larger neighborhood grocery store by purchasing merchandise to sell such as rice, noodles, canned goods, candy, cookies, and soda pop.

His work and desire to succeed enable him to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Luís trabaja como contratista de construcciones y tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, su esposa realiza labores de casa y tiene tres hijos uno es independiente y dos estudian en la Universidad estatal. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Llojeta sector los claveles de la Ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para la instalación y funcionamiento de una tienda de barrio más completa con la compra de mercadería como ser Arroz, fideo, conservas, dulces, galletas y refrescos.

Su trabajo y las ganas de superación le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise in order to expand his grocery store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Lawretta

texts.en: Lawretta K. is 52 years old and  married with 8children. She from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells meat  in an open market.  she has been in business for the past 7 years. She is requesting for a loan of $700 to buy more meat for sales. she thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more meat for sales

loans.name: Elver

texts.es:
Señor Elver lives with his wife and two children in the area Ciudadela Ferroviaria in the city of La Paz. Elver rented a store where his wife runs a food shop. Elver also purchased a car that he uses as a taxi. During the weekends he works on the car. Elver is asking for a loan to repair his car, which will earn him enough income to support his family. His credit history is good and he qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Elver vive en la calle 2 de la Ciudadela ferroviaria de La Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Elver alquiló una tienda en la cual su esposa puso un frial el cual atienden los dos. Elver a su vez compró un auto el cual hace trabajar en transporte público contratando los servicios de un chofer y los fines de semana trabaja él con el auto. El crédito que solicita es para reparar su movilidad ya que con los ingresos que obtiene puede mejorar su economía y mantener a su familia. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Maintenance for the taxi that he uses to generate income.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Ohiegbomwan Magdalene is 38 years old and married with five children. She sells meat in the Ekiosa market, one of the local markets in her community. She is from the Oka Area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been engaged in this business since 2005. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more meat for sale to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more meat for sale

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mr. Mariano F. Huanca lives in his own home in the Llojeta area of El Alto city with his wife, Mrs. Juana Mamani and their daughter. Mariano works as a bricklayer on private homes and his wife works with him as his assistant.

With previous loans they built six rooms including the bathroom, but he still has two rooms to finish.

The loan will be used to do finish work in two rooms.

This is the eighth time he has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic evaluation favorably qualifies him and he can access this line of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Mariano F. Huanca vive en casa propia, en la zona Llojeta de la Ciudad de El Alto, con su esposa, la señora Juana Mamani y su hija. El señor Mariano trabaja como albañil en construcciones particulares y su esposa trabaja junto a el como ayudante de albañil.

Con anteriores créditos realizaron la construcción de seis habitaciones incluyendo el baño, de los cuales le falta terminar dos ambientes.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina de dos habitaciones.

Esta es la octava ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Complete the finish work in two rooms of his home in order to be able to live in them more comfortably.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar is a taxi driver in El Alto city. His wife is a weaver and baker (making turnovers, bread) as their main source of income to support their children who are dependent on the couple. They live in the El Alto area of Villa Adela.

The loan they need is for the construction of a small oven to make bread, where his wife and son will be able to work in order to increase household income to support the family.

This is the second loan with Impro, the evaluation qualifies them for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Oscar, es transportista de servicio publico trabaja de Taxi en la ciudad de El Alto, la esposa es tejedora y realiza masitas (empanadas, pan) es su principal fuente de ingreso para cubrir la manutención de sus dos hijos que depende todavía de la pareja, vive la Ciudad de El Alto Zona Villa Adela.

El crédito requiere para la construcción de un pequeño horno para realizar pan, donde podrán trabajar la esposa y su hijo mismo que le ayudara a percibir mayores ingresos económicos para la familia.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del prestamos.

loans.use: Purchase an oven for his wife's business to sell bread and other baked goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola makes women’s aprons that she sells in Oruro and Potosí; her husband is a taxi driver in La Paz. These two activities are the principle sources of income that support their two children. The family lives in the Puente Topater area of La Paz City.

The loan she needs is to buy another vehicle, the source of her husband’s income, as the current vehicle does not always work and is no longer suitable.

This is the fourth loan from Impro, and the evaluation qualifies her for the loan. They have been Impro clients since 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Fabiola, es confeccionista de mandiles para cholitas, que comercializa en el departamento de Oruro y Potosí; el esposo es transportista de servicio publico trabaja de Taxi en la ciudad La Paz. Estas dos actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con las que cubren la manutención de sus dos hijos. La familia vive en la Ciudad de La Paz, Zona Puente Topater.

El crédito requiere para comprar otra movilidad, fuente de trabajo del esposo ya que la movilidad con la que cuenta actualmente se encuentra muy deficiente y no trabaja continuamente.

Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Fabiola. Ellos son clientes de IMPRO desde al año 2004.

loans.use: Purchase another vehicle so her husband can continue working as a taxi driver.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Señora Maria lives with her one year old daughter in two rooms of a house in the San Pedro zone of La Paz city. Maria works as an administrator in a law office. The two rooms that she rents need to be equipped with minimal comforts to provide a sufficient home for Maria and her daughter. The loan will be used to install water and a sewage system in their house. This is the first time that Maria has asked for a loan and her credit report proves that she is well qualified. This loan is part of our Housing program in the Basic Services sector.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria vive en dos ambientes de su propiedad en la zona de San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. Con su hija de un año. La señora Maria es empleada en un bufete de abogados realizando trámites en el área legal. Las dos habitaciones que adquirió, necesitan ser acondicionadas para brindarle a ella y a su hija de una vivienda con las comodidades mínimas. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la instalación de agua y alcantarillado en su domicilio. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Este crédito será parte de nuestro programa de Vivienda en el Sector de Servicios Básicos.

loans.use: Cover the costs of installing water and plumbing in her home.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Señora Veronica owns her home in the Pasankeri zone, on the west side of the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband, Francisco Quispe, and their five year old son, Juan. Veronica works as a weaver at a microbusiness in her area, and her husband is a carpenter at a workshop in the Sopocachi zone. Veronica will use the loan to purchase materials to build a bathroom in their home. This is her fifth loan with Impro and her good credit history has qualified her for another. Veronica is a long-standing client of Kiva, as she has received a previous loan and paid it back in its entirety.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Verónica vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ubicado en la ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Francisco Quispe y su hijo Juan de cinco años, la señora Veronica trabaja como tejedora en una microempresa de su zona y el esposo es carpintero empleado en un taller de la zona de Sopocachi. Con el anterior crédito la señora realizo la compra de parte de los materiales para la construcción de un baño. El destino del crédito ira a la construcción de un baño. Esta es la quinta ocasión que se beneficia con un crédito en Impro y sus antecedentes y el análisis crediticio la califican para poder acceder al préstamo. Verónica es cliente antiguo de Kiva, pues recibió un crédito anterior el cual ya ha sido cancelado en su totalidad.

loans.use: Cover the costs of building a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Santa Cecilia

texts.en:
Santa Cecilia is forty years old and the proud mother of a five-year-old boy. Santa Cecilia is a multifaceted and experienced entrepreneur. She sells women’s clothing and operates a beauty parlor in the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal, where she cuts, dyes, and straightens hair, and gives manicures and pedicures.

The entrepreneur plans on using her loan to buy a new armchair with a manicure basin. She’ll also buy some nail brushes and manicure products.

Santa Cecilia explains that her big dream is to open a primary school for the children of her community. She has a degree in Primary Education and would like to help low-income families by giving their children a chance to attend primary school.

loans.use: To buy a chair and manicure products for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy window curtains, clothing, and other goods for resale.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
When Luisa started her business a year ago, she was not certain about its future. At that time, she didn’t have access to capital, and she had invested all her money buying stock.

Fortunately, she received a loan from FSMA that allowed her to increase and diversify her inventory and move her business forward. Currently, Luisa offers a large selection of sheets, curtains, and shoes to buyers in the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal.

Luisa explains that her business helps her to keep her four children in school. The entrepreneur hopes that if her business continues to grow, she’ll be able to buy her own house someday.

loans.use: To bed linens, window curtains, and other goods for resale

loans.name: Zuleida

texts.en:
Zuleida is in her late thirties and has five children (four girls and one boy), three of whom go to school. Zuleida has been selling window curtains, tablecloths, and baby clothes in the Trinitarios community of San Cristobal. The entrepreneur explains that she has a lot of experience selling these products, and that she’s very good at persuading people to buy.

Zuleida is also a very responsible person. She’s taken out two loans from FSMA in the past, and she repaid them on time.

She’d like to see her business grow and to be very profitable. She’s requesting more funds to baby clothes in bulk and increase her stock. Zuleida says she’ll keep working hard in to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy window curtains, baby clothes, and other goods for resale.

loans.name: Yajaira Altagracia

texts.en:
Yajaira Altagracia, an ambitious and hard-working woman, lives in the Trinitarios community of San Cristobal, where she runs a small store. She has two daughters and one son, all of them toddlers. Yajaira’s husband works for a construction company.

Yajaira says that two years ago she started a business selling makeup, perfumes, deodorants, body lotions, and the like. Until now, the entrepreneur has run the business from home, but she plans on saving money so that she can rent a store front soon.

With her loan, Yajaira will expand and diversify her stock to attract new clients. The entrepreneur wants to have enough money to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy perfume, makeup, and lotions for resale.

loans.name: Yluminada

texts.en:
Yluminada is an ambitious entrepreneur who owns and operates a small grocery store in the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal. She also prepares breakfast and lunch for people in her community. She explains that her husband is very helpful and attends to the customers at the grocery store when she is busy cooking and selling her delicious Dominican dishes. Yluminada’s businesses pay for her children’s school fees.

She will use the loan to buy rice, flour, vegetable oil, and the like. Yluminada wants to keep working hard for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients used in a catering business and stock for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Clara

texts.es:
Maria Clara started selling food in the central park of San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango, in the year 2000. Maria Clara also sales perfumes, fragrances and cosmetics from home, which she sells through catalogues. Maria Clara’s dream is to inves on her businesses in order to generate enough capital to continue her studies in Information Technology, after that she wants to dedicate her time on development projects in her community, and thus help many people.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Clara inicio su negocio de venta de comida en el parque central de San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango, en el año 2000. También tiene una venta de perfumería y cosméticos en su casa, lo cual vende a través de catálogos. Ella tiene el sueño de invertir en sus negocios y tener bastante capital, para continuar sus estudios como licenciada en Informática y Computación, después de eso ella quiere dedicarse a hacer proyectos de desarrollo en su comunidad, y así ayudar a muchas personas.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her restaurant

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is 47 years and married with six children.  He has been teaching for 23 years with very meager salary.  With the meager salary, Alfred could not save enough to build a house for the family, pay school fees and other family expenses.  Alfred said that he is getting old but still living in a rented house which is very dangerous for his family.  With the little savings, Alfred started construction of the family house but could not finish due to lack money.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $350 to purchase doors, windows and cement to complete construction of the family house.  He will repay his loan from his monthly salary.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to complete the construction of his family house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Virginia Iveth

texts.es:
Virginia Iveth sells shoes, she has been in this business sector for 7 years. Virginia is a single mother, and she has a daughter who goes to school. Virginia has a small retail space, where she leaves a person in charge while she goes to the field to other regions of Guatemala, and reaches various markets where she manages to sell the merchandise. Virginia’s dream is to sale more shoes and therefore be able to generate profits so she can invest in buying mor shoes. Virginia’s goal is to have five retail shoe stores, whether in permanent or walking markets.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia Iveth, se dedica al negocio de venta de zapatos, lleva 7 años en el comercio; es madre soltera, tiene una hija la cuál tiene estudiando, tiene un su local pequeñito, en donde deja a una persona encargada y ella también sale a vender a los departamentos de Guatemala, se va a los mercados donde de sol a sol, logra vender su mercadería. Su sueño es alcanzar una mayor productividad de venta de zapatos, para poder generar ganancias en donde ella pueda invertir más en zapatos. Quiere llegar a tener 5 locales o ventas de zapatos, ya sea en mercados cantonales o ambulantes.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise (shoes)

loans.name: Maria Angelina

texts.es:
For more than 10 years Angelina has been selling “comales.” (Comales are brick stones that are used to make tortillas.) With this business she supports her household, she has 4 children; her husband left for the United States to work.

She learned this business from her mother. She sells the comales in her local market and also from her home, and people seek her out because they are aware of her business. She wants to take advantage of the summer season (dry season in Guatemala), to invest in her business, because in winter or rainy season this product is much more expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Angelina se ha dedicado por mas de 10 años a la comercialización de cómales. (los cómales son planchas de barro cocido que sirven para la elaboración de tortillas) Con este negocio ella mantiene su hogar, tiene 4 hijos, su esposo se fue hace varios años a los Estados Unidos a trabajar.

Este negocio ella lo aprendió de su madre, los cómales los vende en el mercado de la localidad, y también en su casa, a Ella la buscan varias personas que saben de su negocio. Quiere aprovechar la época de verano (tiempo seco en Guatemala), para invertir en su negocio, ya que en la época de invierno o lluvia se encarece este product.

loans.use: Purchase comales.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FAPE - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela sells fresh vegetables in the San Martin Jilotepeque Chimaltenango market. She buys the vegetables wholesale and then sells them individually. She has had this business since she was a girl, inheriting it from her mother. Her husband died 17 years ago, and with this business she has supported her 4 children, all of whom study. She also raises pigs, which she buys when they are little and then sells them.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Adela se dedica a la venta verduras frescas en el mercado de San Martin Jilotepeque Chimaltenango, ella compra esas verduras al por mayor y las vende por unidades. Ella se ha dedicado a este negocio desde que era niña, lo heredo de su madre. Su esposo murió hace 17 años, y con su negocio ha salido adelante con sus 4 hijos, todos ellos estudian. En su cada también se dedica a la crianza de marranos, los cuales compra pequeños y luego vende.

loans.use: Invest in buying vegetables

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FAPE - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: Foday is 28 years old and a school drop out.  He is married with 2 children.  With his previous loan from SMT and some savings, he purchased a motorbike and provides transport service to the public.  To expand his business, he would like to purchase another motorbike and hire another rider to generate more income.  He has saved money from his profit and he is requesting a loan of $300 to add on to purchase the motorbike.

loans.use: To add on his savings and to purchase a second motorbike.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sabina Guicoy

texts.es:
Sabina has been raising, feeding and selling pigs since she was 15 years old. She is now 53 years old. She is single but has a 30 year old son, who she successfully raised by herself thanks to her business.

She buys pigs from different neighbors and friends when they are two months old, she raises and feeds them, and when they are 6 months old she sells them in the local market or larger meat market. Nevertheless, many people look for her to purchase her pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Sabina se ha dedicado a la crianza, engorde y venta de marranos desde cuando ella tenia 15 años. Ella tiene ahora 53 años. Ella es soltera, pero tiene un hijo de 30 años de edad, el cual ella sola saco adelante gracias a su negocio.

Ella compra los marranos con diferentes vecinos y amigos cuando tienen 2 meses de tamaño, los cuida y alimenta, para cuando llegan a los 6 meses, los vende en el mercado de la localidad o ferias; sin embargo, muchas personas la buscan para comprarle sus marranos.

loans.use: Sell pigs.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FAPE - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is 25 years old and married.  She sells cotton materials in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  With her previous loans from SMT, Fatmata was able to purchase the materials in cash and on wholesale,enabling her to generate good income.  Fatamata now owns 75% of the business and she would like to continue building her own capital from the profit.   She is therefore requesting a loan of $350 to increase her stock of cotton materials and to build her capital..

loans.use: To increase her stock of cotton materials and to build her capital.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Mariam N’KASSAÏ was born on December 31, 1970 in Sokodé in central Togo. She is married and the mother of eight children, who all go to school regularly. She has been in the charcoal business since 1998. She usually stocks up during the season of plenty and sells in times of shortages. The first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy thirty bags of charcoal in the village of Assrama and to sell them to middle-men in Lomé. Thus, she will be able to help her husband support their children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame N’KASSAÏ Mariam est née le 31 décembre 1970 à Sokodé dans la région centrale du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants qui fréquentent tous. Elle exerce le commerce de charbon de bois depuis 1998. Elle a l’habitude de faire le stock en saison d’abondance et de les vendre au temps de pénurie. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter trente (30) sacs de charbon de bois dans le village d’Assrama et de les revendre aux semi-grossistes à Lomé. Ainsi elle pourra aider son mari à supporter les charges de leurs enfants.

loans.use: To buy and sell charcoal

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Kouwatinm

texts.fr:
Kouwatinm N. was born on November 6, 1965 in Lomé. She got married to Yendoukoua NAHABE, who is a door-to-door real estate salesman in Lomé. Because her husband lacks a steady income, she helps him to cover family expenses. She sells charcoal, tomatoes, and onions in the Agoè marketplace. This business that she began in 1998 brings her an acceptable return and enables her to withstand the rough competition in the charcoal market. The first loan she is requesting will allow her to procure a supply of ten bags of charcoal and one bag of onions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame N. Kouwatinm est née le 06 novembre 1965 à Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à Monsieur NAHABE Yendoukoua qui est un démarcheur immobilier à Lomé. Le revenu de ce dernier étant irrégulier, madame N. l’aide dans les dépenses familiales. Elle est revendeuse de charbon de bois, de tomates et d’oignons dans le marché d’Agoè. Cette activité qu’elle a commencée depuis 1998 lui procure un bénéfice acceptable et lui permet de résister à la rude concurrence qui est sur le marché de charbon de bois. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire l’approvisionnement de dix (10) sacs de charbons de bois et d’un sac d’oignons.

loans.use: Commerce in charcoal and onions

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald and his grandfather have a workshop where they fix automobile brakes. The workshop is Ronald’s principal source of income, enabling him to support his mother and pay for his university classes. His home is in the Nueva Jerusalén zone of El Alto in Rió Seco. Ronald is asking for a loan to buy a machine for his workshop, an arch to weld compressors. The loan will also contribute to purchasing raw materials. This is Ronald's first loan with Impro, whose evaluation resulted in Ronald’s credit approval.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Ronald (quien trabaja con su abuelo), tiene un taller de servicio de Frenos y Cambio de Balatas de movilidades. El taller es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre sus estudios universitarios y ayuda económicamente a su madre. Su domicilio es en la ciudad de El Alto Zona Nueva Jerusalén – Rió Seco. Ronald solicita crédito para comprar una herramienta de trabajo, es decir, un arco para soldar compresora, el monto también esta destinado para materia prima. Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada determina la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Ronald.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his shop.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina, in her late sixties, is an entrepreneur with a great deal of experience. She’s been selling shoes, boots, and pants for more than twenty years. Six months ago, Alina received her second loan from FSMA, and she used it to increase her inventory. “My efforts and sacrifices were not in vain. My business is very profitable, so I feel like a million dollars," she says smiling.

Alina says she’ll never stop thanking the Kiva community for giving her the opportunity to make that slow but sure change in her life.

With this third loan, Alina will buy more clothing and add new items to her stock so that she can satisfy her customers’ needs and attract more people to her business. Alina wants to have enough money to enjoy her last days in comfort and security.

loans.use: To increase and diversify clothing inventory.

loans.name: Ana Maria Lisette

texts.es:
Miss Flor de Maria is a member of Mujeres Talentosas (“Talented Women”) Community Bank, located at Jr. Salaverry 597, Calleri District, Ucayali Province. She is 21 years old, single, and with insufficient income to meet her living expenses.

With the first loan of approximately $110 from Manuela Ramos, Ana Maria opened a small grocery store. Her store has grown since, selling cold soft drinks as well. In the mornings, she leaves early to work at her job, in the afternoons she runs her grocery store, and in the evenings she studies. With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to purchase soft drinks, candies, and other general items of grocery to sell in her store.

Ana Maria is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the support they provide in the running of her business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Flor de Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry 597, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 21 años, es soltera, el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, Ana María con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido, también vende bebidas heladas, en las mañanas sale temprano a trabajar, por las tardes atiende su negocio y en las noches va a estudiar. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: gaseosas, golosinas, y abarrotes en general. Ana María esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos, por todo el apoyo que le dan para implementar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Mrs Amelia is a member of Las Orquideas Community Bank, located at Jr. Lieutenant Clavero 149, Calleri District, Ucayali Province. She is 57, widowed and has six children.

With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for approximately $110, Amelia opened a small sewing and alterations workshop, as a result of which she has improved her life. After her domestic chores in the mornings, Amelia works in her workshop in the afternoons on her customers’ orders.

With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to purchase: quantities of textile and fabrics, threads of different colors, elasticated materials, zippers, buttons, etc., as it is very important to her to feel more independent, making her happier and more secure within herself.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Amelia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en el Jr. Teniente Clavero 149, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años es madre de 6 hijos, es viuda.
