Amelia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño taller de costura. En la actualidad con su taller de costura esta saliendo adelante, por las mañanas realiza sus labores domesticas, y en las tardes se dedica a confeccionar sus prendas que le piden sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: telas por metros, hilos de diferentes colores, elásticos, blondas, cierres, botones, etc. Para ella es muy importante sentirse mas independiente, eso la hace muy feliz y mas segura de si misma.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics, threads, etc. for the business

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo is a taxi driver with four children. Three of them are completely independent, the fourth daughter is finishing her IT studies in UMSA and she lives with her parents in El Alto, Zona Villa Exaltación.

The microloan will be used to cover the cost of his daughter´s thesis so she can graduate with a BS in IT and be able to work in her profession.

This is his sixth credit with Impro, the evaluation performed supports the approval of the microcredit.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Education

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Amina

texts.es:
Mrs Amina is a member of the Shipibas Community Bank, located at Tarapaca Jr., block 5 of the Calleri district, Ucayali Province. She is 21 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a dental technician but his income is not sufficient to support the entire family. Consequently, using the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for approximately $110, Amina began buying and selling dental products. Now she owns a shop selling such products. She gets up at 7 am to prepare breakfast for her husband and children, after which she works in her shop until 8 pm.

With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to purchase dental equipment and products to add to her shop's product range. Amina is very happy that her business is growing and its sales is increasing, enabling them to provide better education and future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Amina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr Tarapacá cuadra 5 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 21 años, es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es Técnico Dental, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanza para su economía familiar, es así que Amina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de materiales dentales. En la actualidad ella cuenta un puesto de venta de materiales dentales, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo luego se dedica a la atención de su negocio hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará equipos y materiales dentales para implementar su negocio. Amina esta muy feliz, su negocio esta creciendo sus ventas aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para darles una buena educación y futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase a wider range of products for sale

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Ms. Alicia is a member of Mujeres Talentosas (“Talented Women”) Community Bank, located at Jr. June 7 649, Calleri District, Ucayali Province. She is 51 years old, married, and is the mother of five children. Her husband is an oil worker but his income is not sufficient to support the entire family. Consequently, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for approximately $110, Alicia opened a small business selling hardware products. Now, with the profits she made from that small business, she owns her own hardware store that she runs with assistance from her children. Amelia has always enjoyed working as it makes her feel more active and content.

With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to purchase: light bulbs, electric wires and cables, faucets, nails, handsaws, rakes, racks, etc.

Alicia is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the assistance with the loans and the great support offered to all Peruvian women.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Alicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. 7 de Junio 649, D. Distrito de Calleria D. Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años, es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es técnico en petróleo, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Alicia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña ferretería. En la actualidad con las ganancias obtenidas, tiene un local donde ahora puede vender sus productos, con la ayuda de sus hijos atiende el negocio, siempre le gusto trabajar, eso la hace sentirse mas activa y feliz. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: focos, cables, grifos, clavos, serruchos, rastrillos, perchas, etc. Alicia esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todas las facilidades con los prestamos y el gran apoyo que le brinda a todas las mujeres D. Perú.

loans.use: To purchase a wider range of products for sale

loans.name: Emma Aurora

texts.es:
Emma belongs to the “Mujeres Talentosas” (Talented Women) community bank, located in market No. 2 of the Calleria district, in Ucayali. She is 49 years old, has 2 children and is separated. With the first loan of S/. 300 received from Manuela Ramos, Emma decided to invest it for the small sale of regional fruits and vegetables.

Now she has a sales stand in market No. 2 in our city, she gets up very early to go to her sales stand, because her clients start going early to buy her products, in the evenings she stays home with her children.

With this loan of S/. 2,000, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy regional fruits like: papaya, orange, tangerine, bread fruit, corn, coriander, bananas, etc.

Emma feels great now that she has her own capital to work with and support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Emma pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Mercado N° 2, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años, es madre de 2 hijos, es separada. Emma con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta de frutas y verduras regionales.

En la actualidad tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado N° 2 de nuestra ciudad, se levanta muy temprano para ir a su puesto, ya que sus caseros acuden desde tempranas horas a comprar sus productos, en las tardes se dedica a su hogar y sus hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará frutas regionales, como: papaya, naranja, mandarina, pan de árbol, choclo, culantro, plátanos, etc.

Emma se siente muy bien, ahora tiene su propio capital con el cual puede trabajar mas tranquila y puede sacar a sus hijos adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her fruits and vegetables sales stand.

loans.name: Edith Adelaida

texts.es:
Edith belongs to “Las Almendras” (The Almonds) community bank, located in 323 Jr. Manco Capac, in the district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 64 years old, mother of 3 children, widowed, but the income she makes is not enough for her everyday financial needs. What Edith did with the first loan of S/. 300 received from Manuela Ramos was to invest it in a small stand to sell bananas.

Nowadays, she constantly travels in her boat through the Ucayali river to buy her bananas and sell them in the city.

With this loan of S/. 1,000 which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy gas for her boat and some supplies for the trip.

With the loans provided Edith has done better in her business, it's a big help that also makes her feel good and be a women that can get through with the support of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Edith pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el Jr. Manco Capac 323, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 64 años, es madre D. 3 hijos, es viuda, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Adith con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño puesto D. venta D. plátanos.

En la actualidad viaja constantemente a su chacra que tiene por las riberas del rió Ucayali para traer sus plátanos los y venderlos en la ciudad .

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: gasolina para su bote y algunos víveres que llevo para poder ir a traer sus frutas.

Edith con los prestamos recibidos esta surgiendo, prosperando con su negocio, y es una ayuda muy granD. que le brindan para sentirse bien y ser una mujer que aun pueD. salir adelante con el apoyo D. Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Buy gas for her boat to travel to buy fruit for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth belongs to “Las Orquideas” (The Orchids) community bank, located at 460 Jr. Antonio Maya de Britto, in the district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 41 years old, mother of 2 children, her husband is a mechanic, the income she makes is not enough for her everyday financial needs. With the first loan of S/.300 received from Manuela Ramos she invested it in a small business to buy and sell spare parts.

Now she has a store that sells spare parts, and with the loans received she has been able to expand her store to offer more products and increase her income, with the support of her husband the business is getting ahead.

With this S/. 800 loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: spare parts for motorcycles and “motocarros” (small three-wheeled carts).

Elizabeth feels proud of her accomplishments, based in a lot of effort and dedication to offer a better future to her children and family.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en el Jr. Antonio Maya de Britto 460, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es mecánico, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Elizabeth con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de repuestos.

En la actualidad tiene una tienda de venta de repuestos, con los prestamos recibidos esta ampliando mas su local para poder ofrecer mas productos y así sus ingresos aumenten, con el apoyo de su esposo están sacando adelante sus negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: repuestos en general de motos y motocarros.

Elizabeth se siente muy orgullosa de todo lo que esta logrando, a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo belongs to “Las Almendras” (The Almonds) community bank, located at 323 Jr. Manco Capac, in the district of Calleria, in Ucayali. She is 43 years old, has one children, she is separated. With the first S/. 300 loan from Manuela Ramos Consuelo decided to set up a small stand selling typical food.

She sells food outside her house every day; starting at 5 p.m. she fires up the charcoal and starts grilling bananas and meat that will later be consumed by clients that love her food.

With this S/. 1,000 loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy rice, eggs, sugar, oil, vegetables, spices, meat, etc.

Consuelo is very thankful with Manuela Ramos for providing support to all women, specially single moms, who look to provide for a better future to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Consuelo pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el Jr. Manco Capac 323, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años, tiene 1 hijo, es separada. Consuelo con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño puesto de venta de comidas típicas.

En la actualidad vende sus comidas en la puerta de su casa todos los días a partir de las 5 de la tarde atiza su carbón y empieza a asar sus plátanos y carnes que mas luego serán consumidos por sus clientes que gustan mucho de su rica comida.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: arroz, huevos, azúcar, aceite, verduras, condimentos, carnes, etc

Consuelo esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por brindar apoyo a todas las mujeres en especial a las madres solteras, que buscan darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to make food for sale

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica belongs to the “Mujeres Talentosas” (Talented Women) community bank, located in Santa Rosa of the Calleria district, in Ucayali. She is 20 years old and single. With the first S/. 300 loan received from Manuela Ramos she decided to use it to buy and sell clothing.

Her clothing store is one of the most visited in our area, because of the latest trends that can be found and exclusive designs that only Jessica's good taste can select. During the day she goes to the store with the help of her mom, and in the evening she studies to keep preparing as a professional and successful woman.

With this S/. 2,000 loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she plans to purchase clothing such as pants, skirts, tops, dresses, jewelry, hair accessories, bracelets, all from exclusive designs.

Jessica is very happy to belong to the community bank, because thanks to the loans she gets she is expanding her business and works without worries.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Jessica pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en la galería Santa Rosa, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 20 años, es soltera, es así que Jessica con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de ropas.

En la actualidad su puesto de venta que es uno de los mas visitados de nuestra región, por lo ultimo de la moda que se puede encontrar y modelos exclusivos que solo el buen gusto de Jessica puede tener. En las mañanas atiende su puesto con la ayuda de su mamá y en las noches se va estudiar para seguir creciendo como profesional y mujer exitosa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ropas como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, vestidos, alhaja, accesorios para el cabello, pulseras, todo de modelos exclusivos.

Jessica esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que por medio de los préstamos que recibe esta haciendo crecer su negocio y trabaja con tranquilidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for clothing store

loans.name: Wendy Amarilis

texts.en:
Wendy Amarilis, an ambitious entrepreneur and a proud single mother of a school-age boy, is doing her best to provide a better lifestyle for her family through hard work.

She recently got a degree in Basic Education and wants to become a primary school teacher soon. Meanwhile, Wendy is selling her fashionable earrings, bracelets, shoes, and bedspreads to people in her community. Wendy has taken out two loans with our organization, and she repaid them on time. Wendy plans to use her new loan to increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase custom jewelry, shoes, and other items

loans.name: Jenny Flor

texts.es:
Jenny Flor belongs to the “Nuestra Senora de La Esperanza” (Our Lady of Hope) community bank, located at 224 Jr. Apurimac, in the district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 37 years old, has 2 children, she is separated. Jenny invested her first S/. 300 loan from Manuela Ramos in a small store.

Her store has grown, she started with very few items but managed the loans received very well. She works the store with the help of her children, and during night she talks to them a lot because she likes knowing how their studies are going.

With this loan of S/.1,100, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy items such as rice, sugar, milk, soap, canned food, pop, etc.

Jenny feels happy, since he received her first loan her income has grown and she has grown as a business woman as well.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jenny Flor pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuestra Señora de La Esperanza, ubicado en el Jr. Apurimac 224, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años es madre de 2 hijos, es separada. Jenny con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido, empezó con muy pocos productos, y con los prestamos recibidos supo administrarlos muy bien, con la ayuda de sus hijos atienen la bodega, y por las noches conversa muchos con ellos para saber como le esta yendo en sus estudios.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,100, el cual será pagado en 4 meses ,comprará abarrotes: como arroz, azúcar, leche, jabón, conservas, gaseosas, etc.

Jenny se siente muy contenta, desde que recibió su primer préstamo hasta ahora esta aumentando sus ganancias y creciendo como mujer empresaria

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for store

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica is a member of the Our Lady of Hope Community Bank, which is located at Mz K Lt. 2 in the Las Palmas subdivision of the Calleria District, in the state of Ucayali. She is 36 years old and has four children. Her husband is a factory worker.

Jessica decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300 soles (approximately $110) in the sale of candies and braided items. She currently uses the money she earns from her business to pay for her children’s education and give them a better life. With their help, the business is successful. Jessica gets up very early to do her daily household chores and later does her studies and work.

With this loan of 1,500 soles (approximately $550), which will be paid back in four months, Jessica will purchase items for children and teenagers such as necklaces, song books, bracelets, stickers, collectable cards and hair clips. Jessica feels very accomplished. Manuela Ramos has provided tremendous support. Thanks to these loans her business is growing and Jessica feels more fulfilled as a mother and wife.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Jessica pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuestra Señora de La Esperanza, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Las Palmas Mz. K Lt. 2,del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es obrero.

Jessica con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de golosinas y pasamanería. En la actualidad con las ganancias obtenidas de la venta de sus productos, puede educar a sus hijos, darles una mejor vida, con la ayuda de ellos esta saliendo adelante, se levanta muy temprano para realizar las labores domesticas y de ahí ir a estudiar y trabajar. .

Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará artículos que le gustan a los niños y jóvenes como: collares, cancioneros, pulseras, stikers, laminas, binchas, etc. Jessica se siente bien trabajabdo con Manuela Ramos es un apoyo bien grande, a través de estos prestamos su negocio esta creciendo y se siente mas realizada como madre y mujer.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de Maria is a member of the Las Dalilas (The Delilahs) Community Bank, which is located at Jr. Manuel Escorza 986 in the Calleria District, in the state of Ucayali. She is 31 years old and has two children. Her husband drives a motor car.

Flor de Maria decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300 soles (approximately $110) in a small business selling chilled soft drinks. She currently sells the drinks out of her home and splits her time between her business and her household chores. She always wanted to establish a business. She was able to do it thanks to the opportunity Manuela Ramos gave her. She now feels more at peace and can pay for her children’s education.

With this loan of 1,800 soles (approximately $675), which will be paid back in four months, Flor de Maria will purchase soft drinks and candies. She will also use part of the loan for upkeep of her motorcar. The loans Flor de Maria has received from her community bank provide support for her and her family. Because of this support her income is increasing and she enjoys financial stability.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Flor de Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalilas, ubicado en el Jr. Manuel Escorza 986, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años, es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista.

Flor de Maria con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta de bebidas heladas. En la actualidad ella vende sus bebidas heladas en su casa, comparte la atención de su negocio con las tareas domesticas, siempre quiso poner un negocio gracias a la oportunidad que le dio Manuela Ramos pudo hacerlo y se siente mas tranquila y puede educar a sus hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: gaseosas, golosinas, y una parte lo destinara al mantenimiento de su motocarro. Flor de María con los prestamos que recibe de su banco comunal son con un apoyo para ella y su familia, gracias a ello sus ingresos aumentan y goza de una estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Willca Calixta De

texts.es:
Calixta and her husband own their home, where they live with their three children, ages 14, 8, and 3. The two older children attend public school. Calixta sells cosmetics and home remedies and her husband works as a bus driver. Calixta has two carts that she uses to display a variety of cosmetics and home remedies, usually at the bus stop.

Calixta has been in this business for 10 years, and is now competent her field. However, her success is also dependent on the success of her husband in his respective field and above all their joint work at the bus stop. Calixta will buy shampoo, perfumes, soaps, lanterns, and home remedies in bulk and then sell them individually. This is her 12th loan from the Fundación and she and her husband have proven themselves to be responsible people and punctual in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Calixta y su esposo cuentan con un domicilio propio, tienen tres hijos de 14, 8, y 3 años respectivamente, actualmente los dos mayores estan estudiando en una escuela fiscal. Calixta se dedica al comercio de cosméticos y chiflería y su esposo se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su vagoneta en Montero. calixta cuenta con dos carritos donde tiene un surtido de productos de cosméticos y chiflería, generalmente se ubica en las paradas de los micros para poder vender, ella realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 10 años atras. Existe competencia en el rubro, sin embargo el éxito se concentra en la experiencia que ambos tienen en sus respectivos rubros y sobre todo su consolidación frente a la parada de micros. Calizta comprará shampoo, perfumes, jaboncillos, linternas y demás artículos de chiflería, estos los comprará por docenas para venderlos por unidad. Este es el 12avo crédito en la Fundación y en este tiempo de trabajo demostraron ser personas responsables y puntuales en sus pagos.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy cosmetic supplies

loans.name: Liliana Milagros

texts.es:
Liliana is a member of the Our Lady of Hope Community Bank, which is located at Jr. Apurimac 181 in the Calleria District, in the state of Ucayali. She is 41 years old and has two children. Liliana is separated from her husband.

Liliana’s income is not sufficient to cover her daily expenses. That’s why she decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300 soles (approximately $110) in buying and selling clothing and other merchandise. She continues to operate her merchandise business by constantly traveling to deliver her products. Liliana’s female clients generally order these goods and trust in Liliana’s good judgment.

With this loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $375), which will be paid back in four months, Jessica will purchase clothing, shoes, jewelry, sheets, picture frames, watches, etc. Jessica is glad for the support Manuela Ramos gives to her and other women in order to continue their work.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Liliana pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuestra Señora de La Esperanza, ubicado en el Jr. Apurimac 181, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años es madre de 2 hijos, es separada, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Liliana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de mercaderías. En la actualidad continua con su negocio de mercadería, para ello ella viaja constantemente para traer sus productos, que generalmente son pedidos de sus clientas que confían en el buen gusto que tiene Liliana.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: ropas, zapatos, joyas, sabanas, portarretratos, relojes, etc. Liliana esta contenta por el apoyo que le brindan a las mujeres Manuela Ramos para poder continuar con nuestros trabajos.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise for sale

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia knew Omnilife when she was sick. Omnilife is a business that produces beverages, energy and nutrition supplements. A friend told her about these products and that is how she became a client. Lidia began to recommend the products and then she began selling them to family and friends. Four years have passed and Lidia continues with this business that has served her to pay for family expenses. The loans that she has requested will help Lidia to continue to invest and therefore purchase more Omnilife products.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Lidia conoció Omnilife cuando estuvo enferma. Omnilife es una empresa que se dedica a la producción de bebidas y suplementos nutricionales y energéticos. Una amiga le comentó sobre esta marca y fue así que se hizo cliente de estos productos. Ella empezó a recomendarlos y luego empezó a venderlos dentro de su familia y amigos. Ya han pasado 4 años y ella sigue manteniendo este negocio que le ha servido para ayudar en los gastos familiares. Los préstamos que ella ha solicitado han servido para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de productos Omnilife.

loans.use: To purchase more Omnilife products

loans.name: Jossary Paola

texts.es:
Jossary is a member of the Las Almendras (The Almonds) Community Bank, which is located at Jr. Salaverry 171 in the Calleria District, in the state of Ucayali. She is 21 years old and single.

Jossary decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300 soles (approximately $110) in a small pastry business. Her business has grown and she now has more orders than ever thanks to the finishing touches and decoration she puts on each of her cakes, which she makes for any occasion: birthday, weddings, quinceñería (celebration of girl’s 15th birthday), etc. In the evenings Jossary studies at the university. She is thinking of using the profits from her business to expand her business and continue growing as an entrepreneur.

With this loan of 700 soles (approximately $275), which will be paid back in five months, Jossary will purchase materials and ingredients for her business such as: molds, decorating tools, cake layers and cake frames. Jossary loves the group she has formed with other women from her community bank and is very thankful for all Manuela Ramos’s support.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señorita Jossary pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry 171, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 21 años, es soltera.

Jossary con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño negocio de repostería. En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido, atiende mas pedidos que antes, por el buen acabado y decoración que utiliza en cada una de sus tortas, para cualquier compromiso como cumpleaños, matrimonios, 15 años, etc. Por las noches estudia en la universidad con las ganancias obtenidas esta pensando en ampliar mas su negocio y seguir creciendo como empresaria.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará materiales e insumos para su negocio como: moldes, decoradores, pisos y armazones. Jossary esta muy a gusto con el grupo que han formado con su banco comunal y esta muy agradecida por todo el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and ingredients for her products

loans.name: Juana Leon

texts.es:
Mrs Juana belongs to the community bank Las Orquídeas, located in the street Alfonso Ugarte Cdra 7, in the district of Calleria, county of Ucayali.

She is 34 years old and has 1 child. Her husband is a carpenter. However, his income is not sufficient for the daily needs of the family. That is why Juana has decided to invest the fist loan of 300 S. she received from Manuela Ramos into a small clothes shop.

At the moment, she has a stand in the market of Bellavista. She arrives there very early in the morning to open the shop and to serve her customers. In the afternoon, she takes care of the household and her little child.

With this loan of 1,700 S that she will reimburse in 4 months she will buy clothes like 1 dozen of shirts, 2 dozens of stockings, underwear, etc. Juana feels more serene with the support that Manuela Ramos provides her through their loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Cdra. 7, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali.

Tiene 34 años es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo trabaja en madera, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Juana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta de ropas.

En la actualidad tiene un puesto en el mercado de bellavista, se va muy temprano a su puesto para abrir y atender a sus clientes, por las tardes se dedica a las labores domesticas de su hogar, y atender a su pequeño hijo.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ropas como: 1 docena de polos, 2 docenas de medias, ropas interiores, biviris, etc. Juana se siente mas tranquila con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos a través de los prestamos que recibe.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy more merchandise to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is very enterprising and has always sought for the best ways to improve the well-being of her beloved family. Since some time, she has been using the small income she has to buy firewood. She stores it in her house and later on sells it to her neighbours. She started this business because she got a little baby and wanted to give him attention spending most of her time with him.

Over time, she has increased her income through the sales of the firewood.

In order to improve her business, and in order to make sure that this vital heating source is adequately stored, she has in mind to set up a dedicated storage space.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria, es emprendedora y siempre ha estado en búsqueda de las mejores oportunidades para generar mayor bienestar a su amada familia.

Hace poco se dedica a la venta de leña porque llegó a albergar a su pequeño bebé y requería de mayor tiempo y atención para lo cual el pequeño capital del que disponía fue destinado para comprar leña al por mayor y lo almacena en su casa para luego venderlo poco a poco a sus vecinos, con el tiempo ha visto mejorar sus ingresos.

Desea seguir con su labor y para evitar el deterioro de este indispensable conductor de calor tiene en mente adecuar un espacio de almacenamiento.

loans.use: Set-up of a storage space

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Jessica Vasquez

texts.es:
Jessica belongs to Las Dalilas Communal Bank, located at 1014 Jr. Sucre, in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 24 years old and single, but the income she makes is not enough for daily expenses. For this reason, with her first loan of 300 soles from ManueL. Ramos, Jessica decided to invest a small grocery store. Currently she has a well-stocked general store. Ever since she was a teenager she has liked to work, and she always wanted to open a general store. Some friends told her about ManueL. Ramos, which lends capital to women who want to start their own businesses, and she decided to become part of the ManueL. Ramos family. Now she is able to pay for her studies herself and she feels more independent and is able to help her family. With this loan of 1,000 soles ($375), which she will repay over 4 months, she will purchase sweets, soft drinks, groceries and some braids and tassels for drapes and upholstery. Jessica is at a point in her life where she feels very fulfilled and hopes to continue growing as a business woman and professionally in order to make her parents proud and share her experience with other women.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

L. señorita Jessica pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalilas, ubicado en el Jr. Sucre 1014, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 24 años, es soltera, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Jessica con el primer préstamo recibido D. ManueL. Ramos D. S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta D. abarrotes. En L. actualidad cuenta con una bodega muy surtida, desD. que era adolescente le gusto trabajar, y siempre quería poner una bodega, unas amigas le hablaron D. ManueL. Ramos que presta capital a las mujeres que quieren poner un negocio y decidió ser parte D. esa gran familia y ahora elL. misma paga sus estudios y se siente mas independiente y pueD. ayudar a su familia. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará golosinas, gaseosas, abarrotes y un poco D. pasamanería. Jessica esta en una etapa D. su vida que se siente muy realizada y espera seguir creciendo tanto como mujer empresaria y profesionalmente para ser el orgullo D. sus padres y compartir su experiencia con otras mujeres.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in general store

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
Zulema has a talent for making pastries and cakes, and is helped by her new molds used in the preparation of sweets and various desserts. She leaves at dawn to prepare them in the “bread workshop” in the home of one of her relatives, before leaving to sell them in the streets. She remembers learning this occupation from her beloved father. She would like to improve and put her bakery equipment to use in order to soon have a permanent shop to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Zulema tiene el talento para elaborar pasteles y tortas, ayudada por los novedosos moldes que utiliza para la preparación de dulces y variados postres. Sale de madrugada para poder prepararlos en el taller panadero de uno de sus familiares para después recorrer las calles. Ella recuerda que aprendió esta ocupación de su amado padre. Desea mejorar e implementar sus artículos de repostería para pronto poner un espacio de venta permanente.

loans.use: Installation of a bakery

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José Luis is a young man with a strong desire to succeed. For this reason he has chosen two tasks: to study at a university while at the same time undertaking his own call center business, providing great economic support for his mother who actually started the company for him. His goal is to become a successful professional in order to repay his mother for all of her effort and sacrifice throughout the years. Every day he attends to his business in order to work toward completing his university studies. Now he is asking for a loan to improve his business establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

José Luis, es un joven con muchos deseos de superación es por ello que optó por realizar dos tareas: una de ellas es el de estudiar una carrera universitaria y a la vez auto sostenerse emprendiendo su propio negocio que también es un gran apoyo económico para su mamá que actualmente le hace compañía. Su deseo es convertirse en un profesional de éxito a fin de retribuir a su madre todo el esfuerzo y sacrificio que ha realizado durante estos años. Todos los días se dedica a administrar su negocio para solventar sus estudios universitarios. Ahora desea mejorar sus establecimientos para lo cual solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: To improve a work space.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is very pleased for having made the decision to sell recognized brands of beauty products for the last three years, which for her was a new line of business. Now her market has expanded, as she continually explores new areas that allow her to make substantial earnings. She goes out each morning in search of new horizons while also working part-time as a seamstress. She is seeking a loan to acquire a greater quantity of cosmetics and fabrics at wholesale prices to fortify her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen, está muy contenta por haber tomado una buena decisión. Hace 3 años tuvo la oportunidad de vender productos de belleza de reconocidas marcas para lo cual emprendió lo que para ella era una nueva forma de hacer negocio, ahora su mercado se ha expandido y cada vez explora nuevas zonas de intervención que le permiten obtener mayores ganancias. Sale todas las mañanas en búsqueda de nuevos horizontes y a la vez también dedica parte de su tiempo libre a la costura. Solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de cosméticos y telas al por mayor para el afianzamiento de sus actividades.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and fabrics at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
In one of the main streets of the urban community of Huancayo, you will find Nelly, who exemplifies hard work. She creates deliciously seasoned local dishes by hand. Hoping to improve her sales, Nelly has in mind a project to rent a commercial space, meanwhile continuing to work as she does now. Her loan request is intended to improve her work space and the facilities of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

En una de las calles principales de la comunidad urbana justicia paz y vida verán a una mujer ejemplo y símbolo de trabajo, sus manos y su exquisita sazón dan como resultado platos típicos deliciosos. El deseo de Nelly es mejorar sus ventas y tiene como proyecto en mente arrendar un local comercial, mientras tanto seguirá trabajando de esta manera. Su solicitud de un crédito atiende a la necesidad de mejorar su espacio de trabajo y las instalaciones de su hogar.

loans.use: Implemention of a work space.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad works very hard and with persistence. For many years she worked in the health sector. After she retired and divorced from her husband, she decided to improve the situation of her household.

She sells clothes, handcrafts and sometimes footwear. She would like to increase her income in order to offer a wider variety of products and to set up her own stand soon.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Soledad, es muy trabajadora y empeñosa, durante muchos años ha trabajado en el sector salud, se jubiló y tras la separación de su esposo decide llevar adelante las riendas de su hogar.

Por esa razón no dudó en dedicarse a la venta de prendas de vestir, manualidades y en algunas ocasiones calzados de manera ambulatoria. Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para ofertar mayor cantidad de artículos y pronto establecerse en un espacio propio.

loans.use: To offer a wider variety of products.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Thanks to her long experience in the business, Claudia has become one of the best merchants in her district. Since a very young age, she has worked in multiple employments in order to support her household.

As she now runs a small shop, her life has improved. That is why she would like to move ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Los años de experiencia a Claudia, le sirvieron para convertirse en una de las mejores comerciantes de su zona. Desde muy joven ella se ha acostumbrado a realizar múltiples trabajos para poder sobrellevar las riendas de su hogar.

Ahora que posee una pequeña tiendita las cosas en su casita han mejorado y desea continuar con esta su noble labor.

loans.use: To increase the offer of products

loans.name: Luz Jovita

texts.es:
Mrs Luz Jovita belongs to the community bank Nuestra Señora de La Esperanza, located in Asentamiento Humano Pedro Portillo Mz. I Lt. 25, in the district of Calleria, county of Ucayali.

She is 28 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is a motorbike mechanic. Luz Jovita invested the first loan of 300 S. that she had received from Manuela Ramos in buying a motorbike. With the profit she earned from the first motorbike, she bought another one in order to increase her income. She gets up very early in the morning to take care of her children and the household.

In that way, she contributes to a more stable life for her family. Together with her husband, who always helps her, she works to improve their standard of living.

With this loan of 1,200 S., which will be reimbursed in 4 months, she will invest in the maintenance, the purchase of spare parts and in food for the family. Luz Jovita feels like part of a family at Manuela Ramos. She shares her ideas with the other members of the community bank and always participates in all the events. She feels very good about it.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz Jovita pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuestra Señora de La Esperanza, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Pedro Portillo Mz. I Lt. 25, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali.

Tiene 28 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. Luz Jovita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la inicial de un motocarro. En la actualidad con las ganancias obtenidas de su motocarro compro otro para poder aumentar las ganancias, y así poder tener una vida mas estable y seguir creciendo con la ayuda de su esposo que siempre la apoya, se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus hijos y realizar sus que haceres domésticos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento y en la compra de piezas, y víveres para su hogar. Luz Jovita se siente en familia trabajando con Manuela Ramos, con las socias de su banquito comunal comparte sus ideas y siempre esta participe de todos los acontecimientos y es muy bonito sentirse así.

loans.use: To invest in the maintenance and the purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is a young man who has high hopes of getting ahead and who wants to support his mother and younger siblings. Years ago, his father transferred this metal construction shop to him, and today he offers multiple services, that is to say, both metal and woodwork. With the earnings he receives after a hard day's work, he contributes to sustaining his family. Because of the quality of work that he does, he has contracts for the construction of roofs. He is requesting a loan to be able to acquire a larger quantity of supplies with the goal of fulfilling his orders from his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Carlos, es un joven que tiene muchos deseos de superación y ganas de apoyar a su madre y hermanos menores. Hace años atrás su padre le traspasó este taller de construcciones metálicas en el que hoy ofrece servicios múltiples, es decir trabajos en madera y en metal y con las ganancias que recibe después de una laboriosa jornada de trabajo contribuye con el sostenimiento de su hogar.Por la calidad de sus trabajos tiene contratos de licitaciones para la construcción de techos y carpetas. Solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima a fin de cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire a large quantity of supplies

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia learned to work to achieve a stable economic environment for her family. She fulfills the roles of both mother and father for her three children, and because of them that she dedicates herself to selling beer and liquor both wholesale and retail. She also offers these drinks for social events in the city. She has a tent and chairs that she adapted as a work strategy with the aim of obtaining larger profits. Her wish is to improve and expand her small sales space, and it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Cecilia, aprendió a trabajar para lograr una economía estable. Ella desempeña los roles de padre y madre para sus 3 hijos y es por ellos que se dedica a la venta de cerveza y licores al por mayor y menor, así mismo oferta estas bebidas para los eventos sociales de su ciudad, cuenta con una carpa y sillas que adaptó como una estrategia de trabajo a fin de obtener mayores ganancias.Su deseo es mejorar y ampliar su pequeño espacio de ventas y a esta razón atiende su solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: Implementation of a small sales space

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria and her husband work daily to repair all kinds of metal objects and to construct doors and windows. They work with the single objective of starting a store that sells hardware items.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Victoria y su esposo trabajan diariamente reparando todo tipo de construcciones metálicas y construyendo puertas y ventanas. Laboran con el único objetivo de instalar pronto una tienda de venta de artículos ferreteros.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire a larger quantity of tools

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #48251

loans.name: Lotty Mercedes

texts.es:
Lotty belongs to the Mujeres Talentosas (“Talented Women’s”) Communal Bank. Her business is located at Jr. Tarapaca 399 in the Callería District, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 34 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is a merchant, but his income is not enough to meet the family’s daily needs. It is for this reason that Lotty received her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos, which she decided to invest in constructing retail units to rent out.

With the loans she received and the profits she earned Lotty was able to construct more retail units to rent out. Because of the retail units’ central location, Lotty rented them out very quickly, and they are now thriving businesses that generate more income for her.

Lotty will use this loan of 2,000 Soles ($750) to refurbish her retail units. The loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Lotty feels more independent, and is now able to enjoy the financial stability that she always wanted. She is very happy to provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lotty pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Tarapaca 399, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años, es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Lotty con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la construcción de locales para alquilar.

En la actualidad con los préstamos recibidos y las ganancias obtenidas, pudo construir mas locales para alquilar, por la zona céntrica en que se encuentran sus locales los alquilo rápidos y están funcionando negocios, que le generan mas ingresos económicos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, refaccionara sus locales.

Lotty se siente más independiente, ahora puede gozar de una estabilidad económica que siempre quiso tener, aporta en su hogar y eso la hace muy feliz.

loans.use: Refurbishing her retail units

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy is a young man who wants to establish a source of income without letting himself be caught up by the difficult economic situation that has arisen in his country due to an employment shortage. For this reason he chose to open a telephone and computer room where he offers reception services, domestic and foreign telephone calls, and also Internet access. His goal is to offer wireless Internet and to establish a cafe in that space by which means he would continue to capitalize on his income. He is asking for a loan to buy two computers in order to continue improving his service.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Fredy, es un joven que tiene como ideal establecer su propia fuente de ingreso sin dejarse llevar por la difícil situación económica que se atraviesa en su país por la escasez de empleo. Por esa razón optó por abrir un locutorio para brindar servicios de recepción y llamadas telefónicas dentro y fuera de su país y también Internet.Tiene como meta ofrecer el servicio de Internet inalámbrico y establecer un café en ese espacio para lo cual seguirá capitalizando sus ingresos pero en esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para comprar un par de computadoras para seguir mejorando su servicio.

loans.use: Purchase of two computers.

loans.name: Lucy Smith

texts.es:
Lucy belongs to the Mujeres Talentosas (“Talented Women’s”) Communal Bank. Her business is located in Market No. 2 in the Callería District, in the Department of Ucayali. Lucy is 56 years old and has one son; she is separated from her husband. Lucy received her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos, which she decided to invest in a small general store.

Lucy used the loan she received to purchase a stall in the busiest market in her city. She gets up very early in the morning to make her breakfast and then goes to open her stall. Lucy always serves her customers with much care and graciousness.

Lucy will use this loan of 2,200 Soles ($800) to purchase various items for her business, such as: necklaces, bracelets, earrings, cosmetics, lipstick, hair clips, barrettes, etc. The loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Lucy is doing well, and is very grateful for the loan she received to start her business, and for the lending staff who help her and treat her so well, and who give her advice about her business.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lucy pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Mercado N° 2, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años, es madre de 1 hijo, es separada., es así que Lucy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta de pasamanería.

En la actualidad con los prestamos recibidos adquirió un puesto en el mercado mas concurrido de nuestra ciudad, se levanta muy temprano para preparar su desayuno luego va a abrir su puesto y atender a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y carisma que tiene.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, implementara su negocio con la compra de joyas como: collares, pulseras, artes, cosméticos, carmines, binchas, ganchos, etc.

Lucy se siente muy bien, esta muy agradecida a los prestamos, con los cuales empezó a trabajar, las promotoras las ayudan mucho y las tratan muy bien y sobre todo las orientan en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena belongs to the Mujeres Talentosas (“Talented Women’s”) Communal Bank. Her business is located at Jr. Martir Olaya 113 in the District of Callería, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 47 years old and has 6 children; she and her husband are separated. Lorena received her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos, which she used to buy clothing to sell.

Right now she is continuing with her business of selling clothing, and constantly tries to keep up with the latest fashions so that she can offer her customers the most recent clothes and accessories. Lorena spends her mornings looking after her children and her home. In the afternoons she goes out to purchase and sell more clothing so that she can have capital and generate more income, and thus be able to continue expanding her business.

Lorena will use this loan of 2,000 Soles ($750) to buy polo shirts, shoes, lingerie, trousers, wristwatches, cosmetics, etc. The loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Lorena is very happy with the help she has gotten from Manuela Ramos, since this is a very generous loan she is receiving. She is grateful for this opportunity to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lorena pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Martir Olaya 113, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años, es madre de 6 hijos, es separada, Lorena con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de mercadería.

En la actualidad continua con su negocio de venta de mercadería, viaja constantemente para traer las ultimas novedades y así ofrecer a sus clientes lo ultimo de la moda y accesorios, por las mañanas se dedica a atender su hogar y sus hijos y en las tardes sale a vender y cobrar, para así tener capital y generar mas ingresos y poder seguir creciendo con su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: polos, zapatos, lencería, pantalones, relojes, cosméticos, etc.

Lorena se siente muy feliz en Manuela Ramos, por que es un apoyo grande que recibe, gracias a eso puede salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothing to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mercy Anita

texts.es:
Mercy belongs to the Dalilas Communal Bank. Her business is located at Jr. Las Gaviotas 467 in the Yarina Cocha District, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old and single. Mercy received her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos, which she decided to invest in a small store.

Mercy's store has grown as a result of the loan and because of her wise management of her income. She studies in the mornings and in the afternoons she looks after her business.

Mercy will use this loan of 1,000 Soles ($375) to purchase: 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, oil, milk, eggs, soap, toothpaste, canned food, etc. The loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Mercy is very grateful to her communal bank and to Manuela Ramos for helping make her dream of having her own store come true. She feels more independent and successful.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Mercy pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalilas, ubicado en el Jr. Las Gaviotas 467, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años es soltera. Mercy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido gracias a los préstamos y a la buena administración que ella tiene con sus ingresos, por las mañanas estudia y en las tardes se dedica a atender su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, aceite, leche, huevos, jabón, pasta dental, conservas, etc.

Mercy se siente muy bien gracias a su banco comunal y Manuela Ramos puede realizar su sueño de tener su propia bodega, sentirme mas independiente y realizada.

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina is a woman who has always fought to protect the well-being of her 4 children. Since she was very young she has worked in various lines of business. She continues to work presently in the capacity of vending sweets kept in a display cabinet located in the door of the municipal building of Huancayo, supplying candies to the personnel who work there. She would like to increase her capital with the objective of increasing her supplies and her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Marcelina, es una mujer luchadora que siempre ha velado por el bienestar de sus 4 hijos. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado al trabajo realizando varios negocios y también lo sigue haciendo ahora ofertando dulces en una vitrina ubicada en la puerta del local municipal de su zona y ofrece sus dulces al personal que trabaja en este espacio al por mayor. Desea incrementar su capital a fin de incrementar sus ofertas y ganancias.

loans.use: To offer a greater number of candies.

loans.name: Marquita

texts.es:
Marquita belongs to the Dalilas Communal Bank. Her business is located at Jr. Pomarosa Mz. E Lt. 4 in the Yarina Cocha District, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 31 years old and has 2 children. Her husband is a public employee, but his income is not enough to meet the family’s daily needs. It is for this reason that Marquita received her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos, which she decided to invest in a motorcycle taxi.

Marquita's motorcycle taxi has provided much satisfaction, and she is using the profits she has earned to repair her house; in the future she would also like to set up a business. She spends her mornings looking after her children, and in the afternoons, when she can, she plays her favorite sport, volleyball.

Marquita will use this loan of 700 Soles ($275) to invest in the maintenance of her motorcycle taxi. The loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Before she received her loan from Manuela Ramos, Marquita had not known about such loans and had therefore never taken one out. But because of the advice she received she can now manage her own income and get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Marquita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalilas, ubicado en el Jr. Pomarosa Mz. E Lt. 4, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años, es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es trabajador publico, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Marquita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la inicial para la compra de un motocarro.

En la actualidad su motocarro le ha dado muchas satisfacciones, con las ganancias obtenidas esta arreglando su casa, para mas adelante poner un negocio, por las mañanas se dedica a atender a sus hijos, y en las tardes cuando puede juega el deporte que mas le gusta voley.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motocarro.

Marquita, antes de ingresar a Manuela Ramos, desconocía acerca de los préstamos por que nunca antes había sacado uno, pero con las charlas que recibió ahora puede administrar sus propios ingresos y salir adelante.

loans.use: Maintenance for her motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo is a dependable person and a hard worker. As a good father and provider, he has devoted himself for several years to financially supporting his family by managing a small restaurant. He is asking for a loan in order to improve the facilities in his small place of business so that he may provide a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Oswaldo, es una persona constante y trabajadora, durante varios años se ha estado dedicando a consagrar su propia fuente de ingreso que favorece el bienestar de su familia, como buen padre y responsable del sustento de su hogar a través de la administración de su pequeño restaurante. Solicita un préstamo con el deseo de mejorar las instalaciones de su pequeño espacio de ventas para ofertar sus productos con un mejor servicio.

loans.use: To improve restaurant facilities.

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
Erica and her husband have worked in his dental practice for the last two years. Her husband is the dentist and Erica works as his assistant. Erica’s involvement has enabled them to expand their small practice and lease new premises in a more central location. The quality of service they offer has increased both the number of patients seeking their services and their income. Her vision is to expand further and become a well-equipped dental practice with the latest technology in dentistry.

They ask for a loan to install an air-conditioning system in their waiting room and to make their dental practice more appealing.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Erica y su esposo trabajan desde hace 2 años en su propio consultorio dental. Su esposo es odontólogo de profesión y Erica es su asistente su comprometido trabajo les ha permitido con el tiempo mejorar su pequeño consultorio y mudarlo a un local céntrico que arrendaron, su visión es poder ampliar y convertirse en un consultorio dental bien equipado con lo último en tecnología dental. La calidad de servicio que ambos ofrecen les ha permitido mejorar sustancialmente sus ingresos y el incremento de sus clientes que acuden a solicitar sus servicios. Solicitan un préstamo para acondicionar su salita de espera y mejorar el tractivo de su consultorio.

loans.use: Improvements to their dental practice

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Mrs.Martha belongs to the Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, located in the Calleria District of Ucayali Department. She is 46 years old, a mother of two, married, and her husband is a gym instructor. The income from her husband was insufficient to make ends meet so Martha decided to invest in a small gym with a loan from Manuela Ramos.

With the loans she has been able to equip her gym and her clientele has increased. She offers flexible operating hours and payment schemes which have turned her gym into one of the busiest in her city. She is able to do this with the support of her husband and her children.

Her loan will be payed back in four months and she will use it to purchase more equipment to perform the various exercises needed by her clients.

Martha feels at ease in her communal bank because they help her to purchase the equipment needed for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase equipment for her business

loans.name: Asotasi

texts.en:
Asotasi M. S., 30, is married with two children. She has two years of experience in the taro plantation business, selling to the villagers at the public market one day a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). Her husband, a farmer, helps tend to the plantation. This is the main source of income for the family.

She has had one previous loan. This is Asotasi’s first business venture because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.She is requesting a loan to purchase weed killer and tools for the plantation. Part of her loan will also be used to finance renovations to her house.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killer and tools

loans.name: Faatoaga

texts.en:
Faatoaga T., 66, is married with six children. Not allowing her age to restrict her, Faatoaga is still very active. She has been selling vegetables for many years to the people in her village, working six days per week.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~$83 USD). This is Mrs. T.'s first loan request. She sees this first loan as a very successful way for sustainable development in her family.

loans.use: To purchase cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers, pumpkins, lemons, and a small cash box

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita has allways been a busy, hardworking woman. Her natural talent in the kitchen allowed her to prepare meals in banquets and social events as well as opening a small grill. She is able to acquire the necessary means to take care of her family thorugh the sale of pork rinds, fritters, small pieces of grilled skewered meat, etc.

She does not conform with waiting for her husbands paycheck and her wish is to open another grill to continue growing her business.

Margarita is requesting a microloan to purchase a lit storefront sign which the local government requires for her business to continue operating.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase a lit storefront sign

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Fiorella

texts.es:
Fiorella is a young mother willing to improve life for herself and her young child. She is working towards becoming a qualified health visitor. In the meantime, she earns an income by selling various types of clothing.

She would like to improve the variety and increase the quantity of items of clothing she sells.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Fiorella, es una joven madre de familia que tiene muchos deseos de progreso. Para brindarle bienestar a su pequeño niño oferta todo tipo de prendas de vestir.Desea mejorar la oferta de sus productos con el propósito de especializarte en su carrera de visitadora médica.

loans.use: Additional capital to be able to offer more items of clothing for sale

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza belongs to the Las Dalilas ("The Dahlias") community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 44 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband is an independent laborer. With her first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles), Maritza decided to invest in a restaurant business. She now has a restaurant called La Gruta ("The Grotto") that she opens for business on Saturdays and Sundays so that her customers can enjoy her delicious stews, excellent service and great music. She takes charge of every detail so that her customers are well looked after and will come back often.

With this loan of S/.1,000, to be repaid in 4 months, Maritza will buy materials to expand her business. Having a restaurant was one of Maritza's biggest dreams because she loves to cook and be with people. Now she can say that she is more independent than before and she'll continue working with Manuela Ramos because it supports the economic growth of women.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maritza pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalilas, ubicado en el Jr. Lobo Caño Mz. 114 Lt. 16, del Distrito D. Yarina Cocha del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 44 años,es madre D. 3 hijos, su esposo es trabajador independiente., Es así que Maritza con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. comidas. En la actualidad tiene un restaurante D. nombre La Gruta, que todos los sábados y domingos abre sus puertas para atender a sus clientes con los ricos potajes y la excelente atención y la buena música que hay. Para ello Maritza se encarga al milímetro D. supervisar y preparar todo para que sus clientes seas bien atendidos y queden satisfechos y vuelvan muy pronto.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en el compra D. materiales para ampliar su negocio. Maritza, cumplió uno D. sus grandes sueños, tener un restaurante, ya que le gusta mucho cocinar y estar en contacto con la gente, ahora pueD. decir que es mas independiente que antes, y seguirá trabajando con Manuela Ramos por que aporta al crecimiento económico D. las mujeres.

loans.use: Buy materials to expand restaurant business.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz has always been conscientious and hard-working through the many years that she's earned a living selling all kinds of clothing. A year ago, she decided to set up a stall in the market and offer her services as a seamstress. She sells clothes at the stand during the week and the Sunday fair on weekends. She's asking for a loan to buy clothes that she can resell for a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Liz siempre ha sido constante y perseverante con su actividad por lo que durante muchos años se ha venido dedicando a la venta de todo tipo de prendas de vestir y hace un año tomó la decisión de tener un puesto en el mercado para ofrecer sus servicios de compostura, ahí trabaja todo el día y todos los días útiles para ofertar sus prendas de vestir los fines de semana en la feria dominical. Solicita un crédito para adquirir las prendas de vestir que oferta al por mayor.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith is very conscientious and the great love she has as a mother for her 2 young children, 10 and 4, drive her to keep working for a future that will allow them to get a good education and ultimately be successful in life. Edith works hard for them. She rented a small stand, 11 years ago, in the city's main market to sell moderately-priced clothing. She hopes to increase her sales and she's asking for a loan to buy a bigger and more varied inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Edith, es muy constante en su desempeño y el gran amor de madre que siente por sus 2 hijos pequeños de 10 y 4 años la impulsan a seguir trabajando por un futuro que les permita acceder a una educación de calidad a fin de afrontar la vida con éxito. Por esa razón Edith siempre ha estado trabajando, hace 11 años ha alquilado un pequeño stand en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad para vender buzos a precios módicos. Su deseo es incrementar la venta de buzos y solicita un préstamo para adquirirlos en mayor cantidad y variedad.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Perenise

texts.en:
Perenise V., 36, is married with three children. She has five years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business, selling her crops to the local villagers at the public market two days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

She has had one previous loan. This is Mrs. V.'s first business venture because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She is requesting a loan to purchase weed killer and tools for the plantation. Part of the loan will also be used to finance home repairs and for her children's education fees.

loans.use: To purchase weed killer and tools

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
I've now been operating a grocery store for more than 6 years. My husband and I started the business and, when I was left widowed, I took charge of it. One of my daughters and I work there now. The business needs more inventory and the store needs airconditioning because it gets hot in Nuevo Laredo this time of year. Some merchandise will rot and we'll incur a loss for the business. I'm applying for a US$800 loan to buy merchandise and aircondition the store.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo ya más de 6 años con el negocio de ventas de abarrotes. Este negocio lo iniciamos mi marido y yo, al quedar viuda me hice cargo del negocio en el trabajamos un de mis hijas y yo. El negocio le esta haciendo falta mas mercancía y reacondicionar el local ya que en Nuevo Laredo viene la temporada de calor y la mercancía se nos descompone y es una perdida de ingresos para el negocio. Solicito un préstamo de $800.00 dlls. Para la comprar de mercancía y reacondicionar el local.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale and install airconditioning.

loans.name: Fao

texts.en:
Fao S., 30, is married with two children. Her husband, a farmer, works with her and tends to the taro plantation. Mrs. S. sells her crop to the villagers at the public market one day a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

This is her first business venture because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Mrs. S. is requesting this loan to purchase knives, weed killer and other tools for harvesting taro. This is the main source of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killer and tools

loans.name: Maryana

texts.en:
Maryana L., 32, is married with two children. She has 2 years of experience in the handicraft business. She sells her products to locals and visitors at the public market six days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

She has had two previous loans. This is Maryana’s first business venture because she was never able to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase new handicrafts and to renovate her house.

loans.use: Purchase new handicrafts for resale at the market

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
Estrella is a tenacious woman and, despite her delicate health after a recent operation, she's kept on working. For some years, she's made a living buying and selling pork and she recently decided to set up a small, permanent sales space in order to increase her earnings and meet the requests of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Estrella, es una mujer muy perseverante y a pesar de su delicado estado de salud tras ser operada no ha detenido sus actividades. Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la comercialización de carne de cerdo y ha decidido dentro de poco establecerse en un espacio de ventas permanentes para acrecentar sus ganacias y complacer las peticiones de sus clientes.

loans.use: Set up a small space for sales.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is a young mother who very much wants to put her children on the path to a better life. With her mother-in-law's encouragement, she decided to sell chickens in the rural towns most remote from the city. She quickly made an important contact and she now buys her little chicks at a lower price. This loan will allow her to expand her chicken coop so that she can house more chickens and ultimately increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Francisca, es una joven madre de familia muy deseosa de conducir a sus hijos por el camino del progreso. Animada por su suegra decidió vender pollos por los pueblos rurales más alejados de su ciudad. En poco tiempo de trabajo ha podido realizar un importante contacto y ahora compra sus pequeños pollitos a menor precio. Su solicitud de un préstamo atiende a la necesidad de ampliar su espacio de crianza para albergar a mayor cantidad de pollos y acrecentar sus ganacias.

loans.use: Incremento de capital para implementar su pequeño espacio de crianza.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Laura Lizeth

texts.es:
I've been selling Mexican handicrafts for some time.  It's my business but I want to invest in it without using all my capital.  The business is the source of my family's income because I'm a single mother and I have 2 children still in school.  I'm applying for a US$700 loan to buy Mexican handicrafts so that I have a bigger inventory, more sales and can make a better life for my kids.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
Tengo ya tiempo que vendo artesanías Mexicanos. Este es mi negocio pero quiero invertirle más sin descapitalizarme. El negocio es la fuente de ingresos de la familia ya soy madre soltera y tengo 2 hijo los cuales están estudian. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $700.00 Dlls. Para la comprar de artesanías Mexicanas y así tener más inventario y más ventas y podré sacar a mis hijos adelante.

loans.use: Buy crafts for resale.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
I recently bought my house but it only has 2 rooms and I need to build another with wood to add a living room so that we won't be so squeezed. I'm applying for a US$500 loans to buy materials to build a new room.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hace poco mese adquirí mi casa pero solo tiene 2 cuartos y necesito construir otro mas de madera para poner la sala y así no estar tan ajustados en la casa. Solicito un préstamo de $ 500.00 Dlls. Para la comprar de material para la construcción de un cuarto de madera.

loans.use: Add room on front of house.

loans.name: San Juana Alicia

texts.es:
Little by little, I've been building my house and I recently added a room, the interior of which needs to be finished. It's a bedroom for my daughters because they're young women now and want their own space. That's why I'm applying for a US$900 loan, to finish the interior of the room. I don't have the money needed to complete the work and I want to get it done.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Poco a poco he construido mi casa y hace poco construí un cuarto el cual le esta haciendo falta los acabados del interior, es la recamara de mis hijas ya que son todas una señoritas y quieren su espacio. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $900.00 Dlls. Para los acabados del interior de un cuarto. Por el momento no cuento con el dinero que se necesita para los acabados y quiero ya tener el cuarto terminado.

loans.use: Complete the interior.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mara Yolanda

texts.es:
I can't live in my house just now because there's no security fence around the house or security grilles on the windows and doors.  I'm appying for a US$700 loan to make the house secure so that I can live there and stop paying rent.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
Por el momento no puedo abitar mi casa ya que le esta haciendo falta las bardas al rededor de la casa y protecciones de las ventanas y puertas. Solicito un préstamo de $700.00 Dlls. Para la colocación de las protecciones y las bardas alrededor de la casa, y así habitarla y dejar de pagar renta.

loans.use: Security fence for house and security grilles for windows and doors.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
I must fix the front door of my house as well as a window since they were not finished during a refurbishment that we did. I am requesting $430 to carry out the repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Door and window repairs

loans.name: Otilia

texts.en:
