Otilia U., 32, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells her crops to local villagers and the public at the Fugalei market three days per week.

She has had three previous loans. Mrs. U. expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). This is her first business venture as she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. This loan will be used to purchase weed killer, chemicals, pesticides and tools for her plantation. Part of the loan will also be used to pay her children's education fees.

loans.use: To purchase weed killler, chemicals, pesticides and tools for the plantation

loans.name: Fepuleai

texts.en:
Fepuleai T., 76, is widowed with nine children. She has many years of experience in the retail business which her husband started many years ago. Her kids help her with a lot of the hard work and her children who live overseas also send back money and supplies for the business.

Mrs. T. sells food products to members of her village and to people driving through the south side of Upolo Island during the a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1200 Tala (~$500 USD).

This is her first business venture because she was never able to personally qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She has now had seven previous loans. She will use half of this money to supply new food items for her shop and the other half to support her grandchildren's school fees. She will also use part of the loan to repair her home.

loans.use: To purchase stock, flour, sugar, onions, salt, sauce oil, drinks, etc. for resale

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Señora Blanca P. Aranda lives with her husband (señor Genaro Mariscal) and their two daughters in their own home. It is located in the Tacagua zone in the Ciudad de La Paz in Ladera Oeste. Blanca is a domestic employee (a cook) in a private home, and her husband makes a living by repairing appliances in a shop in their zone.

Their objective is to provide their daughters with a space. The credit will go towards refurbishing their two rooms since they lack plaster and interior paint. This is the fourth time she is requesting a loan and the socio-economic anaylisis done qualifies her favorably to be approved for this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Blanca P. Aranda vive con su esposo (el señor Genaro Mariscal y sus dos hijas) en casa propia, el domicilio esta en la zona de Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz (Ladera Oeste). La señora Blanca es empleada domestica (cocinera) en un domicilio particular y su esposo se dedica a la reparación de electrodomésticos en un taller de su zona.

A objeto de brindar un espacio para sus hijas, el crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción de dos habitaciones ya que carece de revoque y pintura interior. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder al crédito solicitado.

loans.use: Refurbishment of her home

loans.name: Filiberta

texts.es:
Filiberta is an enthusiastic woman. She is happy and very optimistic. She started her business to receive extra income, since her husband is a worker at a transportation company. Sometimes there isn’t enough work and there are expenses they have to cover, especially now that she has a nine-month girl. She started in February of 2006, when her mom convinced her to study at a preparatory school at night, that way she would have spare time during the day to do something productive. She got invited to a demonstration of cosmetic products, she liked it and she signed up to sell them. She has been selling cosmetics for a while now and she makes good income out of it. She also helps her mom sell food at her house and takes the opportunity to sell products.

She needs a credit of $300, in which she hopes to pay off in 3 months. She needs it to buy merchandise and have better variety of products for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Filiberta es una persona entusiasta, muy alegre y optimista. Inició el negocio para tener un ingreso extra ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero en una empresa de carga y a veces el trabajo escasea y tienen gastos que debe cubrir, más ahora que tiene una niña pequeñita de 9 meses. Comenzó en Febrero de 2006, cuando su mamá la convenció que estudiara la preparatoria en las noches en una escuela nocturna para poder terminarla, y además le quedaría el día libre para dedicarse a una actividad, y por esos días la invitaron a una demostración de los productos cosméticos; como le gustó se inscribió como vendedora y hasta el día de hoy le ha ido muy bien, además le ayuda a su mamá a vender comida en su casa y ahí entre sus clientes puedo ofrecer los productos de belleza.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $300 el cual esta dispuesta a pagar en 3 meses. Lo necesita para comprara mercancía y tener un buen surtido de cosméticos para sus clientes y poder ofrecer a otros clientes.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is a man with many good qualities. He is honest, hard working, and is a social person. He began a business to earn an extra income and to have an activity that would make him feel useful. He is retired and receives a small pension from the Mexican Postal Service. Since his the amount he receives from his pension is quite a small amount, he decided to start his own business. He began his business in January 2004, after his wife went on a trip to San Antonio, Texas, to see their daughter. His wife mentioned the idea of opening a business to their daughter and she decided to help them. Their daughter helped them get big packages of used clothing from the United States for them to sell to their friends and neighbors in Mexico. It has been a very good business for them. Now his wife travels every three months to the United States to get the clothing, or if they need clothes earlier, their daughter sends them the clothing.

Now they need a loan of $300, which they will payoff in three months. They will use the money to buy more used clothing and to have a better variety of clothing, which will give them the opportunity to increase their income. With your support they will be able to progress more with their business.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Carlos es una hombre muy honesto, trabajador y muy sociable. Inició el negocio Para tener un ingreso extra y tener una actividad para sentirse útil, ya que lo pensionaron del Servicio Postal Mexicano y su pensión es pequeña por lo cual tuvo la necesidad de iniciar su propio negocio. Comenzó en Enero de 2004, por esas fechas su esposa fue a visitar a su hija que vive en San Antonio, Texas y le comentó que querían abrir un negocio, fue entonces que su hija le dijo que ella le ayudaba a conseguir pacas de ropa usada para que ellos las vendieran entre sus vecinos y amistades, lo cual hicieron y les fue muy bien. Ahora su esposa viaja cada 3 meses por ropa, o si necesitan antes dependiendo la temporada, su hija se la manda.

Ahora necesitan un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para poder comprar ropa usada de temporada y tener un mejor surtido que nos permita aumentar nuestras ganancias. Con tu apoyo ellos podrán progresar.

loans.use: buy used clothing

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo is married and he has three children: 20 year old Filiberta, who is married; 16 year old María del Carmen, a secondary school student; and 12 year old José Guadalupe, a primary school student. The youngest two still live at home. Eduardo began his business out of necessity, as his salary as a public transportation driver would not always cover the family's expenses. He began in March of 2005, when his wife suggested he participate in a "Tanda" of money in order to invest in some chairs and tables in the part of the house that was in good shape. Since then it has gone very well and he sells food to his co workers who are also drivers, and at this point in time he has a fair number of clients, including his children who help with the business. His idea is to grow and in the future have a bigger, credentialed business. In addition to this business, his wife also sells name brand beauty products and perfume. Clearly they are a very enterprising family.

Now they are asking for a loan of $300 that they will repay in 3 months. They will use it to buy raw ingredients that will permit them to create meals and also to repair some chairs that are in poor condition. With your help, they will continue to meet their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Eduardo es casado y tiene 3 hijos Filiberta de 20 años, casada; María del Carmen de 16 años, estudiante de Secundaria y José Guadalupe de 12 años, estudiante de primaria; los dos mas chicos todavía viven en casa. Inició el negocio por necesidad, ya que su sueldo como chofer de transporte público a veces no le alcanzaba para cubrir sus gastos familiares. Comenzó en Marzo de 2005, cuando su esposa le sugirió participar en una “Tanda” de dinero para invertirlo en unas sillas y mesas en el patio de su casa el cual acondiciono. Desde entonces les ha ido muy bien ya que le venden comida a sus compañeros de trabajo que también son choferes y en la actualidad tienen bastantes clientes, incluso sus hijos les ayudan en el negocio. Su idea es crecer y en el futuro poner un negocio mas grande y acreditado. Además de este negocio, su esposa también se dedica a vender productos de belleza y perfumería de reconocidas marcas. Por lo que son una familia muy emprendedora.

Actualmente solicitan un crédito por US $300 que pagaran en 3 meses, para comprar materia prima que les permita elaborar comida así como algunas sillas para reponer las que ya se encuentran en mal estado. Con tu contribución ellos podrán hacer realidad sus metas.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es:
María is married. Her husband is a taxi driver, and they have three children: 25 year old José Luis, a university student; 21 year old Nancy Beatriz, an employee; and 14 year old David Alejandro, a secondary school student. All the children live with their parents. María began her business and has always been dedicated to business because she likes to make sales, and she sells very diverse products. Also this is a way for her to be occupied and active, and also permits her to meet people and establish friendships. She began in the world of sales approximately 22 years ago, selling furniture and later cosmetics by catalog. For the past 6 years she has sold natural products, and thanks to loans from Admic she has increased her sales and clients.

Now she needs a loan of $950 that she will repay in 6 months in order to purchase more natural products that will permit her to meet the needs of her current clients, and also in order to gain new customers. With your help, María will continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

María es casada su esposo es taxista y tienen 3 hijos José Luis D. 25 años, estudiante universitario, Nancy Beatriz D. 21 años, empleada, David Alejandro D. 14 años, estudiante D. secundaria, todos viven en casa. Inició el negocio ya que siempre se ha dedicado al comercio porqué le gustan mucho las ventas y ha vendido muy diversos productos, además D. que es una manera D. estar ocupada y activa, también le permite conocer gente y entablar amistades. Comenzó en el mundo D. las ventas aproximadamente hace como 22 años, inicio vendiendo muebles, después productos cosméticos por catalogo y hace como 6 años vendo productos naturistas, y gracias a los créditos D. Admic ha podido acrecentar sus ventas y sus clientes.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir mas productos naturistas que le permitan cubrir las necesidades D. sus clientes actuales y también para poder captar clientes nuevos. Con tu apoyo María seguirá progresando.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
Lizbeth is divorced and she has two children, 12 year old Jonathan Uriel, a secondary school student, and 6 year old Melvin Omar, a primary school student. She began her business in order to offer the best to her children, as her marriage had not gone well and she had divorced, remaining single with her children so that she had to carry the household necessities and the education of her children. At this time, she discovered that she greatly enjoyed sales, and thus she was able to earn her own money and not depend on anyone. This was how she was able to remain single and be able to buy what she wanted and also in order to be able to help her parents with their household expenses. She began her business in August 1992, selling sweets and household products, and it has been about 12 years since she started selling clothes, and it has gone very well to date.

She needs a loan of $950 that she will repay in 6 months that will permit her to acquire merchandise for the season and to have better selection and variety of products in order to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Lizbeth es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos Jonathan Uriel de 12 años, estudiante de secundaria y Melvin Omar de 6 años, estudiante de primaria. Inició el negocio para poder brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, ya que no le fue bien en su matrimonio y se divorcio, quedándose sola con sus hijos por lo que tuvo que hacerse cargo de las necesidades del hogar y del estudio de sus hijos. Entonces, descubrió que le gustaban mucho las ventas y así podía ganar su propio dinero y no depender de nadie ya que en ese entonces estaba soltera y así podía comprarse lo que ella quisiera y además le alcanzaba para ayudar a sus papas con los gastos de la casa. Comenzó en Agosto de 1992, vendiendo dulces y productos para el hogar y hace como 12 años empezó a vender ropa y le ha ido muy bien hasta a la fecha.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses el cual le permitirá adquirir mercancía para la temporada y tener un mejor surtido y variedad de productos para atender mejor a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Itzel

texts.es:
Itzel is married and her husband works has an employee in a department store. She has one son, Roberto Javier, who is three years old. She began her business in order to earn money to help her husband and so she could feel useful. She began in 2005, first helping her mother in the business of selling books, receiving goods and taking orders. Her mother was her example, as under the weight of remaining single and therefore without the help of a spouse, she carried her family forward. It was through her advice that Itzel was inspired to have her own business, and she began with a friend who also was dedicated to the sale of jewelry. For the 10th of May, or Mother's Day, she agreed to make an investment of jewelry that in this time of year people buy a lot of in order to give it to their mothers, and she has done very well with this activity.

Now she needs a loan of $300 that she will repay in 3 months in order to buy a lot of silver jewelry and to have a better selection for her clients in this time of year. With your help, she will be able to continue improving her life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Itzel es casada y su esposo trabaja como empleada en una tienda departamental tiene 1 hijo Roberto Javier de 3 años de edad. Inició el negocio para poder ganar dinero para ayudar a su esposo y sentirse útil. Comenzó en el 2005, primero le ayudaba a su mamá en el negocio de ventas de libros, ya sea cobrando o entregando pedidos, y ella fue su ejemplo pues a pesar que se quedó sola sin el apoyo de un esposo ella sacó adelante a su familia. Fue por consejo de ella que se animo a tener su propio negocio y se presentó con una amiga que también se dedica a la venta de joyería ya que se acercaba el 10 de Mayo, día de las madres, y le convenía hacer una inversión en joyería ya que en esa época la gente compra mucho para regalar a sus mamás, desde entonces le ha ido muy bien en esta actividad

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un lote de joyería de plata y tener un mejor surtido para sus clientes en esta época del año. Con tu apoyo ella podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu runs a local restaurant in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  She re-started her business seven years ago after the civil war, but at a very small scale. She sells rice, with cassava and potato leaves, peanut soup and fish.   With her previous loan from SMT, she purchased new plates, cups and cooking pots but continue purchasing the ingredients in retail, which is very expensive.  Yeabu would like to expand her business to earn better income.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $250 to purchase the ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients (rice, peanuts, beans, spices etc.)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Jose Ángel is married and has a 13 year old girl, Alexia Yamilet who is studying in secundary school. He began his business as he did not have a fixed employment and had a hard time making ends meet after the birth of their daughter.

Twelve years ago he began selling clothing and started selling clothes to his work mates in a factory. Things were going well and he received requests for shoes as well. In May 2006, his wife saw an ad requesting catalogue shoe salespersons. Jose Ángel went to this well known shoe store and was accepted as a credit salesman. He is doing well and currently makes up to 40% commission on sales.

Now he is requesting a microcredit of $300 to be paid back in 3 months. He needs the money to cover his client´s liabilities since he receives a very high commission if client debts are paid back in time. With your support, José will keep progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Pay his client´s liabilities

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José Ángel started his business due to a lack of education, since he studied only up to middle school and only found contract work with very low pay. He started 5 years ago, when his closest relatives (since he is an orphan) suggested that he sell cheeses, and little by little he built his customer base. He started with neighbors and relatives, selling door to door. Currently, he has an established customer base and has been doing very well.

He is requesting a loan for US $675, which he will repay in 6 months, to expand his business and stock with more cheese to increase his income and extend his sales territory toward other parts of the city. With your support, José will continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

José Ángel inició el negocio por la falta de estudios, ya que solo estudio hasta la secundaria y solo conseguía trabajos eventuales poco remunerados. Comenzó hace 5 años, sus familiares cercanos, ya que es huerfano de padre y madre, le recomendaron que vendiera quesos y poco a poco fue haciendo clientela, empezó con los vecinos y familiares, ya que las ventas las efectúa casa por casa, cambaceo. Actualmente ha hecho una buena cartera de clientes y le va muy bien.

Solicita un préstamo por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para ampliar su negocio y surtir más quesos e incrementar sus ingresos, ampliando las rutas de venta hacia otros sectores de la ciudad. Con tu apoyo José podrá seguir progresando.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to stock his cheese business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca started her business to support herself financially, being that her husband’s income was very little and was not enough to cover the household’s expenses. Additionally, he was laid off from his previous employment two months ago, and his current one does not pay very well.

She started in December of 2003, with a savings fund her husband was given by his employer. She decided to sell seasonal clothing and it worked well for her. She started by selling to her relatives for holiday gift exchanges, and also to friends and neighbors. Shortly thereafter, she added the sale of notions in a smaller scale.

She now needs a loan for US $400, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise. This will be a great help for her since she will take advantage of the season, which is when she can make higher earnings from her sales. With your support, Francisca will prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca inició el negocio para ayudarse económicamente, ya que el ingreso de su esposo era muy poco y no alcanzaba con los gastos de la casa, además lo liquidaron hace 2 meses de su empleo y en donde labora actualmente no esta muy bien remunerado.

Comenzó en diciembre del 2003, con el fondo de ahorro que le entregaron a su esposo en donde trabajaba, decidió ponerse a vender ropa de temporada y le funciono; empezó vendiéndoles a sus familiares, para los intercambios navideños y con vecinos y amigos. Posteriormente agrego la venta de mercería en pequeño.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y le será de gran ayuda ya que aprovecharía nuevamente la temporada, y es cuando puede tener mas ingresos en sus ventas, Con tu apoyo Frnacisca saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Soda

texts.fr:
Soda L. is 33 years old, married with 1 child and 1 brother in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Centre 2C in Vélingara for 4 years. She buys Khartoum cloth, damask, and ready-to-wear clothes for resale, as well as food for catering. Her income allows her to contribute to the management of her family. Soda would like to enlarge her business.The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Soda L., 33 ans, mariée 01 enfant et 01 frère en charge est membre du banc villageois de Centre 2C à Vélingara depuis 4 ans. Elle achète des tissus khartoum, des bazins ganila et des prêts à porter à revendre et des provisions pour faire de la restauration. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l'entretien de sa famille. Soda veut renforcer son activité. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy Khartoum cloth, damask, ready-to-wear clothing, and catering food

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Rosari

texts.es:
Guadalupe has always enjoyed cooking, for which reason she decided to start a business selling Mexican dishes and snacks. With it she obtains income that she uses to help her husband with their household’s expenses since they are the parents of two daughters, ages 11 and 13.

She is now requesting a loan for US $250, which she will repay in 3 months to purchase supplies for her store to offer variety in her dishes and thus, increase her sales. With your support, she will be able to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe siempre le ha gustado la cocina por lo que decidió emprender un negocio y de venta de antojitos mexicanos, del cual obtiene ingresos con los que ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que son padres de dos hijas de 11 y 13 años.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $ 250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar insumos para ofrecer variedad en sus platillos y así aumentar sus ventas. Con tu apoyo ella podrá hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to prepare her dishes and snacks.

loans.name: Leydi Teresita

texts.es:
Leydi started her business shortly before separating from her partner and decided to maintain her 3 children selling clothing and footwear, which she had been doing for 10 years to bring up her children successfully. Recently, she had big expenses because one of her daughters enrolled at a university, taking up a lot of her capital. However, her customer base is large and they have requested merchandise, for which she needs this loan to invest and fulfill her customers’ orders as well as close the sale.

She needs a credit for US $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase merchandise. With your contribution, she will continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Leydi, inicio su negocio poco antes de que se separara de su pareja, y decidió mantener a sus 3 hijos vendiendo ropa y zapatos, actividad que ha realizado durante 10 años sacando a sus hijos adelante, últimamente tuvo gastos fuertes por que una de sus hijas ingreso a la universidad y se descapitalizo, pero su clientela es grande y le han solicitado mercancía, por lo que requiere de este crédito para invertir y poder cumplirle a sus clientes, además de asegurar su venta.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para compra mercancía. Con tu contribución ella seguirá con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her business and fulfill her customers' orders.

loans.name: Margarita Del Rosari

texts.es:
Margarita is married and has two chidren: a 24-year-old son and a 12-year-old daughter. She started her business of selling chickens 15 years ago. Nevertheless, when her daughter was born, she stopped selling to dedicate time to her baby. Now she is continuing with her business again since her daughter is 12. She is popular in the colony, which helps her chicken restaurant have good sales. She hopes to invest in fruits and vegetables since there isn't another business like this close to her house. Her clientele has also recommended this. She is sure she can improve her sales in this way.

She needs a loan of $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase merchandise and to be able to reactivate her business. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Margarita es casada y tiene dos hijos uno de 24 y una hija de 12 años. Inicio el negocio de venta de pollos hace 15 años, sin embargo al nacer su hija, dejo de vender para dedicarle tiempo a su bebe, ahora nuevamente continuo con el negocio ya que la niña tiene 12 años y ella goza de popularidad en la colonia que hace que su pollería venda bien, desea invertir en frutas y verduras, ya que por su casa no hay cerca otro negocio de ese tipo y además su clientela se la ha recomendado, ella tiene la seguridad que mejoraran sus ventas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía, y así poder reactivar su negocio. Con tu apoyo esto será posible

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alma Rosalia

texts.es:
Alma started her business because she always had the curiosity, as well as the necessity, to start her own business being that there is a school half a block away from her home and she saw the opportunity to open up a paper store, which would be profitable for her because of the students in the area. She started 8 years ago and her business was very small. She also did not have much merchandise, only the basics for school, but little by little started adding more merchandise according to the items the students requested that she did not have. This taught her how to invest the earnings from the business wisely so that it may grow.

She is requesting a loan for US $475, which she will repay in one month. She has received several loans before, and with this one she will be able to stock her store with merchandise for the Mother’s Day holiday.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma inició el negocio porque siempre tuvo la curiosidad y necesidad de abrir un negocio ya que a media cuadra de la casa hay una escuela y vio la oportunidad de poner una papelería que le resultara buen negocio por los estudiantes. comenzó hace 8 años y el negocio era muy pequeño aparte de que casi no tenia mercancía solo lo indispensable para la escuela y poco a poco fue metiéndole mas mercancía conforme los mismos estudiantes le pedían cosas que no tenia, eso le ayudo a comprender que debía invertir bien las ganancias del negocio, para hacerlo crecer.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 1 meses ya son varios los créditos que pido y el de esta ocasión me servirá para poder surtirme de mas mercancía de temporada para el día de las madres.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario is a widow and has two grown children, ages 30 and 32. She started her business in order to make money as she did not have any other income apart from her sales and the money her children would give her from time to time. She began a few years ago and since then has sold shoes and bedspreads, but now is focused on selling shoes by catalog. The catalog sales are going very well because each month she has a large quantity or orders and people are always purchasing shoes from her.

She is requesting a loan of $475, to be repaid in one month, in order to buy merchandise and fill a pending order. With your help Mrs. Rosario will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Rosario es viuda y tiene dos hijos ya mayores de 30 y 32 años. Inició el negocio para poder sacar dinero ya que no tiene otros ingresos de dinero más que la que le da sus ventas y la de sus hijos que le dan dinero de vez en cuando. Comenzó hace años y desde entonces ha vendido calzado, colchas, ahora esta enfocada vendiendo calzado por catalogo, y le esta yendo muy bien porque cada mes tiene gran volumen de pedidos y la gente siempre le compra.

Solicita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 1 mes, para comprar mercancía y sacar un pedido que tiene pendiente, con tu apoyo la Sra. Rosario podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto worked for many years in a water-bottling company; his salary was very low and insufficient. Tired of the situation and with the help of his wife, he started selling fruit cocktails, for which he acquired a tricycle cart. They traveled through the streets where there were many passers-by, and little by little formed their customer base. When his sales started improving, he decided to set up a little store in his home so that his wife could tend to it while he continued selling in the streets. With much effort, they have managed to prosper, and he now needs support to purchase more stock and increase his sales.

He needs a loan for US $450, which he will repay in 4 months, to purchase merchandise and offer a wider variety of fruits and vegetables in his store.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Alberto trabajo muchos años en una embotelladora de agua el sueldo era poco y no alcanzaba , cansado de la situación y con ayuda de su esposa empezó a vender ensaladas de frutas, para lo cual adecuo un triciclo y recorrían las calles y lugares donde habían muchos trausentes, poco a poco hizo su clientela, al mejorar sus ventas decidió adecuar un lugar en su casa para que su esposa lo atendiera y el continuara con la venta en la calle, con muchos esfuerzos han logrado prosperar, ahora requiere apoyo para adquirir mas inventario y mejorar sus ventas.

El necesita un préstamo por US $450 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mas variedad de futas y verduras en su tienda.

loans.use: Purchase more fruits and vegetables to stock his store.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José is married and has two children. He started his business because he had always wanted to learn a trade and, in order to support his household, he decided to learn how to sheetrock. He began six years ago in his home as an apprentice to another person until he was able to work on his own and was able to make himself independent.

He is requesting a loan of $475, to be repaid over 6 months, in order to purchase a sheetrock cutting machine and work supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

José es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Inició el negocio por que siempre quiso aprender un oficio para apoyar a su casa y decidió empezar a trabajar la tablaroca. Comenzó hace 6 años en su casa como aprendiz con otra persona hasta realizar trabajos por su cuenta y lograr independizarse.

Solicita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses, para comprar una maquina cortadora de tabla roca y material para trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase a sheetrock cutting machine

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban is married and has one child. He started his business to make ends meet, making an occupation out of his skills being that he was unable to gain stable employment in any company because of his age. He started 3 years ago as an electrician, working on occasional orders but has now set up a workshop outside his home.

He is requesting a loan of US $350, which he will repay in 4 months to purchase an electricity-regulating machine to perform his work at 100%. With your help, Esteban will be able to continue improving his business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Esteban es casado y tiene un hijo. Inició el negocio para salir adelante el saber un oficio ya que por su edad no le permitían trabajar en ningún tipo de empresa fija. Comenzó hace 3 años haciendo trabajos de electricista, solo de tipo eventual ahora ya puso un local afuera de su domicilio.

Solicita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar una maquina reguladora de electricidad para realizar al 100% su trabajo. Con tu ayuda Esteban podrá seguir mejorando su negocio

loans.use: Purchase an electricity-regulating machine.

loans.name: Martha Eloisa

texts.es:
Martha is married and has four children ages 38, 35, 33 and 29. She started her business in order to help pay the family expenses as they frequently had money problems. She began six years ago by undertaking the sale of cosmetics and perfumes by catalog, and today she buys in bulk and sells much more.

She is requesting a loan of $475, to be repaid over 6 months, in order to remodel her store and be able to show more merchandise. By showing more merchandise, she will be able to get more orders.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Martha es casada y tiene 4 hijos 38, 35, 33, y 29 años. Inició el negocio para solventar los gastos familiares pues las carencias económicas eran muchas. Comenzó hace seis años, emprendió la venta de cosméticos y perfumería por catalogo, hoy ya compra por paquetes y vende mucho mas.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses, para poder remodelar el local y poder exhibir más mercancía pues compro para exhibir y de ahí saco mis pedidos.

loans.use: Remodel store

loans.name: Wara

texts.en: Wara, 37 years old and married with four children, started her business of selling foodstuffs four years ago.  With a previous loan from SMT, she diversified her business and rented a stall in the market of Makeni town in Sierra Leone.  Wara now feels confident and empowered, with hope for a better future, and so would like to expand the business. She is therefore requesting a loan of $350 to accomplish her dream.

loans.use: To increase stock to generate more income.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Yuliana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yuliana is married but still does not have children. She started her business in order to assure a dignified future. She began three years ago by selling lingerie and perfumes by catalog, and soon with a small amount of savings she had, she bought merchandise.

She is requesting a loan of $475, to be repaid over 6 months, in order to remodel her store and air condition the sales floor to provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Yuliana es casada pero aun no tiene hijos, inició el negocio por asegurar un futuro digno. Comenzó hace 3 años vendiendo por catalogo lencería y perfumería, poco con un pequeño ahorro que tenia compro mercancía.

Solicita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local y acondicionar un área de ventas para mejor la atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Remodel her store

loans.name: María Trinidad

texts.es:
Maria is married and has two children who are 23 and 25 years of age and who are independent economically since they both work. She began her business five years ago. She and her husband suffered a strong economic crisis after their eldest child was in an accident and died. He had his own business, a mechanic shop, and left some debts which Maria and her husband had to cover. Thankfully, his business has continued and has become a fountain of income and an escape that has allowed them to overcome the loss of their son. Maria started her business five years ago . She opened a beauty shop asa result of her eldest son having an accident and passing away.

She is requesting a loan of US $675, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to invest in materials for her business. In this manner, she will be able to provide better service to her customers. With your contribution, Maria will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

María es casada y tiene dos hijos de 23 y 25 años, que son independientes económicamente ya que los dos trabajan. Inició el negocio desde hace 5 años, su esposo y ella tuvieron un crisis económica muy fuerte a raíz de que el mayor de sus hijos tuvo un accidente y murió, El tenia su propio negocio era mecánico y dejo algunas deudas, que tuvieron que cubrir su esposo y ella, y gracias a dios su negocio ha progresado, y hoy para ella su negocio a sido una fuente de ingresos y un escape para poder superar la perdidas de su hijo. Comenzó su negocio hace 5 años empezó su estética a raíz de que su hijo mayor tuvo un accidente y falleció.

Solicita un préstamo por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir material para su negocio y de esta forma para poder ofrécele un mejor servicio a su clientela. Con tu contribución María saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her business.

loans.name: Maria Patrocinio

texts.es:
Maria is married. Her husband works in a mine and they have two children who are 12 and eight years of age and who both study. She decided to start a business in order to help her husband with the family’s expenses and to have a productive activity. She began in 2005 when a friend commented that the sale of catalog lingerie was a good business.

She is requesting a loan of US $400, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise and fulfill the orders that she has. With your help, she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

María es casada, su esposo trabaja en una mina y tienen 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años, ambos estudiando. Ella decidió emprender un negocio para apoyar en los gastos familiares a su esposo y tener una actividad productiva. Empezó en el 2006, cuando una amiga le comento que la venta de lencería por catalogo era un buen negocio, y así fue como empezó.

Solicita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir los pedidos que tiene. Con tu ayuda ella podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is divorced and has one son who is 28 years old. She began her business selling clothing in 2005. She went to Aguascalientes to purchase merchandise since it is cheaper there. She needed to generate some income since, when she separated from her husband, she lost the economic support that he provided.

Catalina needs a loan of US $350, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise and fulfill the orders that she has. With your support, she will be able to continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Catalina es divorciada y tiene un hijo de 28 años. Comenzó el negocio de venta de ropa y blancos en el 2005, fue a Aguascalientes a comprar la mercancía ya que haya es mas barata. Ella tenia la necesidad de generar algún ingreso, ya que cuando se separo de su marido perdió el apoyo económico que el le brindaba.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir los pedidos que tiene. Con tu apoyo ella podrá seguir progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Arleth Azenete

texts.es:
Arleth is separated from her husband and has three children. She began her business because she wanted to become independent and take advantage of savings to start her own business. In addition, she wanted to pay her housing bills. She began her business selling tacos a year ago with a grill and four tables.

Arleth needs a loan of US $1,200, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase ingredients and, therefore, increase her sales by offering a greater variety on the menu of her establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Arleth esta separada de su marido y tiene 3 hijos. Inició el negocio porque se quería independizar y aprovechar un ahorro que tenia para iniciar su propio negocio, además que debía solventar los gastos de su casa. Comenzó su negocio de venta de tacos hace un año con una parrilla y cuatro mesas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $ 1200 que pagara en 6 meses para comprara insumos y asi incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor variedad en el menú que ofrece en su establecimiento

loans.use: Purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is married and has three children. She began her business eight years ago as a result of her wishes to progress and generate better income for her home. She dedicates herself to the sale of cosmetic products and this has allowed her to help her family’s economic situation and her children’s education.

She is requesting a loan of US $900, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to buy merchandise for the upcoming season so that she can increase her sales volumes. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Inició el negocio hace 8 años debido a sus deseos de progresar y generar mejores ingresos en el hogar. Se dedica la venta de productos cosméticos y esto le ha permitido ayudar en la economía familiar y en la educación de sus hijos.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $900 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía por la temporada para elevar su volumen de venta. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Martha Olivia

texts.es:
Martha is married. Her husband is a transportation operator and they have three children. She began her business with desires of improving and moving her family forward and of helping her husband by having extra income. She began approximately eight years ago, after receiving an invitation from a friend. In this manner, she began to sell cosmetic products.

Now, she needs a loan of US $900, which she will repay in 5 months, in order to purchase merchandise and increase her inventory to have better sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha es casada su esposo es operador de transporte, y tienen 3 hijos. Inició el negocio por sus deseos de mejorar y sacar adelante a su familia, y ayudar a su esposo así como tener un ingreso extra. Comenzó hace 8 años aproximadamente, mediante la invitación de una amiga, así fue como se decidió a vender productos cosméticos.

Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por US $900 que pagara en 6 meses, para comprar mercancía e incrementar su inventario y tener mejores ventas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria is separated from her husband and has three children. She began her business to keep herself busy and active when she found herself sad and depressed due to her separation, as well as in order to have an independent income. She decided to sell cosmetic products approximately eight years ago after an invitation from a friend.

Now, she needs a loan of US $900 which she will repay in 5 months in order to purchase merchandise and increase her inventory, and therefore increase her sales. With your support, Maria will continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta separada de su esposo, y tiene 3 hijos. Inició el negocio por tristeza, por depresión, después de la separación con su aun esposo, para mantenerse ocupada en algo, para mantenerse activa y tener su ingreso independiente . Comenzó hace 8 años aproximadamente, mediante la invitación de una amiga, así fue como se decidió a vender productos cosméticos.

Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por US $900 que pagara en 6 meses, para comprar mercancía e incrementar su inventario y así aumentar sus ventas. Con tu apoyo María seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: María Herminia

texts.en:
María Herminia sells costume jewelry and beauty products in the Chucho community of Santo Domingo. She has a lot of dreams for her family, and she hopes her business will allow reach her goals and succeed in life.

María Herminia has two daughters and one son, all of whom go to school. She says that it’s hard to provide for her children every day, but she hopes that her business’s continued growth will help her to earn more profits so she can support her children’s education and her family’s well being.

With her loan, María Herminia will buy new and fashionable items, which may help her attract new clients. This entrepreneur would like to have a big store with a lot of employees and millions of customers visiting it every day.

loans.use: To restock a small business that sells jewelry and beauty products.

loans.name: Gargilla

texts.en:
Gargilla is a smart entrepreneur who lives in the Chucho community of Santo Domingo. Gargilla says that she always pays special attention to the needs of people in her community, because their needs create great business opportunities for those who can meet them.

Currently, Gargilla is running an open-air pub. She explains that a lot of people visit her business to enjoy a couple of beers, whisky, and other drinks while they’re chatting with friends. This entrepreneur dreams of owning an establishment so she can run her business in a more comfortable atmosphere.

With her loan, Gargilla will buy more drinks in order to enlarge her sales volume and increase her revenue.

loans.use: To buy beverages to replenish a small pub

loans.name: Miriam Caro

texts.en:
Miriam Caro is fifty-three years old and she lives in the Libertador community of Santo Domingo. Miriam has been selling homemaD. cakes and bonbons for seven years to people in her neighborhood. Her husband is very old and can no longer work, so Miriam has the huge responsibility of providing food and ensuring the well being of the family.

She’s requesting a loan to buy raw materials to keep producing her delicious goods. Miriam Caro hopes her business will allow her and her husband enjoy their golden years.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cakes and other sweets for her customers.

loans.name: Mohammad Sabar

texts.en: Mohammad Sabar is an electrical engineer in Kabul, Afghanistan, where he runs a consumer electronics shop selling televisions, radios, DVD players and so on. He works full time and employs five hard-working people, three of whom are university students in engineering working part-time. Mohammad has a sizeable client base and wishes to expand to appeal to even more potential customers. To this end, he has requested an individual loan to complete the lease purchase of the shop.

loans.use: To complete the lease purchase on his shop

loans.name: Benyn Mary

texts.en:
Benyn Mary lives with her husband and her five-year-old son in the Ochocienta community of Santo Domingo. She sells an assortment of hair products and women’s clothing. Benyn says that she has a lot of experience selling products, and that has helped her gain a lot of customers.

Benyn also explains that the competition in her sector in very hard, but she hopes that the good quality and low prices of her products will help her to be one of most well-established suppliers of these goods in her community.

This entrepreneur would like to buy her own home someday, so she says she’ll keep working hard in order to reach that goal. With her loan, Benyn Mary will buy clothing and hair products in bulk to increase her supplies.

loans.use: To buy new clothing and hair products in bulk

loans.name: Silvia Iluminada

texts.en:
Silvia Iluminada is an excellent cook and the proud mother of six children. She has a many years experience cooking typical Dominican dishes, and her clientele says that she cooks like nobody’s business!

Silvia explains that this business is her main source of revenue, and that she’s been supporting her children’s studies on her own for a long time. Silvia says that sometimes it’s really hard to keep up with six children, but she’ll keep doing her best to provide a good education for her kids. Actually, Silvia thinks that a mother’s job is to "sacrifice herself" for the well being of her offspring.

This entrepreneur hopes that, as time goes by, she’ll see the results of her investments, and her kids will become important people in society. With her loan, Silvia will buy the ingredients to keep producing her delicious dishes so she can increase her revenue and improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the Dominican dishes that she prepares

loans.name: Srey Mich Yoth Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Mich Y. is the group leader of five members in Prey Taing Thnong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and she can generate a small amount of rice revenues because Mrs. Srey Mich Y. has a small cultivatable land. Mrs. Srey Mich Y. now would like to expand her plantation.

Mrs. Srey Mich Y. has decided to request a loan so that she can buy a piece of rice field to cultivate her rice during the rainy season. Mrs. Srey Mich Y. is a widow with one child who is too young to work or study. In November last year, her child got a lung disease. In order to fight this battle, she had to spend an unforeseen number of expenses.

loans.use: To obtain a loan to buy a plot of field to cultivate her rice during the rainy season.

loans.name: Srun Nhean Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srun N. is the group leader in Ro Laing Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She and her husband, Thol Thy, are farmers and together, they have four children. Two of their children are employed at a garment factory while the others are studying in state school.

The family lives in an extremely poor condition, although the family members are involved in different business activities. They now live in an old house that regularly leaks during the rainy season. Now, Mrs. Srun N. wants to build a new house for her family. Unfortunately, Mrs. Srun N. has insufficient money so she has asked for a loan to combine with the existing profit that she generates.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add with her profit that she tries to generate for many years to build her house.

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mr. Nean Keit decided to pay $8 in advance. Additionally, Mrs. Sum Kheon does $5 as an extra repayment.

This Group Has An End Of Term Loan. This Means That Principal Is Due At The End Of The Loan. AMK Allows For Pre-payments, Thus Some The Members Might Pay Some Principal Before The End Of The Loan. So Mr. Nean Keit Decided To Pay $8 In Advance.

loans.name: Thị Cúc

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thị Cúc (MS: 020025), 23 years old, raises pigs at home while her husband drives construction truck. They have 2 school aged children. The income is 100,000 VND a day. She would like to apply for a loan of 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for pigs. Her group has another member, Nguyễn Thị Hương (MS: 020023), 38 years old, who applies for a loan of the same amount as hers to buy fertilizer.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị T. Thị Cúc (MS: 020025), năm nay 23 tuổi. Chị ở nhà nuôi lợn, còn chồng chị lái xe trở vật liệu xây dựng. Chị có hai con đang đi học. Mức thu nhập binh quân của gia đình chị là 100.000 VND/ngày. Chị thích tham gia chương trình vì được trả góp. Chị vay 2.006.000 NVD về để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương (MS: 020023), năm nay 38 tuổi. Chị vay 1.062.000 VND để mua lân đạm bón cho cây trồng.

loans.use: Invest in business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Num Nheb Group

texts.en:
Six members in Sna Pich Village consist of one group that Mrs. Num N. leads. She is a grocer in the local village. Though her business activity has experienced more improvement over recent times, she now would like to expand it.

Mrs. Num N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her customers. Mrs. Num N. is 35 years old and married with four children, three of whom are enrolled in school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Mean Korng, is a farmer. Mrs. Num N. previously has obtained a loan open a grocery store in the village. (Mr. Rom M. is not presented in the photo but his wife is).

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her customers.

loans.name: Rem Nheb Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rem N. is the group leader in a group of six in Sna Pich Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 41 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are studying in state school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Ern Ek, is a construction worker. Last year, Mrs. Rem N. obtained a loan to buy fertilizers to support her plantation.

She makes roofing for houses out of palm leaves. Aside from this activity, Mrs. Rem N. is a subsistence farmer. Through her rice plantation, she has faced an unsuccessful and infertile season. Thus, Mrs. Rem N. now wants to access a loan to buy more fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.use: To access a loan to buy more fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Sareth Kang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth K. is the group leader of four members in Sna Pich Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a subsistence farmer. In this work activity, she can obtain a small amount of revenue because she has a small plot of cultivatable land. Thus, now she is asking for a loan to buy a piece of land in order to expand her plantation business.

Mrs. Sareth K. has three children, one of whom is a farmer while the other two are enrolled in school. Her husband, Mr. Sarim S., is a soldier. Mrs. Sareth K. previously obtained a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field. (Mr. Socheng S. is not available in the picture but his wife is presented).

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a piece of land in order to expand her plantation business.

loans.name: Khi Meak Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khi M. is the group leader of five members in the Sna Pich Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Khi M. is 37 years old and married with three children, two of whom are enrolling in school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Teth Suon, is a palm juice collector in the village and he usually gathers palm juice to make sugar palm and palm wine.

Mrs. Khi M. is a palm leaf sewer who combines palm leaves together to make roofing for people's houses. Aside from this activity, she is a hard-working farmer. Recently, she has been confronted with an obstacle because the field is more infertile. Mrs. Khi M. now needs to access a loan to buy more fertilizer to support her field.

loans.use: To access for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support her field.

payments.comment: This Group Has An End Of Term Loan. This Means That Principal Is Due At The End Of The Loan. AMK Allows For Pre-payments, Thus Some The Members Might Pay Some Principal Before The End Of The Loan. So Mrs. Channa Srey Decided To Pay $13 In Advance.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
A. Saodat is 39 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living growing crops such as potatoes, onions and tomatoes. Saodat’s husband helps her in the business, working from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. The business has been the main source of income for their family for the last four years, and they work very hard to give their four children a good home and to make them happy.

Saodat has applied for a loan of $600, which she will repay in six months. She will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel. This is the second loan Saodat has applied for, and she promises to repay it as faithfully as the first one.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, fuel and seeds needed to grow potatoes, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
B. Dilshod is 38 years old, married and has four children. He works as a farmer, producing crops such as watermelons, onions and wheat. He has worked his land for the last five years, and during the growing season gets help from his wife, brother and his brother's wife. Dilshod grows enough crops for his family to eat, and sells the balance to people who live in his area. By generating a stable income, Dilshod is able to support his large family.

He has as applied for a loan of $600, which he will pay back in six months. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. Dilshod thanks you for your support, and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.en:
H. Zafarjon is 24 years old, single, and makes a living as a farmer, growing crops such as onions, maize, watermelon and various vegetables. His father helps him in his business. Bekmurat’s sister and mother are pictured because Bekmurat was in a neighboring city on the day the photo was taken.

Bekmurat is thinking about getting married and raising a family. To do this, he needs to increase his business and earn enough money for the wedding. That is why he has applied for a loan of $600, which he will pay back in nine months. He will use the loan to buy materials such as fertilizer, fuel and seeds. He will also use part of the loan to pay the salaries of seasonal workers he hires. Zafarjon needs your help, and hopes that he can count on you to help him meet his goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, fuel and seeds

loans.name: Urinbek

texts.en: K. Urinbek is 28 years old, married and has two children. He supports his family by growing crops such as wheat, onions, potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers. Having worked the land for 10 years, Urinbek  has gained a lot of experience. Each year he produces enough goods for his family to eat and to sell to others. This business is his main source of income, but requires considerable funding. That is why Urinbek has applied for a loan of $600 to buy fertilizer and seeds. He will repay the loan in six months. Urinbek  and his family need your help, and he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Guljihon

texts.en:
K. Guljihon is 40 years old, married and has five children. She works as a farmer, growing crops such as wheat, potatoes, maize and onions. She also raises cattle. Her husband and older son help her in this business. The son helps with cattle-breeding and her husband with farming. Guljihon and her husband have worked their land for the last five years, and farming is their main means of support.

Guljihon has applied for a loan of $900, which she will pay back in nine months. She will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and fodder for her cattle. Guljihon promises to pay back the loan faithfully, and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and fodder for cattle

loans.name: Ram Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Ram Devi M., 33 years old, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, Nepal. Thecho is one of the beautiful, underdeveloped villages of Nepal. Most of the people of this region are poor and depend on agriculture to make a living.

Mrs. M. has two children, a daughter and a son. Her daughter took her SLC (School Leaving Certificate) exam recently, and her son is in grade 7. Her husband, Mr. Krishna Bhakta M., works in an office.

Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop four years ago She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulses, biscuits, and noodles in her shop. Her children also help her in her work. The demand for grocery goods is increasing in that area so she is requesting a loan of NPR 30,000 to buy grocery items to meet the demand.

She spends the major part of her income to give a better education to her children.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Daniyar

texts.en:
N. Daniyar is 35 years old and married. He works as a farmer, growing various crops such as wheat, onions and maize. He also raises cattle. He was been in these lines of work for 20 years, during which he has gained lots of experience. The business is the main source of income, but also requires considerable funding.

Daniyar has applied for a loan of $600, which he will pay back in six months. He will use the loan to buy materials such as seeds, fertilizer and the fodder for his cattle. He will also use part of the loan to pay the salaries of seasonal workers he hires. After gathering his harvest, he will sell his produce to nearby residents for less than they pay elsewhere. Daniyar promises to repay faithfully, and thanks everyone for support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.en:
Y. Kurbongul is 40 years old, married and has seven children. She makes a living growing crops such as potatoes, onions and tomatoes. Kurbongul’s husband and her older children help her in the business, where they work from early 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

Each year, Kurbongul grows crops sufficient for her family to eat and for selling. This business had been the main source of income for the family for the last 12 years. She and her husband work very hard to give their children a good home and to make them happy. Kurbongul is planning to cover the higher education expenses of her younger son and to arrange the marriage of her elder son. She’s asking for a loan of $600. The loan will be repaid in nine months. Kurbongul and her family are counting on your help, and your support will make a big difference in her life and the life of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to grow potatoes, onion and tomatoes

loans.name: Parween

texts.en: Parween lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow of five years and the sole breadwinner for her two sons and two daughters. She is an experienced tailor who currently works in her home, but her clients have asked her to open a tailoring shop. Thus, she seeks an individual loan to purchase the necessary startup materials and start working in her own shop, thereby providing her with more opportunities and securing her family's future. She would like to thank Kiva lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials for her shop

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa is a single woman who has been a tailor for six years. Due to reduced demand, she has found herself unable to continue. She believes that with a loan she will be able to leverage her expertise to expand her business and reach more customers, making a better future for herself.

loans.use: To expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly V. lives with his wife in Potakouy Village in the Pursat Province. V. is an ice-plane machine repairer and generates income of $8 per day. His wife, Mrs. Penh Sokha, is a porridge seller in her village. They have five children, one of whom is married. Four of their children are in school and they are responsible for school’s fee. With growing family expenses, V. works hard to expand his business as much as possible. V. is requesting a $700 loan to grow his ice-plane machine business. This will help improve his income and ability to cover family expenses.

loans.use: To expand his ice-plane machine business

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.en: Umriniso A.  is 53 years old and  is married with 6 children. Mrs. A. Umriniso lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan that is famous for its beautiful fabrics and dressmaking. She has 2 years of experience selling fabrics but has 15 years of general selling experience.  She has a good and harmonious family; her children help her with her home business and her husband is a collective farmer. Mrs. A. Umriniso applies to KIVA for help. She requests a loan for further business development and the new displays that will allow her to increase  turnover. Mrs. A. Umriniso requires the loan of 1800 TJS for 8 months. She thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Business development and new displays.

loans.name: Sareth Muth Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth M. is the group leader of four members in the Chey Bak Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a housewife and she always cooks food for her children. She is 50 years old and a widow of three children, one of whO. is employed at a garment factory while another one is a primary school teacher. The youngest is studying in state school.

Mrs. Sareth M. and her children live in small house. Additionally, her house is old and the roof always leaks during rainy season. Now, Mrs. Sareth M. is asking for a loan to build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to build a new house.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #48337

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en: Mehriniso A.  lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan and she is married with 5 children. Mrs. A. Mehriniso has been engaged in business for 6 years and has the appropriate knowledge and skills that can help her to develop her business further. Mehriniso started the business from scratch but now she has a trade outlet to sell her food products. Her goods include the milk products, vegetable oil, sweets, flour products and sugar. Mrs. Mehriniso A. applies to KIVA with a request for a business development loan of 2100 TJS for 8 months. The loan will help to increase her food assortment and help her open a new meat products department.

loans.use: To increase her food assortment and help her open a new meat products department.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #48338

loans.name: Sokha Sim Group

texts.en:
Four members in the Prey Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province will be formed as one group. Mr. Sokha S. is the group leader and he is also a bicycle repairer in the village. In his business activity, he has an inadequate amount of money to buy more bike equipment.

Thus, he now is asking for a loan for this purpose. He is 28 years old and the father of three children, all of whom are too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Yon Deourn, is a housewife.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more bicycle equipment.

loans.name: Hai Tarawa 2018-1 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is 36-year-old Rejoice P., who sells breads. She and her husband have four children ranging from age 7 to 18 who attend school. Each week Rejoice makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Rejoice is joined in her small group by Joice G., Modong C., Roda R., and Rose L.. Joice G. has a grocery business and wants to construct an oven. Modong C. currently sells beer and wants a loan to construct a shop. Roda R. operates a business brewing alcohol and wants to open up a bar. Rose L. currently sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Huot Eit Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huot E. is the group leader of four members in the Banh Chhkol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a clay pot maker. Aside from this, she is also a firewood seller. Mrs. Huot E. is 59 years old and the mother of one child who is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Mut Rith, is a subsistence farmer and he also assists his wife work.

Though her business activities have improved over the years, she now wants to expand her business. Consequently, she asked for a loan to buy more clay to make additional pots and buy firewood to re-sell.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more clay to make more pots and buy firewood to re-sell.

loans.name: Islom

texts.en: Islom B. has been engaged in the livestock business for 5 years. He learned special skills from his father a s a young boy. Islom is a very good family man. He has a good flock (a pedigree bull and a milk cow). Mr. B. Islom is engaged both raising and selling livestock.  It is a part-time business because Islom is a schoolteacher and works in the rural school. Mr. Islom B.  has a good reputation. Now Mr. B. applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 1800 TJS for 8 months. The loan will be used to purchase rams and develop a sheep business He thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA offers to  small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Sheep business development

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en: Erkin B. lives in the high-mountain region of  Tajikistan where agriculture and livestock is a primary business. Erkin is married and has 3 children. He is a respectable man on the collective farm because he is very hard-working  and a good family man. His wife works as a dressmaker and he works on the collective farm but since it is seasonal work he is engaged in the livestock business as well. Mr. B.  applies to KIVA with a loan request of 2100 TJS for 6 months. The loan will be used to purchase pedigree bulls and increase his flock.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull and increase the flock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To open up a bar.

loans.name: Jurabeck

texts.en: Jurabeck S. has been a client of the MicroInvest since 2008. The first loan taken helped him to develop the business and he was able to replay the loan on time. Now Mr. S.  has a trade outlet for selling fabric for dressmaking. He works with the suppliers from Istaravshan so he has the opportunity to sell for prices that are lower than the bazaar prices. He has many customers and has experience in this business for 8 years. He had previously worked as a schoolteacher. Mr. S. Jurabeck concurrently works in the collective farm. He is married and has 3 children. Now Mr. S. Jurabeck applies to KIVA for a loan to develop his business. Mr. S. Jurabeck requests a loan of 1800 TJS for 8 months. He thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA offers to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: business development and the new sort of material presentation

loans.name: Nazriniso

texts.en: A. Nazriniso has been the client of the MicroInvest since 2008. Her first loan helped her to develop the business and she was able to return her loan on time. Now Mrs. A. Nazriniso has a trade outlet for selling fabric for dressmaking. She sells her fabric for prices that are less than the bazaar prices so she has many customers. She works on the collective farm but the work is seasonal so she is concentrating on selling fabrics for dresses. She is married and has 2 children. Mrs. A. Nazriniso applies to KIVA for a loan to further the development of her business.  Mrs. A. Nazriniso requires the loan of 1800 TJS for 8 months. She thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA provides to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Business development of fabric selling

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 25 years old and is an unmarried woman. She has been sewing children’s school dresses for 1 year now. Stella wants to use her loan to buy more school uniforms and sewing accessories to expand her operations and also to enable her to start saving. She is a member of the group called Quality. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Tulkinjon

texts.en: Tulkinjon B.  lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan and he is married with 3 children. Mr. B. Tulkinjon is engaged in business for 5 years and has the appropriate knowledge and skills that has helped him to develop business. Tulkinjon started the business  from the scratch but now he has a trade outlet for selling food products. He has a good assortment and many customers. He sells different goods including  milk products, vegetable oil, sweets, flour products and sugar. Tulkinjon applies to  KIVA with a request for a  business development loan of 2800 TJS for 10 months. The loan will be used to increase his assortment of items for sale and to open a meat products department..

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase his assortment of items for sale and to open a meat products department..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more clothing for sale

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is 64 years old and the mother of 4 children. She has 1 grandchild who she is taking care of. Akosua has been selling vegetables like tomatoes, garden eggs, peas, onions, tilapia, etc in the family house and the community market for 10 years now. She wants to use her loan to buy more palm and vegetable oils, vegetables, and tilapia to increase her inventory and also to avoid price hikes. She is a member of the group called Quality. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables like tomatoes, garden eggs, gallons of vegetable oil, etc

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.en: Abdullo N.  has been an active client of the MicroInvest since 2007. The business development and profit increases have helped him to return the previous loans and  develop his business significantly. Mr. Abdullo N.  is 59 years old and he lives in the Asht region and has a family of 6 children. He has been engaged in his business for 15 years. He started the business from his household and he now trades from an outlet in furnishings, towels and other items. He has many customers because he is one of the most respected men on the collective farm. Abdullo applies to KIVA for  help. He requests a loan to increase and improve his business by importing new goods. Mr. N. Abdullo requires a loan of 2800 TJS for 10 months. He thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to  small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Business development and importation of new goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more eggs for sale

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.en: Kahramon J.  is 43 years old and  is married with 6 children. Kahramon has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008 but is a reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure.  Kahramon has been engaged in the livestock business for 6 years but he had learned  good and special skills as a child from his father. Mr. Kahramon J.  is a very good family man. He has a pedigree bull and a milk cow. Mr. J. Kahramon is engaged raisin and selling livestock. This is a part time business as his full time job is as a  professional accountant  for the collective farm. Mr. J. Kahramon has a good reputation and applies to KIVA for a  business development loan of 1900 TJS for 7 months. The loan will be used to purchase rams and develop his sheep business.He thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to  small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase rams and develop his sheep business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more clothing for sale

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Pheng S. and her husband live in Moan Heur Village in the Kampong Cham Province. They are farmers and they generate an average income of $1 per day combined. They live with two, small children who are in school. The rainy season is coming, and they have to start grow their crops of potato, so they are requesting a loan to pay for plowing the field and purchasing seeds. The loan will enable them to produce a better farming yield that will generate more income and help with their family support.

loans.use: To pay for plowing a field and purchasing seeds

loans.name: Obijon

texts.en: Obijon U. lives in the high-mountain region of Tajikistan where agriculture and raising livestock are prominent businesses. It is one of the main businesses in the Asht region.  Obijon is married and has 2 children. He and his wife work on the collective farm but since it is seasonal work, they are also engaged in raising livestock.  Now Mr. U.  applies to KIVA with a request for a business development loan of 1900 TJS for 7 months. The loan will be used to purchase pedigree bulls and increase his flock.

loans.use: To purchase pedigree bulls and increase the size of his flock.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 32 year old entrepreneur. He lives in Kisumu in Kenya with his wife and four children, three of whom are in school. He is the proprietor of a small shop that he started three years ago. He sells daily necessities, like bread, sugar, flour, cooking oil and soap.

Micheal's daily income has increased 100% in the last year and he managed to save a bit of his profits. He plans to move his business to a larger and more lucrative location with his next loan of $600.00 and also obtain additional supplies that are in high demand within his community.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand his shop and obtain additional supplies

loans.name: Otabeck

texts.en: Otabeck M.  lives in the high-mountain region of  Tajikistan where  agriculture and livestock is a very prominent business. It is one of the main businesses in the Asht region. Mr. M. is married and has 2 children. He is a very hard-working man and a good family man. He and his wife work on the collective farm but since it is seasonal work, they are also engaged in livestock. Now Mr. Otabeck M.  applies to KIVA with a request for a business development loan of 1900 TJS for 7 months. The loan will be used to purchase a milking cow and to begin  a milk-sour business.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow and to begin  a milk-sour business.

loans.name: St Kizito 2019-3 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is 40-year-old Rejoice P., who operates a retail business and is requesting a loan to expand. She and her husband, a watchman, have five children ranging in age from 10 to 20 who attend school. Each week Rejoice makes approximately 90 Sudanese pounds in profits, and with the extra profits that will accrue from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

Rejoice is joined in her small group by Jioce D., Margaret J., Joice K., and Monica L.. Jioce D. has a business selling at the restaurant and wants to construct houses to rent. Margaret J. is currently operating a business selling breads and wants a loan to stock other goods for sale. Joice K. sells sugar and wants to open up a shop. Monica L. is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To expand the business.
