loans.name: Sorahon

texts.en: M. Sorahon lives in the Asht region. As many of her fellow villagers, she is engaged with livestock. It is a family business but she is responsible for her own duties. Mrs. M. Sorahon is responsible for the taking care of the animals and its milk production and sour products making. It is  very hard work so her children help out. Mrs. M. Sorahon is married and has 4 children. She also works on the collective farm. She works hard to ensure a good future for her children. Now Mrs. M. Sorahon applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 1900 TJS for 7 months. She will use the loan to purchase special modernized equipment  for milk processing and milk-sour products production.

loans.use: To purchase special modernized equipment  for milk processing and  milk-sour products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30 year old entrepreneur. She lives in Kisumu in Kenya with her husband and three school-age children. She set up a fruit and vegetable stall near her home early last year. Her hard work and determination have led to her success within this one year period. She manages her stall during the day and also offers hair dressing services to her established clients in the evenings.

Her profits pay the household expenses as well as her children's school fees. Mary plans to use the funds from her next loan of $600.00 to increase her stock of vegetables, establish a new beauty salon kiosk, and save the remaining amount to use in case of of emergencies.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of vegetables and establish a new beauty salon kiosk.

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.en: Musharaf M.  has been an active client of the MicroInvest since 2002. She is very reliable and respects the loan procedures of  MicroInvest. The stability of her clothing business helped her to return the previous loans and to improve on the business terms of the loan. She started her business practically from the scratch but thanks to the financial support of the MicroInvest loans she has been able to open her own trading outlet in a popular bazaar.  She trades men's, women's and children's clothing and has a rather good assortment so she has many customers who are loyal and only buy from her.  Now Mrs. M. Musharaf applies to KIVA with a request for financial support. She requests a loan pf 2500 TJS for 7 months to expand the existing trade area.

loans.use: To broaden the existing trade area.

loans.name: Rahmonazar

texts.en: Rahmonazar S. is 40 years old and he is married and has 3 children. He lives in the high-mountain region of Tajikistan where there is a focus on agriculture and livestock. It is one of the main directions in the business development of the Asht region. He is a very hard-working man and a good family man. He works as a carpenter and his wife works on the collective farm but since that work is seasonal he also is engaged in raising livestock. Rahmonazar has the appropriate skills and a love for animals that brought him to raising livestock. He now requests a loan of 2100 TJS for 8 months to purchase pedigree bulls and increase the size of his flock.

loans.use: To purchase pedigree bulls and increase the size of his flock.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 27 year old entrepreneur and mother of four school-aged children. She and her husband live in Kisumu in Kenya. She began her current business selling second-hand clothes three years ago. She specializes in women’s clothing: skirts, dresses, and casual and formal tops. She is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale prices. And the prime location of her business on a busy street, three years of experience, and friendly interaction with customers have established a good client base. Her customers return to her shop for her wide selection or to make requests for certain styles.

Jacinta plans to expand her business with her next loan of $600.00. She will use the loan to increase her current stock of second-hand clothes and save the remaining funds in a savings account so that she may continue to purchase new stock even when cash flow slows due to delays in customer payments.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock of second hand clothes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 34 year old mother of three school-aged children. She is the proprietor of a beauty salon located in Nyalenda in the Kisumu area of Kenya. She started her salon in 1997 from her small savings.

She requires $500 so that she can move to a bigger space and also purchase cosmetics and other materials for her salon.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To move her salon into a bigger space and purchase more cosmetics and other materials.

loans.name: Ohunjon

texts.en: Ohunjon U.  lives in the high-mountain region of Tajikistan where there is a focus on agriculture and livestock. It is one of the main directions in the business development of the Asht region. Ohunjon is married and has 2 children. He is a very hard-working man and a good family man. He and his wife work in the collective farm but since that work is seasonal he also is engaged in raising livestock. Ohunjon has the appropriate skills and the love for animals that brought him to raising livestock. He now requests a loan of 2100 TJS for 6 months to purchase a pedigree bull and increase  the size of his flock.

loans.use: To purchase pedigree bulls and increase the size of the flock.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 32 year old mother of nine children. She lives in one of the slums of Kisumu in Kenya and runs a community pharmacy in the area. She started her pharmacy in 2001 and the community knows her personally from her seven years of good work. Dina was trained by KMET as a community health worker and has also been providing home-based care services for people living with HIV/AIDS for these past seven years.

She sells her drugs at lower prices than her competitors and at times gives free drugs to clients who cannot afford them. Her highest selling products are painkillers, antimalarials, family planning drugs, allergy medications, drugs to treat ulcers, worms and skin infections, and various syrups for children to treat malaria and upper respiratory infections. Dina is applying for her fifth loan of $700 to further expand her pharmacy.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand her community pharmacy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more clothing for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Mr. Chi J. is a 26-year-old fisherman who supplements his income by driving a motorbike taxi. He earns an average of about $5 per day. J. lives with his 25-year-old wife, Yem Sangom, and his four children in the Veal Village, Siem Reap Province. J. works hard to support his family’s living expenses. He is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more fishing tools, which will help him expand his fishing catch and improve his income.

loans.use: To enlarge his fishing business by purchasing more fishing tools

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela O. is a very active 40 year old member of her community. She has lived in one of the slums of Kisumu in Kenya for the past fifteen years. In 1997, she was trained by KMET in home-based care for people living with HIV/AIDS, TB ambassadorship, and community-based distribution of oral contraceptives.

Pamela is very well-known within her community for her compassionate work. Her main business and source of income, however, is a community pharmacy that she's managed for the past fourteen years. Given her reputation and the location of her pharmacy within her community, her business has flourished. The most commonly purchased drugs are those to treat malaria, diarrhea, asthma, and upper respiratory infections. Pamela credits her success to hard work and the assistance she has received from KMET through three previous microfinance loans. She plans to use the funds from her next loan of $700.00 to purchase stock of drugs in bulk.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Purchase stock of drugs for her community pharmacy.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is 42 years old and the married mother of 3 children, who are currently in school. She has been preparing and selling cooked rice, yams, and assorted biscuits for schoolchildren in her village for 8 years now. Paulina wants to use her loan to buy more bags of rice, crates of eggs, frozen foods, and more tubers of fresh yams. Paulina is a member of the group called Quality. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, tubers of fresh yams, vegetables, and frozen foods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more clothing for sale

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi is a proud father of 2 children. He is 35 years old and a married man. He sells cosmetics like roll on, deodorant sprays, face and body powders, etc. Kofi wants to use his loan to buy more boxes of cosmetics to increase his inventory and also to avoid price hikes. He hopes this loan will help increase his income to enable him to rent a store to trade, since he currently hawks his goods. He is a member of the group called Quality. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy boxes of cosmetics

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda is 28 years old and has 1 child. She has been operating a stationery store for 2 years now. She also sells cement and batik materials. The selling of cement is necessary as members of her community are building houses and other structures that need cement. She wants to use the loan to buy more stationery for the schoolchildren in her village and also to avoid price hikes. She is a member of the group called Quality. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan. Matilda is holding her baby girl in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more stationery items like books, pens, pencils, drawing papers, etc

loans.name: Komila

texts.en: Komila  O. lives in the Asht region. As are so many of her fellow many villagers, she is engaged with dairy production from livestock. It is a family business but she has her own duties. Komila is responsible for taking care of the animals, milk production and sour products making. It is  very difficult work but she is willing and able to to work hard to ensure a good future. She also works as a schoolteacher. Mrs. O. Komila applies to KIVA for a  business development loan of 2100 TJS  to be repaid in 8 months. The loan will be used to purchase special modernized equipment for milk processing and milk-sour products making.

loans.use: The purchase of special modernized equipment for milk processing and milk-sour products making.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #48378

loans.name: Mwesigwa Development Group

texts.en: Betty K., the chairperson of Mwesigwa Development Group in Seeta, Uganda, is a married woman with three children attending secondary school.  She also cares for her late sister’s child.  For four years she has managed a business car parts from a garage next to Seeta police post.  She buys the car parts from Kampala City. She works with her husband, who supports her role as a member of the lending group.  In turn, Betty is happy to be part of the lending group because her business is running smoothly thanks to the help of a loan.  To further develop businesses, the Mwesiga Development Group is applying for a loan of $5,000, which will be distributed amongst 24 entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy more car parts for the shop.

loans.name: Simmons Group

texts.en:
Robert D. is the leader of Simmons Group. He is 41 years old and has 4 children. Three of the children are currently in school. Robert operates a pharmaceutical store, where he sells drugs like pain killers, antimalarial drugs, cough mixtures, antacids, etc. Other members of the group trade various products like maize, vegetable oils, detergents, cooked rice, and dried fish. The members want to use the loan to buy more products to increase inventories and also to avoid price hikes. Gifty G. is not in the picture because when the photo was taken she had gone to the farm.

Members guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical drugs, maize, dried fish, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Sadi.

texts.ru:
Sadi B. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 27 years okd, is married and has 2 children. He has been raising livestock for four years. He owns several young bulls which he fattens and sells. Right now he needs to purchase a cow which will provide milk. He needs a loan to do this. This will increase his livestock count and will give him the opportunity to earn additional profits. Sadi will pay back the loan over a 5 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобокалонов Сади проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 27 лет, женат и имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Четыре года он занимается животноводством.Имеет несколько голов молодых бычков, которых откармливает и продает. Сейчас ему необходимо купить корову , которая будет давать молоко. Для этого ему необходимо получить кредит.Это поможет ему увеличить поголовье скота и получить возможность увеличить дополнительный доход. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 5 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more clothing for sale

loans.name: Holmahmad

texts.ru:
Holmahmad B. lives in the Khuroson region. He lives in one of the isolated villages of this region. He lives with his family and owns a small store where he sells food and other products. Holmahmad would like to increase his product assortment by getting a loan and purchasing new products. He will pay back the loan over a 5 month period. By increasing his inventory Holmahmad will be able to help local residents to purchase products without leaving their region.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобокалонов Холмахмад житель Хуросонского района. Проживает в одном из отдаленных кишлаков данного района. Живет со своей семьей. Занимается торговлей. Имеет свой минимагазин, где торгует продуктами питания и другими промышленными товарами. Хочет увеличить ассортимент товара, путем получения кредита и ввоза нового товара. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 5 месяцев.Увеличив тварооборот , он сможет помочь населению покупать товар не выезжая за приделы района.

loans.use: Increase Product Assortment

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: expand the business

loans.name: Jabbor

texts.ru:
Jabbor T. lives in Dushanbe. He is 49 years old, is married and has 3 children. He has a secondary-professional education and is a driver by profession. He has been driving a taxi for 8 years. Jabbor’s car needs major repairs and he needs money in order to perform them. He has turned to our organization for a loan of $1000. This will help him to ensure that his car works without breaking. Jabbor will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Тошматов Джабор Рахимович житель города Душанбе. Возраст 49 лет.Женат и имеет 3 детей. Имеет средне –профессиональное образование , по специальности водитель. Работает водителем такси уже 8 лет. Его автомобиль требует капитального ремонта. Но на это ему необходимы деньги. Для этого он обратился в нашу организацию для получения кредита в размере 1000 долларов США.Это поможет ему обеспечить себе бесперебойную работу автомобиля. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Car Repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more clothing for sale

loans.name: Sirojidin

texts.ru:
Sirojidin R. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 42 years old, is married and has 5 children. In order to provide for his family Sirojidin raises livestock. He purchases young calves, fattens them and resells them at the same markets. He has been in this business for 15 years. Almost the entire population of the rural area is in this business. Sirojidin would like to get a loan and increase the headcount of his livestock. This will allow him to increase the income for his family. Sirojidin plans to pay back the loan over a 6 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Раджабов Сироджиддин проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 42 года. Женат и имеет 5 детей. Чтобы обеспечить свою семью клиент занимается животнводством. Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на тех же рынках. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет.Почти все население сельской местности занимается этим видом бизнеса. Поэтому клиент планирует получить кредит и увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет ему увеличить доход для своей семьи. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Sivet

texts.en:
Mrs. Sivet S. and her husband, Mr. Saran Khan were married in 2001 and have one child. The couple is in the process of building their house (see picture). Before that they lived with their parents. The family is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sivet is in the business of selling Chinese noodles and meal at her shop in the village. Her husband has been an English teacher for eleven years. Now the couple needs some money to finish their house. So, Sivet is requesting a loan of US$1000 to finish their house.

loans.use: To build her house

loans.name: Zarobuddin.

texts.ru:
Zarobuddin D. lives in Abdurahmon Jomi. He is 27 years old, is married and does not have children. Zarobuddin has a high school education and sells food. He has a small store where he sells his products. He brings products from Dushanbe. Zarobuddin has been in this business for 3 years and would like to increase his inventory. He needs a loan to do that and this is why he has turned to us. Zarobuddin will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

By getting new products, the client will not only increase his own income, but will also provide local residents with food products. Because Zarobuddin’s village is very far from the city, his business will help local residents.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Давлатов Заробуддин житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 27 лет. Женат детей не имеет. Имеет среднее образование.Занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Имеет небольшой магазин , где реализует товар. Привозит товар из города Душанбе. Торгует уже 3 года. Хочет увеличить товарооборот . Для этого ему необходимо получить кредит и поэтому он обратился к нам. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев. В случае постуцпления нового товара , кроме того , что он сможет увеличить собственные доходы , клиент так же сможет обеспечить население продуктами питания. Так как его кишлак находится очень далеко от города его деятельность поможет населению.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin C. and his wife, Mrs. Poe Dany were married  this year. The couple is living with their parents. His wife has been factory worker for four years. The family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Chin has been a construction worker for three years. Now he wants to create another business is running motor taxi when free from construction work. Chin is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for running a motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for running a motor taxi.

loans.name: Mirzonazir

texts.ru:
Mirzonazir Abdulazizovich N. lives in Abdurahmon Jomi district with his family. He is married and has two children. After finishing school, Mirzonazir started a business selling cattle. He buys calves, fattens them up and then sells them to butchers. He has been in this business for six years, and it brings him a modest income that allows him to feed his family. However, in order to increase his income, Mirzonazir needs a loan to buy a few more calves. He will fatten them up and sell them for meat, allowing him to provide the local markets with high quality meat. Mirzonazir plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Назаров Мирзоназир Абдулазизович живет в районе Абдурахмони Джоми.Проживает со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Закончил школу и занялся бизнесом. Торгует бычками. Предварительно скупив , он их откармливает и продает мясникам на мясо. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже шесть лет. Эта деятельность приносит ему небольшой доход , который позволяет ему прокормить свою семью. Но для того . чтобы увеличить доход он хочет получить кредит и купить еще несколько молодых телят. Он их откормит и так же продаст на мясо, что позволит ему обеспечить рынки полноценным мясом. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase his number of head

loans.name: New Canada 2009-3 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is 28-year-old Margaret D., who is requesting a loan to expand her bread-selling business. Margaret is married and has four school-going children ranging from age 10 to 15. Each week, she makes approximately 360 Sudanese pounds in profits, and with the extra profits that will result from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children’s school fees.

Margaret is joined in her small group by Pita A., Mary J., and Rejina S.. Pita A. has a business in selling vegetables and wants to buy a car. Mary J. is currently operating a business in selling at the hotel and wants a loan to expand. Rejina S. operates a business selling charcoal and also wants to expand.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal M. is a widow with six children. Five of her children are married and live outside the family home. The youngest daughter is living with her and assisting in her business. The family lives along Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophal has been in the business of selling flowers and bananas for over twenty years. She buys them from farmers in her village to resell at market in Phnom Penh.  Sophal  is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase more flowers and bananas to resell.

loans.use: To purchase flowers and bananas to resell.

loans.name: Theab

texts.en:
Mrs. Theab L. and her husband, Mr. Samphorn Bun were married in 1982 and have five children, two sons and three daughters. Their sons have full time employment and two of her daughters are in school. The youngest one stays at home. Samphorn has been a mason since 1985. The family is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Theab has been growing rice since 1985. Her farm is a bit far from her house. Rice’s price is increasing and it is a good time for her to expand her business. Now she is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay fees for workers in her business of growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay fees for workers in growing rice.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap T. and her husband, Mr. Hoeun Hong were married in 1999 with no children. The couple lives on an Island in the Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Hoeun has been a wood carver for many years. He buys wood for carving by himself at home and sell the products to a wholesaler in Phnom Penh. 

Sopheap has been silk weaver for ten years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Sopheap is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase silk material for weaving and purchase wood for her husband's carving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and purchase wood for her husband's wood carving business.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov K., 44, and her husband, Mr. An Nov, have been married over twenty years and have seven children. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home. One of her daughters is in school and the other one has mental problems and stays at home.  An grows jicamas and corn in the farm a distance from home. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Pov has been a weaver since she was fourteen years old. It’s skill she learned from a relative. She sells their finished products to the middleman in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai Y., 52, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Nou, 54, were married in 1976 and have seven children, three sons and four daughters. Two of their children are in school and the others have full time employment and weave silk at home.  Sophal grows tomatoes, papayas, and eggplant in the farm near the house. He sells the products to a wholesaler in the village. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Lai has been a weaver since she was fourteen years old. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells their finished products to the middleman in the village who will sell it in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her children ride to work in Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children ride to work in Phnom Penh.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok S. is a painter and a tailor and he is married with seven children. He previously applied for a loan from Kiva to purchase a sewing machine, sewing threads and other tools for his tailoring business. That first loan was successfully repaid, and now Mr. Sok S. is requesting another loan to purchase construction tools and a blow torch to help his children's work.  The remainder of the loan will be used to further expand his business. He is very excited to be able to grow his income with these loans.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools and a blow torch

loans.name: Ratana

texts.en:
Mr. Ratana C., 44, and his wife, Mrs. Mom Un, 41, were married in 1989 and have five children, three sons and two daughters. Two of their children have full time employment in Phnom Penh and another one is in school . The two youngest stay at home. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ratana has been a weaver since 1985. It’s skill he learned from his parents. He also taugt  his wife to be come a weaver in 1998. The couple sells their finished products to the middle man in the village who sells them in Phnom Penh. 

Ratana is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk material for weaving and tor fill in the land round his house because it floods in the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and fill in the land around the house.

loans.name: Sreyrath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyrath I. and her husband were married in 1993 and have three children, one son and two daughters. All of her children are in school. Her husband has been a mason since 1993. Now he is working in Phnom Penh City. The family lives on an Island in the  Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sreyrath has been a weaver since she was fifteen years old. It’s skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who sells them in Phnom Penh. 

She is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Kak

texts.en: Mrs. Kak P., 33, is a mother of two children and lives in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. This loan is her second loan with Kiva and she will use this loan to purchase more grocery products to keep her business growing. She is very impressed with the impact of the loan on her business, and she has seen that the more products she has in her inventory, the more she can fulfill her customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more gorcery products and to reinvest in her business.

loans.name: Vun

texts.en:
Vun Y. (pictured with her daughter), 44, and her husband were married when she was 17 years old and have six children, three sons and three daughters. Two of her children are married, one of whom weaves silk at home, two of her daughters have full time employment in Phnom Penh, and the other two are in school. Her husband is a wooden house repairer and does fishing. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Vun has been a weaver since 1980. It’s skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who  sells them in Phnom Penh. Besides weaving, she also sells fish in the village.

Vun is requesting a loan of US$350 to purchase silk material for her daughter (pictured with her) to weave silk and to buy planks to repair the wall of her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her daughter’s weaving and buy planks to repair the wall of her house.

loans.name: Sam-Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-un  V., 41, and her husband were married in 1984 and have five two sons and three daughters. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. One of daughters works in a garment factory and other two children are in school. Her husband has been a mechanic for over ten years. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sam-un has been in the business of selling fruits, fishes, and vegetables such as tomatoes and cucumbers since 1984. She buys them from farmers in her village to resell at the market in Phnom Penh. Now is in that mangoes ar in season, Sam-Un needs some money to buy mangoes from farmers on contract (pay money first before harvesting).

She is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase mangoes on contract from farmers  for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes on a contract from a farmer for resale.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhun P. is married with five children and works selling fish at a market. On average she can typically make around $5 each day in revenue. Her husband has worked as a fisherman and a farmer growing rice crops and vegetables since 1980, earning about $5 per day as well. One of her children is employed by a garment factory, making about $70 to $80 each month and the rest of her children are enrolled in school. Mrs. Chhun P. has applied for a loan from KIVA to purchase more fish for her business.
( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Chhun P. is not available).

loans.use: To purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Sam-Ath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-Ath M., 49, and her husband, Mr. Nat Mak, 48, were married in 1986 and have five children; four sons and one daughter. All of their children are in school. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sam-Ath has been a weaver since 1979. It’s skill she learned from her parents and she also taught her husband to becme a weaver in 1997. Beside weaving, her husband also raises pigs and produces  rice wine as well. The couple sells their finish products to the middleman in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Sam-Ath is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Phou

texts.en:
Mrs. Phou L. is 56-year-old mother of one child. She owns an at-home stand selling pork/chicken rice and coffee to serve to the people in her community for their breakfast. NormalL., she can earn about $10/day in revenue. Her husband is employed as a policeman, earning $2/day. 
Mrs. Phou L. would like to expand her stand and provide more services to her excellent customers. She needs more utensils and equipment such as chairs, tables cloths, tables, and so on. She is requesting a loan to purchase this additional equipment, and she is very excited about expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for her business.

loans.name: Bunneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunneang K. and her husband, Mr. Ngoun Men were married in 1985 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. Two of their children have full time employment and other two children are in school. Mr. Ngoun Men has been a taxi driver since 1979. He drives in Phnom Penh and other provinces. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Bunneang has been in the business of selling groceries for three years. She bought grocery items from the Ta Khmao Market to resell at her shop in front of her house. The shop is very old and broken so she needs some money to rebuild it. Now she is requesting a loan of US$600 to rebuild her shop to sell grocery items.

loans.use: To rebuild her shop for selling grocery items.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat L., 41, and her husband, Mr. Sarem Saum have been married for twenty years and have six children; three sons and three daughters. Three of her children are in school and the other three children work in a garment factory.  Sarem grows rice on his farm about 7 kilometers from the house. He also does construction work when he is not rice farming. The family lives in an old house about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophat started her business of selling dessert many years ago. She sells many kinds of Cambodian dessert made from corn, bananas, bean, and sticky rice. She cooks them at home for sell at Prek Phnao Market about five kilometers from her house. Now she is requesting a loan of US$500 to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna S. and her husband, Mr. Sou EK were married in 1980 and have four sons and two daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home.  Two other sons help them in growing flowers and one daughter is in school. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River a tributary of the nearby Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Vanna has been in the business of growing flowers for many years. She grows jasmine flowers on her farm near her house. Her husband is in the business of renting musical  instruments and small generators to villagers.

Vanna is requesting a loan of US$600 for growing flowers.

loans.use: For growing flowers.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap P. and her husband were married in 1988. They have three children, one son and two daughters. All of their children are in school. The family lives across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sopheap has been a weaver since 2005. It’s skill she learned from a relative. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband works for an organization in Battam Bong province.

She is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Srean

texts.en:
Mr. Srean S. and his wife were married in 2002. They have two little sons. His wife, Mrs. Vanny SEAM has been a weaver for ten years. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. The family lives across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Srean has been a motorcycle repairer for seven years. He buys motorcycle spare part from market in Phnom Penh for sell at his motorcycle’s repairing shop in front of his house. Now, he is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase motorcycle spare parts for his business of repairing motorcycles.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for the business of repairing motorcycles.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mr. Em C., 65, and his wife, Mrs. Nut SOUN, 53, were married in 1972. They have three sons, one of whom weaves mosquito nets at home. The other two of  are masons. And their only daughter has full time employment. The family lives across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Em and his wife have been mosquito net weavers since 1985. He is in his middle 60s but still strong enough to work. They sell the finished products to the middleman in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Now, Em is requesting a loan of US$1100 to purchase a looming semi machine for weaving mosquito nets.

loans.use: To purchase a looming semi machine for weaving mosquito nets.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is a married mother of four. Because her husband cannot find work, the economic well-being of her family depends upon selling the milk of her three cows at the bazaar. Habiba is seeking a loan to buy more dairy cows and expand production, allowing her to bring more milk to market; this will provide a greater degree of income stability for her family and establish a sustainable business for the future of her and her children.

loans.use: To expand her dairy cattle stock.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin M., 55, is widow with six children; five sons and one daughter. Her husband died in 1965. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home. Of the other three children, one has full time employment, another one  raises cows  at home, and the last one is in school. The family lives on an Island in the  Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

 Rin has been a weaver since 2005. It’s skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh. Before started this business she sold Khmer noodles and sweets in the village.

Now Rin is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase silk material for weaving and to fill in the land around her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and fill in the land a round her house.

loans.name: Vanret

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanret D., 27, and her husband, Mr. Chhounvy Khim, were married in 2003. They have one daughter. Her husband has been a mechanic and mason since 2003. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Vanret has been a weaver since she was sixteen years old. It’s skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flower seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rose seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more raw materials for production of a local drink

loans.name: Ishmeal

texts.en:
Ishmeal I. is a distiller of a local drink. He is married and has 5 children. His wife is a petty trader. Business is doing very well, and he wishes to increase production and sales.

He is asking for additional capital to buy more raw materials for production of a local drink.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more raw materials for production of a local drink

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. is a distiller of a local drink. He is married and has 4 children. Business is doing very well, and he wishes to increase production and sales.

He is asking for additional capital to buy more raw materials for production of a local drink.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more raw materials for production of a local drink

loans.name: Eseosa

texts.en: Eseosa E. has been in business since 1993. She is married with four children and is 39 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells bread and needs a loan of $600 to buy more bread for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Eseosa

texts.en: Eseosa O. is married and is 32 years old. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells wrappers and has been in this business for past 5 years. She is a LAPO client. She needs a loan $700 to buy more wrappers for sale.

loans.use: To buy more wrappers for sale

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian A. is married with a child. She is 34 years old and hails from Edo state, Nigeria. She sells clothes, body creams, shoes, and bags. She has been in business since 2004. She needs a loan of $350 to buy mother care products to sell.

loans.use: To buy mother care products for sale

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas O. is 40 years old, married with 5 children. She sells local gin and palm oil. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria and needs a loan $350 to buy more palm oil to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more oil and local gin to sell

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas O. is 40 years old, married with 5 children. She sells local gin and palm oil. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria and needs a loan of $350 to buy more palm oil for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more oil and local gin for sales

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth O. is 54 years old, married, with 6 children. She sells provisions and food. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2003. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more provisions and food for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions and food for sale

loans.name: Agripina's Group

texts.es:
Agripina, Eulogia and Eugenia belong to the San Miguel de Ayacucho Communal Bank. The associates are from the community that has the same name. It is in a small valley where the majority of the settlers are dedicated to the cultivation of vegetables.

Agripina is married, 44 years old and has 3 children. On the other hand, Eulogia is married, 30 years old and has 2 children. Eugenia lives in a shared home, is 37 years old and has 3 children.

Agripina, Eulogia and Eugenia are dedicated to the cultivation of diverse vegetables, that subsequently they sell wholesale in the supplies market of the city of Ayacucho.

Agripina, Eulogia and Eugenia need loans of 1500 soles, 600 soles, and 600 soles, respectively; money that will be invested in the purchase of agricultural supplements, seeds and remedies to control illnesses.

The dreams of Agripina, Eulogia and Eugenia are that their children become professionals and they improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Agripina, Eulogia y Eugenia pertenecen al Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho, las socias son de la comunidad que tiene el mismo nombre, es un valle pequeño donde la mayoría de sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura de verduras.

Agripina es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, por otro lado Eulogia es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, mientras que Eugenia es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos.

Agripina, Eulogia y Eugenia se dedican a la agricultura de verduras diversas, que posteriormente venden por mayor en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Agripina, Eulogia y Eugenia necesitan préstamos de 1500 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de abonos, semillas y remedios para controlar las enfermedades.

Los sueños de Agripina, Eulogia y Eugenia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds and remedies to control illnesses for their vegatable crop.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria Jesus belongs to the San Miguel of Ayacucho Communal Bank. She is from the community that has the same name. It is in a small valley where the majority of the settlers are dedicated to the cultivation of vegetables.

Maria is married, 41 years old and has 7 children. Maria is dedicated to the cultivation of vegetables and to raising cattle, which are sold in the markets of the city of Ayacucho.

Maria Jesus needs a loan of 1500 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of cattle and agricultural supplements.

The dreams of Maria Jesus are to improve her business and to offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Jesus pertenece al Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho. Ella es de la comunidad que tiene el mismo nombre, es un valle pequeño donde la mayoría de sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura de verduras.

Maria es casada, tiene 41 años y 7 hijos, Maria se dedica a la agricultura de verduras y además al engorde de ganado vacuno, los cuales son vendidos en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Maria Jesus necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno y abono.

Los sueños de Maria Jesus son mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy cattle for fattening and agricultural supplements for her vegetable crop.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza belongs to the San Miguel of Ayacucho Communal Bank. She is from the community that has the same name. It is in a small valley where the majority of the settlers are dedicated to the cultivation of vegetables.

Esperanza lives in a shared home. She is 22 years old and has 5 children. Esperanza is dedicated to the cultivation of vegetables that she sells in the supplies market of the city of Ayacucho. She is also dedicated to the breeding of guinea pigs.

Esperanza needs a loan of 750 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of agricultural supplements, seeds and pesticides.

The dreams of Esperanza are to improve her business and to offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Esperanza pertenece al Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho. Ella es de la comunidad que tiene el mismo nombre, es un valle pequeño donde la mayoría de sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura de verduras.

Esperanza es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 5 hijos, Esperanza se dedica a la agricultura de verduras que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Ademas se dedica a la crianza de cuyes.

Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono, semilla y remedios.

Los sueños de Esperanza son mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds and pesticides for her vegatable crop.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is an example of constant effort and dedication to selling clothing for infants, and she always pays attention to the latest styles. For this reason, she travels all the time to renew her inventory with the goal of selling novel items at the Sunday market in Huancayo. Her goal is to increase her products and her earnings.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Cristina, es un ejemplo constante D. dedicación y esfuerzo, se dedica a la venta D. ropas para bebés y siempre se mantiene atenta a las últimas novedades, por esa razón realiza viajes constantes para renovar su mercadería a fin D. comercializar novedosos artículos en la feria dominical D. Huancayo y desea incrementar su capital D. trabajo para acrecentar su oferta y ganancias.

loans.use: Increase her inventory / Inyección de capital para incrementar su oferta.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is very enthusiastic and hard-working, always looking to give the best to herself and her 3-year-old son. It's this that is her biggest daily motivation. She travels constantly to her country's capital city in search of clothing articles and with time she has come to learn the best sales techniques that has kept her in the merchant trade. Her goal is to increase her inventory, which is why she's requesting a loan.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Margarita, es muy entusiasta y trabajadora, siempre está buscando dar lo mejor de sí a su pequeño hijo de 3 años y para ella esta es la razón y la más alta motivación que encuentra en su diario vivir. Viaja constantemente a la ciudad capital de su país en busca de sus artículos y con el tiempo ha visto y ha aprendido las mejores técnicas de ventas que han asegurado su permanencia en este rubro mercantil. Su deseo de incrementar sus ofertas la conducen a solicitar un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase the amount of clothes she offers / Incremento de capital para incrementar las ofertas de sus prendas de vestir.

loans.name: Asunta Desideria

texts.es:
Asunta is 64 years old and she is a clerk at the Civil Registry and she runs her own notary. She has a 25 year old son who is currently attending University.

The only income she earns is through the work she does at the public notary, where she has worked for more than 12 years. The demande for her services is currently in an elevated level.

The loan she is requestnig is to renovate her home. This is the third loan that Asunta has requested from Agrocapital and she has demonstrated great diligence in meeting her payments. Asunta is responsible and punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Asunta de 64 años de edad, en oficial de registro Civil y actualmente tiene su notaría. Tiene un hijo de 25 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando en la Universidad. El único ingreso que pericbe es por su trabajo en la notaría de fe pública y tiene una experiencia de más de 12 años en este negocio. La competencia es de nivel medio pero la demanda por este tipo de servicios también es elevada. La presente solicitud la utilizará para realizar mejoras en su vivienda. Este es el tercer crédito de Asunta en Agrocapital y durante el tiempo de relación con la institución demostró un excelente cumplimiento de pagos, Asunta es una persona responsable y puntual.

loans.use: To renovate her home.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco F. is a 36-year-old single father of a 5-year-old son. They live in the Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood.

Mr. F. has been selling lubricant for 3 years. During this time, he has struggled to increase his clientele. It was difficult for him in the beginning because of the lack of funds and experience needed to manage his business. His biggest dream is to always be able to offer his son—his reason for living and for whom he works day to day—the best in life.

With this loan, he would like to augment his inventory so that he can improve his selection of products, thus increasing his profits. He would also like to expand his business and offer more complete service.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco F. tiene 36 años de edad, es soltero, habita en el barrio Maria Auxiliadora, y tiene un pequeño hijo de 5 años.

Don Francisco se dedica a la venta de lubricantes desde hace 3 años, y durante este tiempo ha ido luchando para obtener más clientela, al inicio fue díficil por la falta de dinero y la experiencia para manejar su negocio. Su mayor sueño es siempre poder ofrecerle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo que es su razón de ser, y por quien trabaja dia a dia.

Con el préstamo desea elevar el nivel de inventario para poder mejorar su oferta y así obtener más ganacias para su negocio, el cual quiere agrandar para así ofrecer un servicio más completo.

loans.use: Increase inventory and offer customers a greater selection

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia N. is sixty-one years old and a mother of five children.  Her husband died several years ago and through her business she has managed to support her five children through their schooling.  Afia is a trader who trades in clothes, women's slippers and dressing bags. She belongs to the community group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee loans for one another as social collateral.  Afia is convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants a loan of $425 to buy more stock, make a bigger income, and purchase a decent shelter for her business.

loans.use: To buy more pieces of garment clothes, slippers and dressing bags

loans.name: Reina Adelina

texts.es:
Ms. Reina Blandon is a 48-year-old single mother who lives in the Augusto Cesar Sandino neighborhood and has 4 grown up children.

She sells pork, pork rinds, chips, and tortillas for a living. She has been in business for 20 years, which has helped her acquire many customers who need her products almost on a daily basis.

Winter is approaching, which means sales will drop due to the rainy season. She will invest this loan in the purchase of firewood, corn, and other goods. Her future plans are to keep selling her products, to retain her clientele, and to finish building her house and lead a decent life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Reina Adelina, tiene 48 años de edad y habita en el barrio Augusto Cesar Sandino, es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos ya son mayores de edad.

Su negocio es la venta ambulante de cerdo, chicharrón, fritos, tortillas. Tiene veinte años de estar en estas ventas y le ha servido para establecer una clientela que casi todos los dias necesita de sus productos.

El invierno se acerca y se le hace un poco más difícil las ventas debido a las lluvias. El préstamo lo va invertir en capital de trabajo como: compra de leña, maíz y otros. Sus planes a futuro es seguir vendiendo y mantener su clientela, terminar de hacer su casa y tener una vida digna.

loans.use: Purchase firewood and corn for winter stockpile

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es:
Mr. William A. lives in the Campo Bruce neighborhood. He is a 49-year-old married father of 4 children ages 3, 4, 10, and 12.

Mr. A. sells CD’s, DVD’s, clothing, and footwear. He now has 5 years of experience. He started selling in the inland region of the country. At first, he did not sell much, but after a while, he was able to gain customers.

He started this business with loans. He will invest this loan in purchasing more products, widening his selection, and increasing his sales. He would like to develop his business, open up a line of credit, and help his children get ahead and obtain good job opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. William habita en el barrio Campo Bruce, es casado y tiene 49 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos de 3, 4,10 y 12 años.

La venta del Sr. William es CD Y DVD, ropa, zapatos y tiene cinco años de experiencia, el inició con ventas en los departamento del interior del país, al principio no vendía mucho pero despues de algun tiempo logró tener clientela.

Este negocio lo empezó con prestamos, con este préstamo va a invertir en capital de trabajo para comprar inventario, ampliar sus ofertas y vender mas. Desea crecer y hacer una línea de crédito, sacar adelante a sus hijos y que obtengan buenas oportunidades de trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase a greater quantity of CD’s and DVD’s

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose is 28 years old, and has been running a transport business. He is also involved in the purchase and sales of wood. Jose is married but they still have no children. He works alongside his wife in both their businesses.

He transports agricultural products with his truck, but he purchases wood in the country and sells it to carpenters in the community where he lives. He has been running these businesses for 8 years. There is a great deal of competition for this field of work which is great for Jose because he has earned a steady clientele.

With this loan he will purchase a new vehicle. This is his eighth loan with his institution and he has demonstrated commitment to meeting his payments in the past.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

José de 28 años de edad, se dedica hacer fletes en camión y también se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Actualmente José se encuentra casado pero aún no tiene niños, él trabaja junto a su esposa en sus dos actividades. Realiza fletes de productos agrícolas en su camión, en cuanto a la madera la compra en el campo y la vende a los aserraderos que se encuentran en la comunidad donde vive. En este rubro ya tiene una experiencia de 8 años. Existe competencia pero lo que le favorece a José es que ya cuenta con clientes fijos. Con la presente solicitud el reintegrará a su presupuesto que tenía fijado para la compra de un vehículo. Esta es la octava secuencia de Jose con la institución y demostró un buen cumplimiento con sus pagos.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle.

loans.name: Alda Lucia

texts.es:
Alda Lucia is a 50-year-old single mother of three children ages 12, 15, and 20. She lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood.

Alda Lucia is a seamstress who started her business with her own funds and now has 17 years of experience. Her business is going well, but she earns the biggest profits during the peak seasons.

With this loan, she would like to build an additional room in her house so that she and her family can live more comfortably. Her short-term plans are to finish building her house, as well as provide an education for her children so that they can grow up to be upright members of society.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Alda Lucia habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene 50 años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hijos de 12, 15 y 20 años de edad.

Alda Lucia es costurera, tiene diecisiete años de experiencia, y empezó su pequeño negocio con fondos propios, actualmente en su negocio le va bien, pero las mayores ganacias las obtiene por temporadas.

Con el préstamo desea hacer una habitación, para vivir más cómoda con sus hijos. Sus planes a corto plazo es poder terminar de construir su vivienda, así como poder darle educación a sus hijos para que estos sean hombres de bien para la sociedad.

loans.use: Build an additional room in her house

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice A. is thirty years old, married, and the mother of three children aged ten, six and four years old. She is a member of the community group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee loans for one another as social collateral.  She trades in underwears and children’s clothes. She sells these goods by mobile hawking.  Beatrice wants to use the loan of $175 to buy an increased stock of panties, singlets, boxer shorts and children's wears. She believes this will increase her ability to meet her customers' tastes, and therefore result in the acquisition of more income.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of panties, singlets, boxer shorts and children's wears.

loans.name: Pedro Joaquín

texts.es:
Mr. Gamez is a 48-year-old married father of 4 underage children. He lives in Unidad de Propósito, a neighborhood in the city of Managua.

Mr. Gamez has owned a snack bar, which he started with his own money, for 15 years. For a few months now, he has been having some difficulties running his business due to power outages in his neighborhood. Because of this problem, he has experienced drops in his sales.

He wants to use this loan to stock up on the products necessary to satisfy his customers’ needs. His future plans are to expand his business and sell other products, to prepare his children, and to live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Pedro tiene 48 años de edad, habita en Unidad de Propósito un barrio de la ciudad de Managua, es casado y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales dos son menores de edad.

Don Pedro tiene un cafetín desde hace quince años, este negocio lo llevó a cabo con dinero propio. Desde hace algunos meses atrás debido a los cortes de luz en el lugar en el que habita ha tenido muchas dificultades, ya que ha tenido que cerrar temprano su negocio, es por eso que ha experimentado algunas bajas en sus ventas.

El dinero del préstamo lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo y abastecer de todos los productos necesarios para sastifacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Sus planes futuros son ampliar el negocio y vender otros artículos, preparar a sus hijos y vivir más cómodos.

loans.use: Purchase supplies needed to run a snack bar

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua A. is forty-four years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Akosua works very hard to support her husband in providing for their children. She is a member of the community group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral.  She is a retailer of maize and through her business she has been able to support two children's efforts to finish school (who are now working) and one child's studies as an apprentice. Because maize prices are increasing every day due to the current global food crisis, Akosua wants a loan of $275 to buy more bags of maize so that she can supply her customers throughout the season and provide a steady income for her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize for keep.

loans.name: Lady

texts.es:
Lady is 34 years old and she sells shoes in the market "De Los Pozos" in the Antonio Vaca Diez locale. She currently doesn't hold much merchandise for which she requires this loan.

Lady lives near Saguapac in her father-in-law's house. She has two children who are currently in school, and her common law husband is currently working in Spain.

Lady works as a shoe salesperson and has been doing so for about 10 years alongside her mother. It was her mother who taught her how to manage the business since she was young.

There is a great deal of competition in the field of shoe sales especially because there are 20 others holding down the same business. But her personal demeanor and her attention to detail and fine customer services have always brought Lady the demand she needs for her products.

With the loan she is requesting she will purchase merchandise because she doesn't have much left and as the prices of her products vary depending on the style.

Lady has had a good credit history and this is the second time she has been financed through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Lady de 34 años de edad, se dedica a vender zapatos rn el mercado de los pozos en la Antonio Vaca Diez, actualmente no tiene mucha mercadería por lo cual requiere de este crédito. Lady vive por Saguapac en la casa de su suegro, tiene dos hijos los cuales son estudiantes su concuvino no figura se encuentra trabajando en España. Lady trabaja como comerciante de zapatos desde hace más de diez años atrás y su mamá vende junto a ella, quién enseño a su hija todo sobre el negocio desde joven. Existe competencia en la venta de zapatos ya que donde ella vende hay unas 20 personas más con el mismo negocio, pero su amabilidad y su peculiar atención a los clientes hacen que Lady tenga siempre demanda por sus prodcutos. Con la presente solicitud Lasy comprará mercadería porque ya no tenía mucho y en cuanto a los precios de estos artículos varian dependiendo el modelo (masculino o femenino). Lady tiene bueno antecedentes crediticio y esta es la segunda vez que es financiada por Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. She is a responsible mother because she has the needs and welfare of her children at heart.  Mary is a member of the community group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee for each other's loans as social collateral.  Mary is a trader who sells in used clothes.  Because used clothes are used by many people as their daily wears, Mary has many customers. However, with very limited access to capital, she can barely sell enough to make a profit. She wants a loan of $175 to buy more bales of used clothes to meet the demands of her customers and therefore increase the income of her family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Jorge Felix

texts.es:
Jorge is 57 years old and he provides taxi services as well as deliveries for a courrier company. He has been separated from his wife for many years now and he took costudy of the kids. The youngest is still living with him but he started working about 8 months ago and he is starting to gain financial independence. His son is 21 years old.

He has been working as a taxi driver for many years now and he has gained a great deal of experience. He also provides courrier services for some companies. The competition in his line of work is high, but as the automotive sector grows so does the demand.

He would like to make general repairs to his car. The loan money will be enough to cover the labour costs as well as the parts he needs.

Jorge has been a member of his financial institution for many years, this being the seventh loan on credit that he is requesting from Agrocapital. He is not a member of any other financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge de 57 años de edad se dedica al transporte de pasajeros brindando servicios de taxi, ademas aprovecha en sus recorridos para hacer entregas de correspondencia para una empresa de courrier. Es separado de su esposa hace muchos años, el se hizo cargo de sus hijos, el ultimo esta todavia vivendo con él pero ya empezo a trabajar hace unos 8 meses atrás, por lo que ya esta independizandose economicamente, este su hijo tiene aproximadamente 21 años. Trabaja con taxi desde hace muchos años, por lo que tiene bastante experiencia. Tambien es conocido por algunas empresas de courrier las cuales contratan sus servicios. La competencia en el medio es media, asi como el parque automotor crece esta tambien creciendo la demanda. Realizara refacciones generales en su motor, el dinero le alcanzara para cubrir mano de obra y repuestos. Jorge trabaja bastante tiempo con la institución, este es el septimo crédito que solicita en Agrocapital. No trabaja con ninguna otra institución.

loans.use: Vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
Biviana is 37 years old and she is a manager of a Karaoke Bar. Her family is made up of her husband and their two children.

Biviana has been managing her business for many years and she has earned the support of a great deal of experience in the field and with an ample clientele that she can count on. Many of her clientele are very well to do.

Her loan request is to equip and furnish her business, purchase tables and chairs and other furnishings. Biviana has had a good credit history and she has always met her scheduled payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Biviana de 37 años de edad se dedica a la atención de un Bar cantina y karaoke. Su familia está compuesta por ella su esposo y sus dos hjios. Biviana atiende este local desde hace muchos años atrás, por lo que cuenta con bastante experiencia en el rubro y también cuenta con amplia clientela. Debido a que es el único local por el lugar es que cuenta con bastante afluencia de gente. La presente solicitud es para el equipamiento de su negocio es decir para la compra de mesas, sillas y otros, cuyos precio varian dependiendo el artículo. Biviana tien bueno antecedentes crediticios y un buen comportamiento en los pagos de sus cuotas.

loans.use: To furnish and equip her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha S. is thirty-two years old. She is married and the mother of three children who are all currently in school. Martha is an important part of her family because she provides food and helps to pay family bills. She is a member of a community group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee one another's loans as social collateral.  Martha is a trader and sells all kinds of underwear, napkins, diapers, bed spreads, towels and other goods by traveling around and offering her goods to strangers. However, her business is constrained by a lack of access to capital. Martha therefore wants a loan of $225 to buy a larger stock of goods, which will allow her to make increased sales. This she believes will help her raise money to build a container shop to ease the drudgery of hawking to strangers.

loans.use: To increase the stock of underwear, bed spreads, napkins, diapers, etc.

loans.name: Priscila Estefany

texts.en:
Priscila Estefany is a young entrepreneur who started a small business selling clothes just a couple of months ago. She is working to pay for her university studies and produce more revenue for her family. Priscila is married and says that, even though she has no children, it is hard to pay for all the expenses of the couple with just her husband’s job.

This entrepreneur sells her garments to friends, teachers at her university, and people in her neighborhood. She says that her business has an excellent reception from people she regularly visits, and her clientele continues to grow.

She used her first loan to open her business. Priscila is now requesting a second loan to buy goods for the approaching season in order to augment her sales volume and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: Clara Celeste

texts.en:
Clara Celeste, a thirty-three year old mother of two school-going children, owns and operates a cafeteria in San Cristobal. Because she has to take care of her children during the day, in addition to cooking for her cafe, her sister-in-law helps her to attend to her customers.

Clara Celeste is very confident and affirms that she cooks like nobody’s business! That’s why she thinks her business will keep on growing and being successful in the upcoming years.

This entrepreneur is requesting her second loan from FSMA to buy more goods in order to introduce new typical Dominican dishes and increase her revenue. Clara Celeste would like to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To improve a small cafeteria by buying ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra has been selling shirts, pants, and shoes for more than three years to supplement her family’s income. Her husband works as a mechanic, and the couple has four daughters ranging from six to fifteen years old, all of whom go to school.

It is Petra’s ambition that her children can become professionals, and independent and important people in the society, so she swears that she’ll keep working hard so that she can reach that goal.

With her loan, this entrepreneur will buy a greater variety of goods to add her to her stock to increase her sales volume and attract new clients.

loans.use: To buy shoes and pants to replenish her small clothing business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama S. is twenty-eight years old, and is married with three children. Two of her children are in school and the other has not started school yet. Ama is very supportive of husband, who provides for the family’s basic needs. She is a member of the community group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee one another's loans as social collateral.  Ama owns and operates a grocery shop in her local community and sells standard items like soap, evaporated milk, rice, canned foods and drinks. She now wants a loan of $175 to buy more bags of rice, cartons of milk, canned foods and drinks to increase her stock of goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cartons of milk, canned foods and drinks etc.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is an experienced and versatile entrepreneur. She’s been selling wood, coal, fruits and vegetables, and also ice cream. Currently, Paulina sells tablecloths, window curtains, and bedspreads in her neighborhood.

This entrepreneur explains that, despite her advanced age, she doesn’t feel like closing her business. In fact, she’s requesting a loan to boost her business and to buy a large variety of goods to add to her stock. The entrepreneur would like to have enough money in order to enjoy her golden years.

loans.use: To buy household goods to sell in her community

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina B. is twenty-four years old. She is married with a two year old child. She is a member of the  community group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee one another's loans as social collateral.  Faustina manages a business which sells cosmetics like earrings, lip gloss, beads, perfumes, powders, and other related goods. She sells these by moving around towns and offering her products to strangers because she has not got a shop yet. Faustina believes that with a loan of $175 she will be able to buy good quality standard goods and therefore make more valuable sales to her customers. She also wants to use the loan to buy a greater variety of goods, which will help her meet the preferences of her customers. Faustina believes this increased income will help her come closer to buying her own shop.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of earrings, lip gloss, beads, perfumes, powders, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana M. is a 50-year-old married mother who lives in the Hialeah neighborhood and has a 7-year-old son. Her husband supports her with this business, but at night he works as a security guard.

Mrs. M. has been selling scrap metal for a living for a year. She used to sell curd and fried food, but her sales decreased day to day, so she decided to change her business.

With this loan, she plans to purchase iron and aluminum so that she can sell it at a good price that allows her to yield better profits. She would like to increase her sales and consequently improve her home’s condition.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Juana M. tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah III etapa, es casada y tiene un hijo de siete años de edad. Su esposo le apoya en este negocio, pero por la noche se dedica a ser guarda de seguridad.

El negocio de doña Juana es la venta y compra de chatarra, ya tiene un año de tener el negocio, ella anteriormente vendía cuajada y fritos pero sus ventas día a día disminuyeron y optó por cambiar de negocio.

Con el dinero que le presten va a comprar hierro, y aluminio y vender a un mejor precio ya que le permite un mejor margen de ganancia. Desea incrementar sus volúmenes de venta y así mejorar las condiciones su casa.

loans.use: Purchase iron and aluminum

loans.name: Maria Esthela

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria R. is a 27-year-old married mother who lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood and has 2 children ages 8 and 13. Her husband is a taxi cab driver who helps her with the household expenses. Mrs. R., who now has 8 years of experience in this business, sells cheese and curd for a living.

She started the business with her own money. She needs this loan in order to build an additional room in her house. She would like to one day open a general store that will help her grow both as a person and as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos niños de 8 y 13 años de edad. Su esposo es taxista y ayuda con los gasto del hogar, la venta de doña Maria es el queso y cuajada y tiene ocho años de experiencia.

Ella comenzó con dinero propio. El préstamo lo quiere para empezar ha construir un cuarto en su casa de habitación. Ella desea algún día poder llegar a poner una pulpería que le permita desarrollarse mejor como persona y como comerciante.

loans.use: Start construction of an additional room in her house

loans.name: Ayeshetu

texts.en: Ayeshetu B. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. She is a member of the community lending group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee one another as social collateral for access to loans.  Ayeshetu is a retailer of charcoal at her local community.  Because charcoal is a very popular energy source for cooking in many Ghanaian homes, Ayeshetu has many customers. However, her business is constrained by limited access to the capital needed to buy larger amounts of charcoal. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $325 to buy more bags of charcoal, which she will sell to her customers in order to make a profit and support her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.es:
Ruby belongs to the Communal Bank of Talented Women, located on the Junior Atahualpa Block 9 in the Calleria District of the Department of Ucayali, Peru. She is 31 years old and has one child. Her husband is an electrician, but his income is too low to meet their daily needs. Some time ago, Rubi took out a loan of 300 Soles (about US$110) from Manuela Ramos to begin buying and selling clothes and perfume.

Today, Rubi has many customers. She is constantly traveling in order to provide quality goods and keep her customers happy. With the loans she will receive in the future, Rubi is considering outfitting a store so she can better sell and display her merchandise.

With this loan of 2,500 Soles, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy general merchandise, such as 12 polo shirts, 6 outfits, 5 pairs of shoes, perfume, etc.

Rubi feels good about borrowing from Manuela Ramos. The organization trusts her a great deal in giving her these loans.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La señora Rubí pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Atahualpa Cdra. 9, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años, es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es electricista, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Rubí con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de ropa, perfumes.

En la actualidad goza de mucha clientela, para poder dar buenos productos viaja constantemente, y así complacer a sus clientes, y poder brindarles lo mejor, con sus siguientes préstamos esta pensando en acondicionar un local para poder vender y exhibir mejor su mercadería.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará mercadería en general como: 1 docena de polos, ½ docena de ropas, 5 pares de zapatos, perfumes, etc.

Rubí se siente bien con las promotoras, hay bastante confianza con los prestamos que brinda Manuela Ramos

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly belongs to the Talented Women Community Bank, located in Jr. Atahualpa 1030, in the Calleria District, in Ucayali, Peru. She is a 36 year-old mother of 3 children. Her husband is a businessman, but his income is not enough to support the family’s economic needs.
