For this reason, Nelly, with the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, decided to create a hardware store (iron eye-bolts).

Now she sells hardware out of her house, and with the help of her husband and children she works in this business, divvying up the things that have to be done. During the evenings, they discuss the events of the day and how to keep on improving the business.

With a loan of $375, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy: iron of all sizes and thicknesses.

Nelly is pleased with her work, and the community bank’s way of supporting the community’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Atahualpa 1030, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años, es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Nelly con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de cancamos y combas.

En la actualidad vende sus cancamos en su domicilio, con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos se dedican al negocio, se reparten las actividades que van a realizar, y por las noches conversan de lo acontecido en el día y como seguir mejorando en el negocio.

Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: fierros de todos los tamaños y grosores.

Nelly se siente bien y le gusta mucho la forma como se trabaja, su banco comunal y las promotoras que le brindan mucho apoyo y atención.

loans.use: Iron for her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma belongs to Las Orquideas Community Bank, located in Jr. Huaraz 160, in the Calleria District, in Ucayali, Peru. She is a 32 year-old mother of 2. Her husband is a woodworker. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to create a small general store.

Now the store is moving forward, helping with the costs of her family and her small children who depend on her. Norma gets up very early to take care of them and take them to school, and from there, attend to her business.

With this loan of $750, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy: 1 sack of rice, ½ sack of sugar, milk, canned goods, noodles, bread, vegetables, soap, oil, etc.

Norma is happy to be working with Manuela Ramos because it is a help to enterprising and determined women like her.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en el Jr. Huaraz 160, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es estibador de madera. Norma con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad con su bodega esta saliendo adelante, ayudando en la economía de su familia, sus hijos aun son pequeños y necesitan mucho de ella, Norma se levanta muy temprano para atenderlos y llevarlos a su escuela y de ahí atender su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar. Leche, conservas, fideos, panes, verduras, jabón, aceite, etc.

Norma se siente muy contenta trabajando con Manuela Ramos por que es una ayuda para todas las mujeres que son emprendedoras y decididas como ella.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Edessia

texts.es:
Señora Edessia López of H., her husband (Hernán H.) and their three children live in their home in the Villa Fátima zone of the City of La Paz. The couple is dedicated to the breeding of chickens in a province of the fore-mentioned metropolis.

Previous loans served to build four rooms in all, of which two are finished. At present, Edessia requests a loan for construction of the fine work for the remaining rooms. This is the fourth occasion when she has requested a loan. The economic analysis associate notes that she qualifies favorably.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Edessia López D. H., su esposo (Hernán H.) y sus tres hijos viven en casa propia en la zona D. Villa Fátima D. la Ciudad D. La Paz. El matrimonio se dedica a la crianza D. pollos en una provincia D. la mencionada urbe.

Anteriores créditos sirvieron para construir cuatro habitaciones en obra gruesa, D. las cuales dos están terminadas. Actualmente, Edessia solicita crédito para construcción en obra fina D. los restantes cuartos. Siendo esta la cuarta ocasión en la que requiere un préstamo, el análisis socio económico la califica favorablemente.

loans.use: To finish the detail work on two rooms in her home.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabián works marketing seasonal merchandise with his wife. He has a small son. His residence this located in the poor zone called Sopocachi of the city of La Paz. The house belongs to his grandparents.

This is the fourth time that he has requested a loan with Impro. The amount will be used to purchase merchandise (women's clothing and some household goods for the home). Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro-businessman and his experience in commerce, the client is eligible to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Fabián trabaja comercializando mercadería con su esposa de acuerdo a la temporada, tiene un hijo pequeño. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona bajo Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, la casa pertenece a sus abuelos.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el monto será destinado para compra de mercadería (ropa de mujer, y algunos enseres para el hogar). Debido a la rentabilidad de su negocio, la determinación de este micro empresario y su experiencia en el comercio, el cliente es apto para acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale, specifically women's clothing and some household goods for the home.

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
The lady lives in the home of her parents on Mururata street in the Villa La Merced zone of the city of La Paz. She is a teacher of natural science, but the salary that she receives (like most teachers) is very little, so she is obligated to earn her living with an additional activity; in this case selling natural beauty products, specifically those of the Natural Avon brand. This is what allows her to improve her income and cover all her expenses.

This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO, but she is qualified to obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Mururata de la zona villa La Merced de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es profesora de Ciencias naturales, pero el sueldo que percibe (al igual que muchos docentes) es muy bajo, por lo cual esta obligada a subsistir con una actividad adicional, en este caso vendiendo productos naturales de belleza, específicamente de la marca Natura Avon. Lo que le permite mejorar sus ingresos y cubrir todas sus necesidades.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO, pero esta calificada para obtener un préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase natural beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Justina Pastora

texts.es:
The lady lives with her husband and their children in her own house on Julio Téllez Avenue in the Tacagua zone of the city of La P.. Her husband is a carpenter and his salary is insufficient, so she helps with the household expenses by generating her income with the sale of clothes, provisions, toys, etc. In order to increase her capital, purchase more merchandise, enlarge her clientele and improve her standard of living, she has requested a loan.

Her previous credit is good and she qualifies to obtain said loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos en la Av. Julio Téllez de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La P.. El marido es carpintero y su salario es insuficiente, por lo cual ella ayuda en el hogar generando sus ingresos con la venta de ropa, víveres, juguetes, etc. A fin de aumentar su capital, surtirse de mayor mercadería para aumentar clientela y mejorar su nivel de vida ha solicitado un crédito.

Su antecedente crediticio es bueno y califica para obtener dicho préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, provisions and toys for resale.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es:
The lady lives at the home of her parents on Landeata street in the Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz. Tatiana is dedicated to the production of fruit marmalades, but this activity does not generate enough income, so she is also dedicated to commerce and sells ladies clothes such as coats, sweaters, dresses, etc. She requests a loan to increase her capital, increase her clientele and improve her income.

Her credit history is good and she is qualified to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Landaeta de la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. Tatiana se dedica a la producción de mermeladas de fruta, pero esta actividad no le genera muchos ingresos por lo cual también se dedica al comercio y vende ropa de dama como ser abrigos, sacones, vestidos, etc. Solicita crédito para aumentar su capital, incrementar clientela y mejorar sus ingresos.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y esta calificada para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To buy ladies clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José works in inter-provincial public transportation. He is also a producer of milk, which he markets to the PIL Andean industrial plant. (This is his main source of income that serves to cover the maintenance of his wife and four children). The client lives in the Ticuyo Community of the Andes Province (about two and a half hours from the city of La Paz).

He requests a loan to acquire a minibus, which will be used by his older son.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out permits IMPRO to approve the loan requested by José

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

José es transportista público inter provincial y también es productor de leche, la cual comercializa a la planta industrial PIL Andina (su principal fuente de ingreso que sirve para cubrir la manutención de su esposa y cuatros hijos). El cliente vive en la Comunidad Ticuyo de la Provincia Los Andes (a dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz).

Solicita crédito para adquirir un minibús, el cuál será usado por su hijo mayor.

Es su primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por José

loans.use: To buy a minibus for his transportation business.

loans.name: Deyna

texts.es:
Deyna is a seamstress. She makes comforters. Also she markets baby cradles (her main source of income that covers the maintenance of her two children.) Her dwelling this located in the 6th of August Zone of Rió Seco (El Alto).

She requires a loan to buy a computerized embroidery machine, which will help her to satisfy the demands of her market.

This is the second loan through Kiva. Her good payment history permits IMPRO to approve the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Deyna es costurera, confecciona edredones, también comercializa cunas de bebes (su principal fuente de ingreso que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos) Su vivienda esta ubicada en la Zona 6 de agosto de Rió Seco (El Alto).

Ella requiere crédito para comprar una máquina bordadora computarizada, la cual le ayudará para satisfacer la demanda de su mercado.

Este es el segundo crédito vía Kiva, su buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: To buy a computerized embroidery machine for her business of making comforters.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio occupies a residence in which he works as a attendant with his wife and their 4 children (whose ages are 15, 12, 10 and 5 years). The house is located on Juan Vargas Street in the Pedro Domingo Murillo zone (City of El Alto).

His commercial activity is the making of wool sweaters for ladies. Said production is sold in the main fair of the city.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of wool in quantity to reduce his costs.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out qualifies IMPRO to offer him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio ocupa un domicilio en el que trabaja como cuidador junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos (cuyas edades oscilan entre 15, 12, 10 y 5 años de edad). La casa esta ubicada en la Calle Juan Vargas de la zona Pedro Domingo Murillo (Ciudad de el Alto).

Su actividad comercial es la confección de chompas de lana para señoras, dicha producción es vendida en la feria principal de la ciudad..

El crédito será invertido en la compra de lana en cantidad para reducir sus costos.

Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase wool in quantity for his sweater production business in order to reduce costs.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is very grateful to Kiva for the previous loan of $175. With the loan she increased her stock of peanuts and was able to purchase 15 bags per month. She purchased beds and beddings for her children and was able to pay for their school requirements. Because of the increase in stock, her husband assisted her with the business, and they are working very cooperatively for the family's better future. Zainab has savings, and she is planning for the family to have their own house in the future. Zainab is very thankful to Kiva and is requesting a loan of Le.800,000 to further increase her stock for more income.

loans.use: Zainab would like to increase her stock of peanuts.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha lives in the home of her parents. The house is on 21st of September Street in the Vila Ingenio zone located in the city of El Alto. She has a daughter of three years and her husband works in the Department of the Interior of La P. (here meaning the entire territory of La P., not the city)

She is dedicated to the making of wool blankets and scarves for ladies. Said production is sold in the main fair of the city.

The loan will be destined for the purchase of wool wholesale, which will permit her to reduce her costs.

This is the third loan with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out qualifies IMPRO to offer her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha vive en casa de sus padres, la casa esta en la calle 21 de septiembre de la zona Vila Ingenio ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Tiene una hija de tres años y su esposo trabaja en el interior del departamento de La P. (aquí se habla de todo el territorio no la ciudad)

Se dedica a la confección de mantas y chalinas de lana. para señoras, dicha producción es vendida en la principal feria de la ciudad.

El crédito será destinado para comprar lana al por mayor, eso le permitira reducir sus costos.

Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To purchase wool wholesale for her business making wool blankets and scarves.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo has his own residence. He lives on Antonio Llanque Street in the Villa Ingenio zone located in the periphery of the city of El Alto. He is the father of a boy of three years. His wife is a merchant in a street stall of the city of El Alto, while he is the chauffeur of a minibus whose routes are the streets of the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to pay off the minibus with which he works.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out qualifies IMPRO to offer him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Reynaldo tiene domicilio propio, vive en la Calle Antonio Llanque de la zona Villa Ingenio ubicada en la periferia de la ciudad de El Alto. Es padre de un niño de tres años, su esposa es comerciante en un puesto callejero de la ciuddad de El Alto, mientras que él es chofer de un minibús cuyo recorrido son las calles de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito será destinado para cancelar totalmente los pagos de la movilidad con la que trabaja .

Es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To pay off the minibus that he uses for his transportation business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina has her own home. She lives on Los Rios Street in the San Jose de Yunguyo zone located in the city of El Alto. She is the mother of 6 children, ages 22, 18, 16, 13, 8 and 6 years respectively.

She is dedicated to the sale of different types of construction gloves. Said sales are carried out in the various markets of the city and nearby provinces.

The loan is destined for the wholesale purchase of merchandise, in order to reduce her expenses.

This is the second loan with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out qualifies IMPRO to offer her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina tiene casa propia, vive en la calle los rios de la zona San Jose de Yunguyo ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Ella es madre de 6 hijos, de 22, 18, 16, 13, 8 y 6 años respectivamente.

Se dedica a la venta de diferentes tipos de guantes para la construcción, dicha venta la realiza en las diferentes ferias de la cuidad y en provincias cercanas.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería al por mayor, así reducirá sus gastos.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To purchase construction gloves wholesale.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
My name is Eugenia C. and I live in San Pedro Sacatepequez. I´m 50 years old. I make blouses embroidered by hand, with the typical huípil design. When I was ten years old I learned how to weave and and also swe with a machine. I worked several years for a clothing factory--I would make the shirts in my house for the company. But then the factory hired a lot of people and so I decided to start my own business. I continued to weave, making belts, huípil blouses and embroidering blouses to earn money for my family alongside my husband. When my daughters started growing up they helped me.

I need more capital to invest in the material to make the embroidery and fabrics. When I buy in greater quantities it´s cheaper. I have people working for me to satisfy my clients´ orders. One plan I have is to buy a large number of embroidered napkin sets from people I know. I need sufficient capital to invest in this.

I feel happy since I´m giving work to my family and together we´ll get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Vivo en San Pedro Sacatepequez, mi nombre es Eugenia C., tengo 50 años de edad. Actualmente me dedico a la elaboración de blusas bordadas a mano, tejidos de güipiles típicos. Cuando tenía 10 años de edad aprendí a tejer y también a coser a máquina, trabaje varios años para una fabrica de ropa, yo trabajaba en mi casa y en la fabrica me daban trabajo para que elaborara camisas en mi casa, pero con el tiempo las fabricas empezaron a contratar mucha gente para que les trabajara, entonces era tiempo que me dedicara a mi propio negocio, así que seguí tejiendo, haciendo fajas, güipiles y bordando blusas, para ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de la casa, conforme fueron crecido mis hijas, ellas también empezaron a ayudarme. Necesito más capital para invertir en la compra de material para elaborar los bordados y tejidos ya que al comprar cantidades mas grandes me sale mas barato, y es que tengo a varias personas que trabajan para mi, para poder sacar los pedidos que mis clientes me hacen, entre mis planes es que la cantidad de servilletas típicas, ya las personas que se dedican a elaborar servilletas vienen a entregarme su producto, pero como son por docenas que ellos me dejan yo necesito tener suficiente capital para poder comprarlos, me siento muy contenta ya que les doy trabajo a mi familia y juntos estamos saliendo adelante.

loans.use: Buy material for embroidery and invest in cloth napkin sets

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is very grateful to Kiva. With her previous loan from Kiva, she increased her stock and income. Mary extended her peanut-butter market base to the villages. She uses a small hand machine to grind the peanuts and packs them in small plastic bags. She sells the butter both in Magburaka town and the nearby villages. Mary is happy that, with the profit, she was able to meet her children's educational requirements and has saved some money through a rotating savings club for future needs. She is requesting a loan of Le.800,000 to further increase her stock for more income.

loans.use: To purchase more peanuts to increase her income

loans.name: Susana Hilaria

texts.es:
Susana is a 61-year-old widow who lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood. She has eight grown up children who are all independent.

Susana has been running a beauty salon for 17 years. She started out selling cosmetics in the oriental market, but then she sold her business space and set up a beauty salon. She will invest her loan in purchasing cosmetics and beauty supplies.

Her plans are to relocate her beauty salon to a more strategic place, and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Susana es viuda, habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela, tiene 61 años de edad, y tiene ocho hijos, todos mayores de edad y que son independientes a ella.

Susana tiene un salón de belleza, que tiene 17 años de experiencia, comenzó a ser comerciante en el mercado oriental vendiendo cosméticos, luego vendió su tramo y puso el salón de belleza. El préstamo lo va a invertir en compras de cosmético y productos de belleza.

Sus planes son ubicar el salón de belleza en un punto estratégico y mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and beauty supplies

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos F. is a 40-year-old married father of four who lives in the 14 de febrero neighborhood. His wife works from home making tortillas in order to help cover the family expenses.

Mr. F. is a welder and a bricklayer with 16 years of experience. He started his business with his own funds. He needs this loan so that he can purchase the necessary welding supplies. His plans are to open a business space in which he can set up his workshop, thus increasing his profits and improving his living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos F. habita en el barrio 14 de febrero, tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos, su esposa trabaja en la casa, para ayudar con los gastos de la familia ella vende tortilla.

El Sr. Carlos es albañil y soldador, lleva dieciséis años de experiencia, comenzó con dinero propio. El préstamo lo quiere para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de soldadura. Sus planes son tener un local donde pueda instalar su taller, y tener más ganancia para mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase welding supplies

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia C. is a seamstress. She makes jackets and all kinds of seasonal garments. Her husband works as an electrician in a shipping company. This work brings in the main economic income that covers the maintenance of the couple’s two children. The dwelling of the family this located in the 16th of July Zone of the city of La Paz.

She requests a loan to increase the amount of her down payment. Previously she has paid ordinary rent. In the future the couple wants to buy land and thus to have their own dwelling.

This is the second loan with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out permits IMPRO to approve the loan requested by Celia.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Celia C. es costurera, confecciona chamarra y todo tipo de prendas por temporadas. El esposo trabaja de electricista en una empresa de transportes, de este trabajo provienen los principales ingresos económicos que cubren la manutención de los dos hijos de la pareja. La vivienda de la familia esta ubicada en la Zona de 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de La Paz.

Ella solicita crédito para incrementar el monto de su anticrético, anteriormente pagaba un alquiler ordinario, en lo posterior, la pareja piensa comprarse un terreno y así tener vivienda propia.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Celia.

loans.use: To increase the amount of her down payment so that she can purchase land on which to build a home.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is one of the Kiva clients who received a previous loan of $175 to increase her stock of palm oil. With the profit Marie was able to send her children back to school, as they were sent away due to a lack of required school fees. She said that the loan opened an opportunity for her to expand her business and earn more income than before. Marie is therefore requesting a loan of Le.800,000 to purchase 70 gallons of palm oil to further expand her business.

loans.use: Marie would like to increase her stock of palm oil.

loans.name: Filomena Rosario

texts.es:
Señora Filomena is 54 years old and lives with her 60 year old husband and two sons, 32 and 22. She is a housewife and her husband is the wage-earner, working in real estate. He is actually now retired from working at the compay Sobolma Ltd., where he still continues to work for free.

Filomena will use the credit to buy the materials they need for construction in their house, like bathroom accesories. This is Filomena's fifth loan with Fundación Agrocapital and she has demonstrated responsibility and puntualily in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Filomena tiene 54 años de edad y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo que tiene 60 años y sus hijos de 32 y 22 años de edad. Ella es ama se casa y su esposo es rentista y asalariado. Su esposo es jubilado de la empresa Sobolma Ltda. donde actualmente sigue trabajando sin ningún tipo de beneficio. Filomena utilizará el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción que necesita para su casa, accesorios de baño y otros. Esta es la quinta secuencia de Filomena con la institución y todo el tiempo que trabajo con la institución demostró ser muy responsable ya que canceló puntualmente sus cuotas.

loans.use: Buy construction materials for their house

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Happiness, dedication and persistence are the chief characteristics of Victoria, a very responsible and loving mother who since being being blessed with a daughter has worked intensely with the goal to always come out ahead. Currently she's dedicated to buying and selling cheeses, which she acquires at the town markets surrounding her city of Juilaca and orders from the cities of Arequipa and Cuzco. Additionally to this task, she also dedicates a lot of time knitting beautiful beanies and caps to sell at the city's Sunday market. The goal of Victoria is to acquire a loan to invest in her knitting business, purchasing more supplies. This diligent woman is sure she is worthy of your confidence and she will fulfill her dreams.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Su alegría, dedicación y persistencia son las principales características de Victoria, madre muy responsable y amorosa que desde que le otorgó el don de la vida a su pequeña niña trabajó insistentemente en sus actividades con el fin de salir siempre airosa. Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos, mercadería que adquiere los días de feria de los pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca, y los despacha para las ciudades de Arequipa y Cuzco, adicionalmente a este oficio se dedica con mucha persistencia a tejer hermosos chullos y gorras que oferta en el mercado dominical de dicha ciudad.El deseo que tiene Victoria es adquirir un préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio de tejidos. Esta diligente dama está segura que recibirá tu respuesta y concretará su sueño.

loans.use: Increase her capital so she'll be able to offer more products / Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de artículos.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 48479

loans.name: Hayde

texts.es:
From the city of Samán comes Hayde, a young woman of 24 who wasn't able to complete her studies because of a lack of resources. With this fact in mind and with a lot of effort, she decided to live her hometown in search of better opportunities. Since she arrived in the city of Juliaca, with the help of her older sister, she has been dedicated to selling American clothing, which she acquires wholesale in the Sunday market. She offer the items at retail, obtaining a small percentage of earnings for every article she sells. The dream lodged in this young woman's heart is to be able to offer her products first-hand, with the goal being to increase her sales and obtain more income to cover her most urgent needs.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El distrito de Samán, es la ciudad natal de Hayde, joven de 24 años de edad que no pudo concluir sus estudios primarios por sus bajos recursos económicos. A raíz de este hecho y con mucho esfuerzo decidió salir de su pueblo en busca de mejores oportunidades y desde que llegó a la ciudad de Juliaca con apoyo de su hermana mayor se dedica a la venta de ropas americanas, mercadería que adquiere al por mayor en el mercado dominical y oferta al por menor obteniendo un porcentaje mínimo de ganancias por cada prenda vendida.El deseo que cobija en su corazón esta joven es ofrecer ropas americanas de primera, con el fin de mejorar sus ventas y obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades más urgentes.

loans.use: Increase of capital to acquire a larger quantity of clothing to sell / Incremento de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 48480

loans.name: René

texts.es:
Consuelo is a woman who works day to day with the goal of providing for her 12-year-old son's well-being and giving him the tools to make him successful in the future. Every since she was very little she worked as a merchant and has inherited the art of selling from her parents. It brings her a lot of pleasure to dedicate herself to this activity and she hopes to increase her work area and the amount of candies, snacks and beverages she offers.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Consuelo es una mujer que día a día trabaja con el objetivo de otorgarle bienestar y las herramientas necesarias a su hijo de 12 años para que éste pueda alcanzar el éxito en su vida futura. Ella desde muy pequeña a estado ligada a la labor mercantil y ha heredado de sus padres el arte de vender, le complace mucho dedicarse a esta actividad y está decidida a mejorar su espacio de trabajo y la cantidad de los productos que ofrece.

loans.use: Increase her capital to offer a larger amount of candies / Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de dulces.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is forty years old, and she and her husband have four children who go to school. She has been cooking specialty fried dishes for a long time in her community. Petronila explains that she started this business when she realized that her husband’s job couldn’t help him to support all of the expenses of the family.

“There’s a lot to be said for running this business”, she says.

Actually, it’s easier to pay the children's school tuitions and the rental of her house. Petronila dreams of buying her own house in the upcoming of years, so she can provide a comfortable lifestyle for her children.

She’ll use her loan to buy ingredients to keep producing her tasty fried dishes and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients for her fried dishes

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina is originally from the city of Sandia, where they sew the freshest and most delicious fruit in the area, and it is this fruit that she sells in large quantities in the cities of Puno and Juliaca. Agustina travels twice a week to acquire her merchandise and she distributes it to various markets in said cities; the benefits she reaps are that her needs, and those of her kids, who are the main reason for her effort, are met. Agustina’s desire is to increase the amount that she invests so that she can improve the benefits to her and to maintain her kids without reservation. Your important support will concrete the desires of this diligent mother.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Agustina, es natural de la ciudad de Sandia, lugar donde cosechan las frutas más frescas y deliciosas de la zona, y se dedica precisamente a la venta de estas frutas al por mayor en las ciudades de Puno y Juliaca.Agustina viaja para adquirir su mercadería 2 veces por semana y los distribuye a los comerciantes de los diferentes mercados de dichas ciudades; con los beneficios que obtiene puede cubrir sus necesidades y la de sus queridos hijos, quienes son el motor principal de su esfuerzo y constancia.El deseo de Agustina es aumentar su monto de inversión con el fin de mejorar sus beneficios y sobre todo mantener sin privaciones a sus queridos hijos.Tu importante aporte concretará los deseos de esta diligente madre.

loans.use: An increase of capital to improve her sales/Incremento de capital para mejorar sus ofertas.

loans.name: Marìa Marcelina

texts.es:
My name is María Marcelina B. C.. I´m 31 years old and from San Pedro Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. I started 10 years ago by business selling children´s clothing on the street. Now I´ve diversified my products. I sell t-shirts, plasticware, basic goods, and I sell alongside my husband in the towns of San Raymundo, Chuarrancho y San Juan Sacatepequez.

Since I still don´t have a fixed location, I take advantage of the market days in the pueblos we visit. I also make aprons, blouses, traditional dresses and I sell tortillas--for these activities I need more capital to increase my production. Right now I´m seeing good demand and it´s important for me to satisfy what the customers want. My plan is to increase sales, but I can only do this by having more products to offer. I always work hard since I have five girls and three of them go to school. I want to give them the opportunity to study and get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es María Marcelina B. C., tengo 31 años de edad; soy de San Pedro Sacatepèquez Guatemala, soy comerciante. Inicie mi negocio vendiendo de forma ambulante, ropa para niños, ya tengo 10 años en el negocio. Actualmente he diversificado los productos que vendo, ya que vendo playeras, recipientes plásticos, productos de consumo diario, los que vendemos junto a mi esposo en los municipios de San Raymundo, Chuarrancho y San Juan Sacatepequez. Ya que mi negocio es de forma ambulante aprovecho los días de mercado en los pueblos que visitamos, por lo que también me dedico a la elaboración de delantales y blusas, costuras de cortes típicos, y venta de tortillas, por lo que necesito más capital para incrementar los productos que vendo, actualmente estoy teniendo bastante demanda de mis clientes, por lo que es necesario que pueda cumplir con lo que ellos me piden. Mis planes son incrementar las ventas que tengo en los diferentes negocios, pero solo lo puedo lograr teniendo suficientes productos que la gente pide. Sigo trabajando duro ya que tengo 5 niñas y 3 de ellas ya van a la escuela quiero darle la oportunidad de que estudien y se superen.

loans.use: Invest in more merchandise: clothes and kitchenware

loans.name: Rudesinda

texts.en:
Rudesinda, a fifty-four-year-old woman and the mother of four children, lives in San Cristobal, where she owns and runs a cake shop. Rudesinda has been running her shop for more than eight years and she produces cakes to order. Currently, she has a well-established clientele, most of whom are mini-market owners.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy ingredients, such as flour, sugar, milk, and cream, to keep producing her cakes, since her products are in heightened demand now. Rudesinda hopes that, by the end of the year, she’ll have enough money to begin the construction of her own house.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her made-to-order cakes

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo is 33 years and and married. He lives with his 27 year old wife in their own house along with their five children: 3, 5, 7, 8 and 10 years old. Eduardo has worked in his tire workshop for several years and has a good location on his town's main avenue. There is a fair amount of competition--several other tire shops around--but due to Eduardo's time with the business and his good location he is seeing good demand.

His curreny loan application is to buy used tires and inner tubes to fix them up and sell them. This is Eduardo's fifth loan with Fundación Agrocapital and he has always been punctual and responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Eduardo tiene 33 años de edad y actualmente se encuenra casado, vive con su esposa de 27 años en su casa propia, la pareja tiene 5 hijos de 3, 5, 7, 8 y 10 años de edad. Eduardo trabaja en su gomería desde hace varios años atras, esta se encuentra bien ubicada ya que está en plena avenida principal de la comunidad. La competencia es mediana ya que existen otras gomerías por el lugar, pero debido a su antiguedad y ubicación del negocio es que cuenta con bastante demanda. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de llantas y camaras usadas para acomodarlas y luego poder nuevamente comercializarlas. Esta es la quinta secuencia de Eduardo con la institución y siempre demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.

loans.use: Buy used tires and inner tubes for his tire workshop

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Milena belongs to Las Dalilas Community Bank, located in Jr. Las Gaviotas Mz. 44 Lt. 8, in the Yarina Cocha District in Ucayali, Peru. She is 60 years old, and is widowed. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to get into food sales.

Now she has a little store, which she built with the first loan that she received and the earnings from her business. She looks forward to improving the space and creating a restaurant, with flavorful juanes and parrilladas. She works at the store every day, and has many clients, who are very important for her and her business.

With this loan of $375, which she will repay in 4 months, she will use part to remodel the store, and another part to buy provisions such as: rice, sugar, meat, condiments, etc.

Milena, who is getting through a difficult time with the loss of her husband, keeps moving forward for herself and her children, who are now her greatest comfort and support and her reason for living.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Milena pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalilas, ubicado en el Jr. Las Gaviotas Mz. 44 Lt. 8, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 60 años, es viuda. Milena con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comidas.

En la actualidad tiene una maloquita, que construyo con los préstamo recibidos y las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio, mas adelante espera seguir ampliándolo mas y así poder tener un restaurante, con los ricos juanes y las parrilladas. Atiende todos los días y goza de mucha clientela, por que para ella son muy importantes y la razón de ser de su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá una parte en remodelar su local y otra en la compra de víveres como: arroz, azúcar, carnes, condimentos, etc.

Milena, a pesar de estar pasando por un momento muy triste de su vida con la perdida de su esposo, sigue adelante por ella y sus hijos que ahora son su gran consuelo y apoyo y la razón de ser de su vida.

loans.use: Provisions for the preparation of food

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.en:
Ana Francisca is a hard working and ambitious entrepreneur who struggles to proviD. a better life for her family. She has a nineteen-year-old son who’ll start his university studies in a couple of months.

Soon after her husband passed away five years ago, Ana Francisca had to face the hard reality of raising a child on her own. She started a small business of selling arepas (unleavened corn-flour flatbread) from her home. Currently, this entrepreneur’s business is successful and her clientele keeps growing.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy corn flour, sugar, milk, cocoa and other ingredients in bulk to keep producing her tasty arepas and satisfy her customers’ needs. Ana Francisca hopes that her business will help allow her improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her arepas in bulk

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who has dedicated her life to work for the well-being of her 4 kids, who are now good men. The whole family wishes to improve their work space and offer better services to the community, and it is for precisely this reason that they would like a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Alicia, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que ha dedicado su vida al trabajo con el deseo de procurarles bienestar a sus 4 pequeños que ahora ya se han convertido en hombres de bien. La familia en pleno desea mejorar su espacio de trabajo y ofrecer más y mejores servicios a su comunidad, y precisamente a esta razón atiende su petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: An injection of capital to reboot her small workshop/Inyección de capital para reflotar su pequeño taller.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is a very persevering woman, and she has never been put off by difficult circumstances. A few years ago she owned a food store, but because of her delicate health she had to sell all her products. Now she is better she wants to start all over again, and she will work hard so that her dream becomes a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maria, es una persona muy perseverante y nunca se ha dejado derrotar por las circunstancias difíciles. Hace un par de años poseía una tienda de comestibles y debido a su delicado estado de salud tuvo que vender todo lo que tenía en ella, ahora ya recuperada de su dolencia desea iniciar una vez más su actividad y esforzarse para hacer este sueño realidad.

loans.use: An injection of capital to reopen her shop/Inyección de capital para reabrir su tienda.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana lives with her husband and their three children who range in age from five to thirteen years old. Her husband's eldest son recently moved in with them while he studies at the university.

Juana has been running a small grocery store for seven years in the small rural community of San Cristobal. This entrepreneur humbly explains that her stock is still limited, but she plans to use her loan to buy a greater variety of products, especially drinks, which she is not selling yet. She wants to add to her inventory in order to meet the needs of her customers.

Juana dreams of owning a big market with plenty of products to offer to people of her neighborhood, and becoming the most well established supplier of these goods in her community.

loans.use: To improve a small grocery store by adding new items, especially drinks, to the inventory.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma really wants to move forward, and it is this characteristic drive that has lead her to taking home economics classes. A short while ago she started making yoghurts of all flavours in her home, always taking into account health and safety, and the ways of getting the exact products she needs for excellent quality. Her desire is to continue with this work and this is why she would like a loan; to buy more ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Norma, tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante, precisamente su ímpetu característico la ha llevado a tomar clases de fabricación de alimentos y desde hace poco se dedica a la elaboración de yogures de diversos sabores en casa, siempre teniendo en cuenta las indicaciones sanitarias y los ingredientes en la medidas exacta para obtener productos de excelente calidad. Su deseo es continuar con su labor y a esa razón atiende la petición de un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de insumos.

loans.use: An increase in capital to buy more ingredients/Incremento de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de insumos.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Every day Maria, with help from her husband, dedicates herself to the administration of her business and attends to clients in their small shopping centre. They both have the desire and are willing to improve their work space and their earnings so that their 12 year old son will benefit, as he has a very painful illness.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maria, diariamente se dedica a la administración y a la atención de sus clientes en compañía y con apoyo de su esposo en su pequeño centro de ventas.Ambos tienen el deseo y compromiso de mejorar su espacio de trabajo y ganacias para procurarle bienestar a su pequeño niño de doce años quien padece de una dolencia sumamente penosa.

loans.use: An increase in capital to reboot commercial activity/Incremento de capital para reflotar su actividad comercial.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata accessed a previous loan from Kiva, and she is very happy that she completed paying her installments. She purchased gallons of palm oil and rice, and she was able to make a profit. With the profit, Aminata was able to support her jobless husband in meeting some of the family's expenses. Aminata's business is the only source of income for the family, and the loan enabled her to expand it. She is very grateful to Kiva and would like to access another loan of Le.800,000 to continue expanding the business for more income.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of palm oil and rice

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is a very hard-working woman. Her and her partner work cultivating potato and maize. Their most urgent need right now is of fertilizers and medicines which will help to look after their products and will allow the earth to give them excellent vegetables as the market requires.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maribel, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora.Ella y su pareja se dedican al cultivo de papa y maíz, su necesidad más urgente ahora es comprar fertilizantes, abonos y medicinas para el cuidado de sus productos a fin de que sus terrenos puedan producir excelentes vegetales acorde a la exigencia del mercado.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers/Compra de abonos y fertilizantes.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila belongs to the Talented Women Community Bank, located in Jr. Piura 191, in the Calleria District, in Ucayali, Peru. She is a 64 year-old mother of 6 children. Her husband works a manager in construction, but his income is not enough to meet their daily economic needs. For this reason, Zoila, with the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, decided to begin a small store selling sodas.

Now she sells wine maD. from local fruit. In the mornings, she sells food, and in the afternoon, she has begun to offer wine to stores, which occupies most of her time and helps her get to know many people and friends.

With this loan of $925, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy: wine, grapes, brandy, and provisions for the food that she makes.

Zoila is happy that with the loans she has received she has been able to make her dreams and greatest longings become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zoila pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Piura 191, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 64 años, es madre D. 6 hijos, su esposo es maestro constructor, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Zoila con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta D. gaseosas.

En la actualidad venD. vinos hecho a base D. frutas regionales, por las mañanas se dedica a vender comida, y en las tardes sale a ofrecer sus vinos a las tiendas y la mantiene muy ocupada y así conoce mas gente y amigos.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: vinos, uvas, aguardiente, víveres para sus comidas.

Zoila se siente muy contenta, con los prestamos recibidos sus sueños y anhelos mas soñados se están haciendo realidad.

loans.use: Will increase the supply of products she sells.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
Mrs Ricardina dedicates the majority of her time to her cultivated land now that that is her principle source of sustenance for her family. Agriculturist have always needed to be very careful with sowing the land, which is the first step taken to achieve their goals of production and the augmentation of their income. One way in doing this is to meticulously disinfect the seeds. One large limitation for her is not having the capacity to buy seeds whole sale since their price is high, and this is why she is soliciting a loan

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer>

Doña Ricardina, dedica el mayor tiempo a sus terrenos de cultivo ya que esta es la principal fuente de sustento de su amada familia.Siempre los agricultores tienen que ser muy cuidadosos en la siembra pues es el primer paso para lograr sus metas de producción y el aumento de sus ingresos, es por ello que tienen que desinfectar minuciosamente las semillas.Una gran limitación para ella es no tener la capacidad de comprar mayor cantidad de semillas puesto que su precio es significativo, por esa razón solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchas of seeds at whole sale price

loans.name: Marìa Marta

texts.es:
I´m María Marta B. X.. I`m 43 years old and I sell comales [clay dishes for making tortillas] and clay pots of all sizes. I live in San Raymundo, and since I was little I made comales since that is one of the most common activities. When I married and had kids (now 6 children in all), only making comales was no longer profitable since I had to sell them here in my pueblo and people didn´t pay much for them. So 15 years ago I decided to commercialize my products in other places. We currently go to Taxisco, Chiquimulilla, Pasaco, Sipacate--all on Guatemala´s coast.

Now I´m a wholesaler. I buy the products from people in my pueblo and I have clients who order large quantities of comales and pots. I need more capital to invest and I want to take advantage of this season, when everyone is making comales. If I buy now, then I can have my products stored before winter begins. I want to sell my products in other towns and also I´d like to hire two people who will work full time making comales so I can cover orders during the winter months.

I work hard so my children can continue in school. Four of them are in different grades. I want them to graduate and have a career that´s different from my job.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Soy María Marta B. X., tengo 43 años de edad, el negocio al que me dedico es la venta de comales para hacer tortillas y ollas de barro, de todos tamaños. Vivo en San Raymundo, desde pequeña me dedicaba a la elaboración de comales, ya que en este municipio es una de las actividades màs comunes, al formar mi hogar con mi esposo y al tener mis hijos que son 6 en total, ya solo elaborar comales no era tan rentable ya que los tenia que vender aquí mismo en el pueblo y las personas no pagaban mucho por ellos, hace ya 15 años que decidí salir a comerciar con mi producto a otros lugares, actualmente vamos a los municipios de Taxisco, Chiquimulilla, Pasaco, Sipacate que están en la costa de Guatemala. Ahora ya soy mayorista le compro su producto a las personas del pueblo y caserios cercanos, tengo clientes que me hacen pedidos grandes de comales y ollas, por eso necesito más capital para invertir ya quiero aprovechar que es el tiempo en que la gente produce bastantes comales y que al comprarlos pueda tener almacenado mi mercadería antes que inicie el invierno. Quiero visitar otros municipios para ofrecer mi producto y tambien contratar a dos personas para que me trabajen fijo y comprar material para elaborar comales, ya que esto me ayudará a poder cubrir los pedidos durante los meses de invierno, siempre trabajo muy duro para que mis hijos sigan estudian ya que 4 de ellos esta en diferentes grados y que puedan graduarse y tener una carrera para que puedan tener un trabajo diferente al mío.

loans.use: Wholesale investments in comales and clay pots

loans.name: Máximo

texts.en:
Don Maximo is a 60 year old man who still feels very young at his age. He has a lot of energy to devote to his job that he loves. He hopes to update his work tools in order to continue improving his work and this is why he is soliciting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Don Máximo es un hombre de 60 años y a su edad aún se siente joven y con mucha fuerza para dedicarse a la labor que lo apasiona. Desea renovar sus herramientas de trabajo para seguir desarrollando su labor y a esa razón atiende la petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Update farming tools

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, from a very young age has been a farmer. This being a very common profession in her area and in her family from whom she learned the trade. Thanks to her efforts her production and economic stability at home have improved greatly. She hopes to continue achieving the dreams of her beloved children and with this motive she hopes to solicit a loan in order to purchase more fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Gloria, desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado a la agricultura siendo este una labor muy común en su localidad y dentro de su familia de quienes aprendió los gajes del oficio.Gracias a su desempeño continuo su producción y economía dentro de su hogar han mejorado mucho. Su deseo es continuar con el desarrollo de los sueños de sus amados hijos y por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a farmer and working in this occupation has become a passion of hers. She dedicates herself to the sale of apples that she cultivates at her little farm. Every day in the morning she has to worry about maintaining the irrigation system located on her land in order to care for the fertilizer need for her crops. Dina is also a mother of two and she adores them. She works as hard as she does for them after preparing their meals. She hopes to increase her work capital with the objective of increasing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Dina, es agricultora y el trabajar en esta ocupación se ha convertido en su pasión. Se dedica a la venta de manzanas que cultiva dentro de su chacra y todos los días en las mañanas tiene que preocuparse por mantener los regadillos activados dentro de sus hectáreas de terrenos sin descuidar el abono que necesitan.Dina además es madre de dos pequeños niños que son su adoración y por quienes trabaja a sol y a sombra todos los días después de preparar sus alimentos. Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo con el objetivo de acrecentar también sus ganacias.

loans.use: Increase her capital to better her working conditions

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.en:
Oswaldo feels very satisfied with the achievements he has obtained up until now. Thanks to his work on his little farm and the collaboration of his friendly oxen that help him in the process. Not long ago he acquired land and wishes to build a home on it so that he can offer a higher level of comfort to his family. His objective in the sort run is to increase his income by optimizing the quality of his products.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Oswaldo, se siente muy satisfecho por los logros obtenidos hasta el día de hoy gracias a su trabajo en la chacra y a sus más grandes colaboradores que son sus amigables bueyes que le ayudan en el proceso de siembra. Hace poco ha adquirido un terreno y desea construir en el su hogar para brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia. Su objetivo a corto plazo para alcanzar este fin es incrementar la siembra de gladiolos en sus terrenos de cultivo y optimizar la calidad de los mismos.

loans.use: Increase of capital in order to optimize yield

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has always wanted to offer more to her loved ones. Her vegetables have been very successful and have give a good harvest thanks to her care, and she hopes to have a similar harvest this year. This is why she is soliciting a loan, and with it acquire bulk quantities of fertilizer and minerals.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Ana, siempre quiso dar lo mejor a sus seres queridos. Sus vegetales gracias al cuidado que le otorga le han dado excelentes frutos la cosecha pasada y espera tener una cosecha similar este año. Por ese motivo solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes.

loans.use: Purchase in bulk of minerals and fertilizers

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
In order to better her health, Felicia decided to sell homemade meals from her home. She decided to install cable television so that she can attrack more clientele and hopefully increase her daily earnings. Due to her poor health and old age, she needs to buy some vitamins to make her feel better. With the support of her partner and older children, she's able to buy the medicine she needs for her ailments. Felicia's biggest wish is not only to improve her health, but to open up a restaurant and make it one of the best restaurants in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Con el deseo de establecer su salud, Felicia trata de aumentar sus ventas en su negocio de comida y como un estrategia de venta instaló en su domicilio un cable televisivo para atraer a la clientela, siendo este un beneficio que la ayuda a poder aumentar el número de pensionistas y por ende el aumento de sus ingresos diarios.Sin embargo siempre tiene esos malestares propios de su edad y requiere de algunas vitaminas para mejorar su salud y gracias al apoyo de su pareja y de sus hijos mayores puede acceder de los medicamentos que requiere. Pero el deseo de Felicia va mas allá de establecer su salud y desea ambientar su restaurante y convertir a su negocio en la más concurrido de su comunidad.

loans.use: To open up a restaurant

loans.name: Zila

texts.es:
Zila belongs to Las Orquideas Community Bank, located in Av. Aguaytia 500, in the Calleria Distrito, in Ucayali, Peru. She is a 33 year-old mother of 2. Her husband is a car mechanic, but his income is not enough to support the family’s economic needs, so with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Zila decided to begin a small general store.

She is now selling more products at the store, and with the loans she has received, she is increasing her supply in the hopes of increasing the number of clientele. She attends to the store with the help of her children.

With this loan of $850, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy: 1 sack of rice, ½ sack of sugar, milk, oil, noodles, vegetables, meat, condiments, bread, soap, detergent, etc.

For Zila, the loans greatly support her and her business. She is not able to be more independent and manage her own income.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zila pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en la Av. Aguaytia 500, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Zila con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad su bodega esta mas implementada con productos que antes no vendía, con los prestamos que recibe esta comprando mas productos para surtir su bodega y tener mas clientela, con la ayuda de sus hijos atienen su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, verduras, carnes, condimentos, pan, jabón, detergente, etc.

Para Zila los prestamos son un gran apoyo para ella y su negocio, ahora puede ser mas independiente y administrar sus propios ingresos.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, since she was a little girl, has always been a good saleswoman of various products. Thanks to the teachings of her parents, who were very well-known salespeople in the area. Beatriz now works doing the same thing her parents used to do and was able to send her kids to good schools. Now her kids are all grown-up and have good jobs and they all have their own families to take care of. Beatriz sells charcoal/fuel and refreshments. Thanks to God, her business is going very well. She's currently in the process of opening up a restaurant which she will run from her store. She doesn't have enough money and this is why she's requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz desde muy niña supo desenvolverse en los negocios de diversos productos, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres que fueron grandes comerciantes de la selva central. Ahora Beatriz trabaja en el mismo oficio de sus padres y con el ha podido mejorar la educación de sus hijos quienes ahora son profesionales y tienen su propia familia.Beatriz se dedica a la venta de combustibles y a la venta de bebidas en su pequeña bodega que gracias a Dios marcha muy bien y está pensando abrir un restaurante en su bodega pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder empezar y solicita le podamos apoyar con préstamo.

loans.use: To open up a restaurant

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Teresa has always been a very responsible homemaker, bussiness woman and mother. Thanks to the grocery store/pub she has had for the past 4 years, she has been able to send all her kids to good schools. She and her husband would like to continue to dream big and share their dreams with their kids. This is why they are requesting a loan to help them invest in the two main areas the're involved in which is commercial and agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Teresa siempre ha sido muy responsable en su hogar, en su negocio y con sus hijos, gracias a la pequeña bodega que posee por más de 4 años ha podido educar a sus pequeños con satisfacción.Ella y su esposo desean seguir colaborando y compartiendo los sueños de sus hijos y por esa razón solicitan un préstamo para optimizar sus dos actividades principales, el comercio y la agricultura

loans.use: To invest in her store and agriculture

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is very grateful that, with her previous Kiva loan, she was able to increase her stock of palm oil and peanuts. She invested the profit in purchasing more peanuts and sold them in Freetown. Her business expanded, and she is able to supplement her husband's meager income to help with family expenses. Fatmata is thankful to Kiva and would like the Le.800,000 loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of palm oil and peanuts

loans.name: Juana Yamileth

texts.es:
Mrs. T. has worked with Kiva partner Fundación Leon for the past nine years and has received 19 loans. She runs a general store located in her city's central market. She currently shares the site with her mother, but her dream is to be able to have her own store. She is married with two children, one in preschool. Her husband is a merchant and together they form a united pair that has been able to make headway thanks to hard work and persistence.
Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer
La señora T. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos nueve años donde ha recibido diecinueve creditos, ella tiene su negocio ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad, actualmente comparte un local con su mamá, pero su sueño es llegar a tener su propia tienda, es casada con dos niños, uno en educación pre-escolar y otro tierno su esposo trabaja como comerciante y son una pareja muy unido que han logrado salir adelante con el esfuerzo y empeño de ambos.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetics and jewelry / capital de trabajo compra de ropa, zapatos, cosmeticos y joyas.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
Madeleine is a young mother of a beautiful 3-year old girl. She sells firewood and furniture pieces such as drawers/chests which help her pay the monthly bills and the basic necessities of her little daughter. At this time, she's requesting a loan which she will used to renovate her home to accomodate/make room for a beautiful grocery/convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Madeleine, es una joven madre de una pequeña niña de tres años. Se dedica a la venta de leña y cajones que le ayudan con los gastos en su hogar y las necesidades de su pequeña hija, pero en estos momentos requiere de capital para poder ambientar su domicilio y hacer de ella una hermosa tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: To renovate her home to accomodate/make room for a grocery/convenience store

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina was able to open up a small store 3 years ago with the help of her husband's income who is a teacher at a local school. She has been able to take care of her store ever since by making sure everthing runs smoothly.

Due to the problems the country is currently dealing with, in terms of education, she would also like to offer a wide variety of other products. She would like to sell good quality products which a lot of times are not accessible in her community unless you go to nearby cities. She hopes to make a profit by offering a wider range of products.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Saturnina, gracias al ingreso de su esposo quien se desempeña como docente en un centro educativo pudo establecer una pequeña bodega y ya lleva más de 3 años dedicada a la atención y administración de su espacio de desarrollo.Debido a los problemas que están afectando al sector educativo de su país ha pensado llenar su bodega con una gran diversidad de productos, para poder no solo obtener ingresos sino dar la posibilidad de ofrecer a sus clientes productos de calidad y de difícil acceso por el alejamiento que tiene su comunidad a las ciudades más cercanas.

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia is a loving mother. The love towards her children motivate her into working hard each day and to never give up in life. This hard-working mother remembers with sadness how she got started in this business which was going from home to home, town to town selling school supplies.

Thanks to her effort and sacrifices, she was able to find a place that she could lease to sell her school supplies from. Her store is located in a very busy area in her native town of Juliaca. She's currently doing very well with the support of her older daughters. Her economic situation and the well-being of her family have improved. The wish of this loving and hard-working woman is to be able to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Florencia, es una madre diligente, el amor por sus hijos la motiva a seguir trabajando y a perseverar en la vida. Ésta laboriosa madre recuerda aquellos días difíciles cuando inició su negocio de venta de útiles escolares en forma ambulatoria, con mucha nostalgia. Gracias a su esfuerzo y a muchas privaciones pudo finalmente alquilar un local, implementarlo y abrir su pequeña librería en un lugar muy estratégico de su ciudad natal, Juliaca.Actualmente con apoyo de la mayor de sus hijas viene sacando adelante su negocio y con ella la situación económica y el bienestar de su familia se han incrementado. El deseo de esta emprendedora y amorosa mujer es adquirir un préstamo para aumentar el stock de su mercadería.

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda is a woman who diligently operates a small dry goods store out of her home. Her store is very popular and is frequently visited by her neighbors. In her store, they find everything they need at a very reasonable price and very friendly service. Since Amanda's dry goods store is one of just a few small stores that exist in the area, she often receives suggestions and requests for goods she does not carry. She wants to begin to stock these items in order to increase her income and better serve her customers. With this objective in mind, Amanda is asking for your help to obtain a loan.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Amanda, es una dama que con constancia y mucho esfuerzo ha ido implementando su pequeña bodeguita ubicada en su domicilio. Actualmente esta tiendita es muy visitada y solicitada por sus vecinos, quienes encuentran en este lugar todo lo que requieren y con precios sumamente cómodos y sobre todo una buena atención.Esta bodeguita de abarrotes es una de las pocas tienditas que existe en su localidad, es por ello que goza con una gran cantidad de solicitudes y sugerencias, solicitudes que desea complacer para mejorar sus ingresos y el servicio a sus clientes, Amanda. Con ese objetivo en mente recurre a vosotros en búsqueda de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase more goods in order to make her little bodega more popular

loans.name: Silvia Mery

texts.es:
Silvia belongs to Las Dalilas Community Bank, located in the Jr. Sucre 1013, in the Calleria District, in Ucayali, Peru. She is a 37 year-old mother of 2. Her husband is a bus driver. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos, she decided to begin selling frozen drinks.

With the earnings from this undertaking, she now has a place where she attends to clients with great care, sharing the care-taking of her store with some housekeepers, and counting on the help of her children and husband.

With this loan of $375.00, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy: sodas of all flavors and sizes, candies, and a few groceries.

Through working with Manuela Ramos, Silvia has found the motivation to move forward toward the well-being of herself and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Silvia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalilas, ubicado en el Jr. Sucre 1013, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es cobrador. Silvia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de bebidas heladas.

En la actualidad con las ganancias obtenidas ahora tiene un local donde atiende a sus clientes con mucho esmero, comparte la atención de su local con las labores domesticas de su hogar, contando con la ayuda de sus hijos y esposo.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: gaseosas de todos los precios y tamañas, golosinas en general, y un poco de abarrotes.

Silvia trabajando con Manuela Ramos le ha dado un motivo mas para seguir adelante por el bienestar de ella y de su familia.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more merchandise to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is a young man who has known the dignifying meaning and the value of hard work since he was just a boy. He worked very hard and suffered through a lot of economic hardships in order to complete his education. After a lot of hard work and effort, he finally got his degree from a technical institute. But he was unable to find work, and so he took the advice of his family and decided to get into the business of selling beer and gas. He buys goods in bulk and brings them to the Rinconada Mine, a distant, frigid part of his native city of Puno. There, he has been able to earn more money than he could by staying in the city in which he currently lives. His dream is to increase capital in order to increase his income and improve quality of life for himself and his humble parents, whom he wants to take care of.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Juan, es un joven que desde niño conoció el verdadero valor del trabajo y su dignificante significado. Para poder concluir sus estudios trabajó arduamente y pasó muchas privaciones económicas, ahora finalmente con esfuerzo terminó una carrera superior técnica y al ver que no lograba conseguir trabajo por consejo de su familia decidió dedicarse a la venta de cerveza y gas, mercadería que lleva por mayor hacia la mina Rinconada, lugar muy distante y frígido de su ciudad natal, Puno, consiguiendo obtener ingresos mayores a los que adquiere en su localidad.El deseo de este emprendedor joven es contar con más capital, que le permitirá acrecentar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus humildes padres por quienes desea velar.

loans.use: Capital increase to expand offerings

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 48515

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza is a diligent mother who left her native village of Sandia with many ideas about how to make a life for herself. She used her savings to buy a van to provide urban transit to the Juliacan public. She has also dedicated herself to selling gasoline, and with the two businesses she was able to build her home. This cheerful woman dreams of getting this loan, which she will use to fix her van, currently in need of repairs.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Esperanza, es una diligente madre que salió de su pueblo natal, Sandia, con muchas perspectivas para prosperar en la vida, con los ahorros que disponía decidió adquirir una combi y brindar servicios de transporte urbano a la población Juliaqueña, adicionalmente a este oficio viene dedicándose a la venta de combustible; negocios con los que ha logrado construir su vivienda.El deseo de esta alegre dama es adquirir un préstamo que tiene pensado invertir en la reparación de su vehículo que en estos momentos se encuentra paralizado.

loans.use: Repair her public transit vehicle

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 48516

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Just a few months ago, Lucia and her children tragically lost her husband. Since then, Lucia has had to be both a mother and a father to her sons, whom she watches over and tries to give love, wellbeing and an education so that they will grow up to be good men, just as she and her husband Teofilo had dreamed. When he was alive, Teofilo worked as a chauffeur to support the family. Lucia has been selling candies, soft drinks and fruits on foot, and dreams of expanding her fruit stand. She believes that once she can do this, her sales will improve, as will quality of life for herself and her young children. Lucia asks that you trust her; she promises to work her hardest to improve, with your help.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Hace sólo algunos meses Lucia y sus hijos sufrieron la penosa pérdida del jefe de su hogar. Desde entonces esta valerosa mujer se convirtió en padre y madre de sus retoños, por quienes vela y desea ofrecerles amor, bienestar y educación para que en el futuro sean hombres de bien como algún día lo soñó junto a su querido esposo Teófilo quien en vida trabajaba como chofer para mantener a su familia.El deseo de Lucia quien viene dedicándose a su negocio de venta de golosinas, bebidas gaseosas y frutas en forma ambulatoria es ampliar su puesto de ventas, Lucia considera que concretando su proyecto mejorarán sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de sus menores hijos.Lucía te pide que confíes en ella y se compromete a esforzarse para mejorar con tu ayuda.

loans.use: Expand fruit stand

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen wanted to work and increase her household income, so she and her oldest daugher decided to begin making and selling jewelry. They learned the process, and are now partners in making beautiful handmade jewelry in the comfort of their own home. They then sell their wares--along with a mix of other products--in different parts of the city, such as the Concepcion market. Their goal for the future is to have an actual store from which to sell their work; they continue to work hard in pursuit of this goal.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Las ansias de trabajar y apoyar a mejorar la economía de su hogar motivaron a Carmen a incursionar en el negocio de la bisutería, junto a su hija mayor. Se capacitaron y hoy son socias en la elaboración de bellas joyas artesanales en la comodidad de su casa para luego venderlas en diversos lugares de la ciudad como la feria de Concepción surtiéndola con diversos artículos. Su meta a futuro es poder tener un local estable para realizar sus ventas es por esa razón que seguirá esforzándose para alcanzar su objetivo.

loans.use: Expand product offerings

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.es:
Victoria, Maria and Gregoria are partners at the Banco Comunal Seccelambras. The are from the community with the same name which is 2 hours away from the city of Ayacucho.

Victoria is a widow. She is 48 years old and has 5 children. She sells food at the community's street market twice a week. She is also involved is agriculture.

Maria, on the other hand, is 28 years old, married and has 4 children. Maria runs a convenience store from her home and she also sells food daily.

Gregoria lives with a companion and is 28 years old. She has 2 children. Gregoria sells food at the community's street market.

Victoria, Maria and Gregoria need loans in the amounts of 600 soles, 900 soles and 1000 soles, respectively. This money will be used to purchase beef, pigs, rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk and vegetables.

Victoria's, Maria's and Gregoria's dreams are improvements to their business, to build capital and help their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Victoria, Maria y Gregoria son socias del Banco Comunal Seccelambras, ellas son D. la comunidad que lleva el misma el mismo nombre, que se ubica a 2 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Victoria es viuda tiene, 48 años y 5 hijos, Victoria venD. comida en la feria D. su comunidad, actividad que realiza una vez por semana. Además Victoria se dedica a la agricultura.

Por otro lado Maria es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, además venD. comida diariamente.

Mientras que Gregoria es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Gregoria venD. comida en la feria D. su comunidad.

Victoria, Maria y Gregoria necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. carne, cerdo, arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche y verduras.

Los sueños D. Victoria, Maria y Gregoria son mejorar sus negocios, tener capital propio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Victoria, Maria and Gregoria need loans in the amounts of 600 soles, 900 soles and 1000 soles, respectively. This money will be used to purchase beef, pigs, rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk and vegetables.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
