Simona is a partner at the Banco Comunal Seccelambras. She lives in the community of the same name which is 2 hours away from the city of Ayacucho.

Simona is a widow. She is 50 years old and has 10 children - three of them still live with her. Simona sells typical food during the day in her community. She also grows cereals and tubers that are sold at the Ayacucho's supply market. Additionally, she raises small livestock.

Simona needs a loan in the amount of 1000 soles which will be used to purchase pigs and lambs. Her dream is to own a convenience store, proviD. a good education to her children and have some money saved for her elderly years.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Simona es socia del Banco Comunal Seccelambras, ella es D. la comunidad que lleva el misma el mismo nombre, que se ubica a 2 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Simona es viuda, tiene 50 años y 10 hijos D. los cuales 3 viven con ella, Simona venD. comida típica los días D. feria en su comunidad. Además Simona se dedica a la agricultura D. cereales y tubérculos que luego venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. Ayacucho. También se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores.

Simona necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cerdos y oveja.

Los sueños D. Simona son tener una tienda D. abarrotes, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y tener dinero suficiente para su vejez.

loans.use: Simona needs a loan in the amount of 1000 soles which will be used to purchase pigs and lambs.

loans.name: Angelina's Group

texts.es:
Angélica, Julia and Sabina are partners from the Banco Comunal Seccelambras. They come from the community with the same name located 2 hours away from Ayacucho. Angelica is 37 years old, married and has 4 sons. She sell food at the community's street market and also runs a convenience stO. from her home. She is also involved in agriculture.

Julia, on the other hand, lives with a companion. She is 26 years old and has 3 children. Julia owns a convenience stO. located in her home.

Sabina is a single mother of 3 children and she is 44 years old. She sells firewood which she purchases in wholesale and resells them in her city.

Angelica, Julia and Sabina need loans in the amount of 1000 soles, 1000 soles and 900 soles respectively. This money will be used to purchase pigs, rice, sugar, sweets and firewood. Their dream is to improve their business and help their children get an education and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Angélica, Julia y Sabina son socias del Banco Comunal Seccelambras, ellas son de la comunidad que lleva el misma el mismo nombre, que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Angélica es casada, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Angélica vende comida en la feria de su comunidad, también tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Además Angélica se dedica a la agricultura.

Por otro lado Julia es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 3 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Mientras que Sabina es madre soltera, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Sabina vende leña que compra al por mayor y revende en su pueblo.

Angelica, Julia y Sabina necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 1000 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, leña.

Los sueños de Angélica, Julia y Sabina son mejorar sus negocios, educar a sus hijos y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Angelica, Julia and Sabina need loans in the amount of 1000 soles, 1000 soles and 900 soles, respectively. This money will be used to purchase pigs, rice, sugar, sweets and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothing in bulk to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Sanggam

texts.id:
Sanggam's daily occupation is collecting used and damaged items. Every day he has to move around to search and buy used items to be resold to the damaged items storage location. He only uses a cart and a bicycle. Besides family expenses, he also has to pay for his two children education expenses. Klien is persistent, although profit is not too high. He very much hope to be given the loan to increase his business capital. Living in Patih Jelantik street, he and family rent a room with monthly payment. The room condition is OK, although the roof is from tinroof, and floor is rough cement.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sanggam sehari-harinya bekerja sebagai pengumpul barang-barang bekas dan rongsokan. Setiap harinya dia harus berjalan keliling untuk mencari dan membeli barang-barang bekas yang kemudian dijual kembali ke tempat pengeumpulan rongsokan. Sarana yang dipakai hanya gerobak dan sepeda dayung. Selain harus memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya, dia juga harus menyekolahkan kedua anaknya. Klien cukup ulet meskipun keuntungan yang didapat tidak terlalu banyak. Dia sangat mengharapkan diberi pinjaman untuk bisa dijadikan tambahan modal usaha. Bertempat tinggal di Jl.Patih Jelantik, dia bersama keluarganya menyewa kamar dengan pembayaran bulanan. Kondisi kamarnya lumayan bagus, tetapi atapnya hanya dari seng dan lantainya dari semen kasar.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Suyono

texts.id:
Suyono currently lives in Mertasari street Denpasar, by renting a room for Rp.150.000 (about US$19) a month. His sales location is not too far from his living quarters. His business is Tofu and packed rice sales. Usually he sells from 5:00 PM to 10:00PM. Suyono is already in this business for 3 years, and income is sufficient to support the family with child and wife. This time Suyono's request for loan would be used for capital increase, so that his business could expand.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Suyono saat ini tinggal di Jl.Mertasari Denpasar dengan menyewa kamar Rp.150.000 per bulan. Tempat berjualannya tidak begitu jauh dari tempat tinggalnya. Adapun jenis usahanya adalah sebagai penjual tahu lontong. Biasanya dia berjualan dari jam 5 sore sampai dengan jam 10 malam. Suyono sudah menjalankan usaha ini selama 3 tahun dan penghasilan yang didapat cukup untuk kebutuhan keluarga bersama anak dan istrinya. Saat ini Suyono bermaksud mengajukan pinjaman yang dipakai sebagai tambahan modal usaha, sehingga usahanya bisa lebih berkembang.

loans.use: To increase  business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Arik

texts.id:
Arik S. currently lives in Wibisana street Denpasar by renting land then building a semi permanent house on it. The business he is in is meatballs sales. The location is not too far from where he lives. Usually he sells between 11:00AM to 7:00PM. Suyono is already in this business for years, and income is sufficient to support the family with child and wife. This time Suyono's request for loan would be used for capital increase, so that his business could expand.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Arik S. saat ini tinggal di Jl.Wibisana Denpasar dengan mengontrak tanah lalu kemudian membangun rumah semi permanen diatasnya. Usaha sehari-harinya adalah sebagai penjual bakso. Tempat berjualannya tidak begitu jauh dari tempat tinggalnya. Biasanya dia berjualan dari jam 11 siang sampai dengan jam 7 malam. Suyono sudah menjalankan usaha ini selama bertahun-tahun dan penghasilan yang didapat cukup untuk kebutuhan keluarga bersama anak dan istrinya. Saat ini Suyono bermaksud mengajukan pinjaman yang dipakai sebagai tambahan modal usaha, sehingga usahanya bisa lebih berkembang.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Edi

texts.id:
Edi B. today lives in Wibisana Barat street Denpasar with his wife Nur Yatim. He is in this buying and selling used items business since 2003. He usually collects used items 2X/day. Early in the morning strating at 6:00 AM, and evenings starting at 16:00. His operation route are around Gunung Agung street Denpasar and near terminal Ubung. The assortment of collected items include beverage cans, mineral water bottles and used newspaper. Package goods and cartons he usually buys from shops in Denpasar. From his profits he is saving to prepare for his first child's upcoming birth.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Edi B. saat ini tinggal di Jl.Wibisana Barat Denpasar bersama Nur Yatim istrinya. Dia sudah menekuni usaha jual beli barang bekas sejak tahun 2003. Ia biasanya mencari barang bekas 2 kali sehari. Pagi hari Ia berangkat jam 06.00 dan sore Ia berangkat jam 16.00. Jalur yang biasa ditempuh adalah sekitaran Jl.Gunung Agung Denpasar dan dekat terminal Ubung. Adapun jenis barang yang dikumpulkan adalah kaleng minuman, gelas air mineral dan koran-koran bekas. Dos atau kardus biasanya dia beli dari toko-toko di Denpasar. Dari keuntungan yang dia dapat, bisa disisihkan sebagai persiapan bagi kelahiran anak pertamanya.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Ida Ermayati

texts.id:
Ida's daily work is sales of food and drinks in a cantine of Muhammadiyah Middle school and High school in Pulau Batam street Denpasar. The assortment of food offered include mixed rice, fried items, drinks like juice and packed soft drinks. She has been in this business for 5 years, and every day she starts at 7:00 AM until 2:00 PM. The business is promising, since food offered is finished daily, because of the many school children who likes to eat at her place. Food offered are of her own cooking. Profit obtained was enough to provide schooling for her children who are in highshool . Ida hopes to obtain the loan for expanding her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Pekerjaan sehari-hari Ida adalah sebagai penjual makanan dan minuman di kantin SMP dan SMA Muhammadiyah di Jl.Pulau Batam Denpasar. Adapun jenis makanan yang dijajakan seperti nasi campur, gorengan dan minuman seperti jus dan minuman ringan dalam kemasan. Sudah sekitar 5 tahun Ida menjalankan usaha ini dan setiap harinya dia bekerja mulai jam 7 pagi sampai jam 2 siang. Usaha ini cukup menjanjikan karena makanan yang dijajakan setiap hari selalu habis, karena begitu banyaknya anak sekolah yang ingin makan ditempatnya. Makanan yang dijajakan adalah hasil masakannya sendiri. Keuntungan yang didapat bisa untuk menyekolahkan anak-anaknya yang sampai saat ini sudah dibangku SMA. Ida berharap bisa mendapatkan pinjaman untuk dipakai mengembangkan usahanya.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Dilbaroy

texts.en: K. Dilbaroy is 35 years old. She’s the loving mother of two children. Dilbaroy’s husband is a businessman. They both are working hard in order to support their family and to ensure their children shall have opportunity to have higher education. Already for 6 years she is selling the bedclothes in the local market “Somon-bozor”. This market is very popular among the population that is why Dilbaroy has a lot of clients. As a rule Dilbaroy travels to Bishkek which is located in the neighboring country Kyrgyzstan for purchasing the new goods. She tries to choose various goods of good quality and attractive prices which allows her keeping the clientele. The business brings the stable income and allows Dilbaroy to improve the living conditions for her family and to make savings for the future of her children. Dilbaroy requests 990 $ US Dollars for purchasing the bedclothes in order to increase the range of goods. Dilbaroy would like to thank everybody for supporting her and promises that she will pay the loan in 9 months promptly.

loans.use: Purchasing of bedclothes for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.id:
Nyoman S. manages a restaurant and shop that sells rice (both cooked for a meal or to purchase dry in bulk). Her business has already grown because her first loan from Kiva allowed her to increase her inventory. She would like to receive a second loan to lease an additional place to sell rice. In addition to selling rice, she also sells fuel. The money she brings in is enough to lighten the day-to-day burdens on her family. She currently lives with her husband in a single rented room on Tegal Jaya Street in Denpasar, Bali.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Warung nasi yang dikelola Nyoman sekarang sudah berkembang sebab dari pinjaman pertama dia bisa menambah barang-barang dagangannya. Rencananya pinjaman periode ke 2 ini akan dipakai sebagai modal untuk menyewa tempat lagi untuk jualan nasi. Selain jealan nasi, sehari-hari juga Nyoman berjualan bensin eceran. Keuntungan dari usahanya cukup untuk menambah mengurangi beban keluarga. Saat ini dia tinggal bersama suaminya di Jl.Tegal Jaya Denpasar dengan menyewa sebuah kamar.

loans.use: to increase funding for her business

loans.name: Dilbaroy

texts.en:
Dilbaroy K. is 35 years old, and she is the loving mother of two children. Dilbaroy’s husband is a businessman. They both work extremely hard in order to support their family and to ensure that their children have the opportunity to receive a higher education. For the past 6 years she has been selling bed clothes in the local market known as “Somon-bozor,” which is a very popular market among the population and is why Dilbaroy has a great deal of clients. Generally, Dilbaroy travels to Bishkek, which is located in the neighboring country of Kyrgyzstan, to purchase new goods. When purchasing new goods, she tries to choose various products of high quality at reasonable prices, which allows her to maintain a dedicated and loyal client base.

The business generates stable income and thereby allows Dilbaroy to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for the needs of her children as they grow older. Dilbaroy is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to increase her inventory of bed clothes and to expand the range of goods she offers to her customers. Dilbaroy would like to thank everybody for supporting her and promises that she will pay the loan back within the 9-month loan term.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and to meet her customers' demands by purchasing a wider array of goods

loans.name: Sugiarti

texts.id:
Sugiarti lives with her family on Pulau Pinang Street in Denpasar, Bali. She has a land contract for 3,000,000 Rupiah per year for 1 acre of land. On the land she has built 9 rooms which she rents out for 130,000 Rupiah per month each. For her everyday work, Sugiarti has a shop called Warung Sembako which sells basic supplies to families like rice, cooking oil, flour and other items. ("Sembako" is a shortened version of the term "Sembilan Bahan Pokok" which means the "9 necessities of life" . These necessities consist of rice, sugar, fuel, salt, salted fish, cooking oil, coffee, eggs, and flour.) She also has a motorcycle which she uses to shop for additional inventory if her supplies run out. Sugiarti would like to receive this loan so she can further increase her business funding.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Sugiarti tinggal bersama keluarganya di Jl.Pulau Pinang Denpasar. Dia mengontrak tanah sebesar Rp.3.000.000 per tahun dengan luas 1 acre. Dari tanah ini dia membangun 9 kamar yang kemudian disewakan per bulannya sebesar Rp.130.000. Kegiatan sehari-harinya adalah sebagai penjual bahan-bahan pokok kebutuhan keluarga seperti beras, minyak goreng, tepung dan lain-lain. Sarana yang dipakai adalah sebuah sepeda motor, yang digunakan berbelanja jika dagangannya habis. Kali ini Sugiarti bermaksud mengajukan pinjaman untuk dipakai sebagai tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: to increase funding for her business

loans.name: Domullojonova

texts.ru:
M. is 31 and has a high school education. She is married with four children. M. has a business selling vegetables wholesale; right now, her main business is in carrots. She would like a loan in order to expand into selling potatoes, beets, and other vegetables as well. M.'s husband is a mechanic. Her children are in school. M. has a steady income from her business and would like to increase her sales volume.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Манзура женщина в возросте 31 год замужем имеет 4 детей , образование имеет среднее .Она занимается оптовой продажей овощей восновном сейчас продает морковь.Получив кредит Манзура хочет увеличить ассортимент, продавать нетолько морковь но и картофель , свекла. и.т.д. Муж работает слесарем. Дети учатся в средней школе. Манзура имеет доход со своего бизнеса и хочет увеличить товарооборот.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for sale

loans.name: Supiyati

texts.id:
Supiyati earns her living by collecting recyclables. Every morning she begins her work collecting items from 5:00AM to 8:00AM and then continues again later in the afternoon. She travels around a large area carrying sacks that she uses to collect the items she finds. She collects a variety of items such as old buckets, newspapers and water bottles. Sometimes she also goes to houses and pays people a small fee to take their recyclables. The money she brings in is enough to pay for food and drinks every day. Supiyati hopes to get this loan to help increase her business funding.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Kegiatan sehari-hari Supiyati adalah sebagai pengumpul barang-barang bekas dan rongsokan. Setiap pagi dia harus mulai bekerja pada jam 05.00 sampai jam 08.00 dan kemudian berangkat lagi pada sore harinya. Dia berjalan keliling sambil membawa karung yang dipakai untuk menampung barang-barang hasil cariannya. Berbagai jenis barang bekas dikumpulkan seperti ember bekas, koran bekas dan juga botol bekas air mineral. Kadang juga dia harus membeli dari rumah dengan harga murah. Keuntungan yang didapat cukup untuk biaya makan dan minum sehari-hari. Supiyati mengharapkan diberi pinjaman untuk menambah modal usaha.

loans.use: to increase funding for her business

loans.name: Wasis

texts.id:
Wasis is originally from Java, but has spent quite a few years living in Bali running his own motorcycle repair shop. He has one employee who helps him and he brings in 600,000 Rupiah per month. He gets plenty of business in his shop because it is located next to a busy street with lots of motorcycle traffic. (Motorcycles are a common form of transportation for individuals and families in Indonesia) The income he gets from his business is used to pay for household necessities and also for purchasing spare parts for motorcycles. Wasis would like to grow his business, but he has been held back by his lack of funding. He would like to receive a loan to help him reach his goal.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Wasis sebenarnya merupakan pendatang dari Jawa. Sudah beberapa tahun ini dia menetap di Bali dan mempunyai usaha bengkel kendaraan bermotor. Dari usahanya ini dia dibantu satu orang karyawan dan digaji Rp.600.000 per bulan. Keuntungan yang didapat setiap cukup besar, dikarenakan bengkelnya berada di jalur yang padat lalu lintas. Hasilnya bisa dipakai untuk keperluan rumah tangga dan juga untuk membeli suku cadang untuk kendaraan bermotor. Saat ini Wasis bermaksud untuk mengembangkan usahanya tapi terkendala modal. Oleh karena itu dia sangat berharap bisa diberi pinjaman oleh DINARI.

loans.use: to increase funding for his business

loans.name: Hasanova

texts.ru:
G. is a 30-year-old divorced mother of three. She sells vegetables at the market in Khujand. Right now, G. lives with her parents and brothers. They help her out, since her turnover isn't high and she isn't making a very big profit. In order to expand her business, G. has applied for a loan from Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Гульнора возрост 30 лет имеет 3 детей с мужем разведена , сама торгует на рынке Худжанда . В данное время Гульнора живет вместе с родителями и братьями , которые помогают ей по жизни , т.к. ее оборот пока не велик и прыбыль конечно она имеет не большую. Поэтому для того чтобы увеличит свой бизнес она решила обратится в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Selling vegetables

loans.name: Alfandi

texts.id:
Kegiatan sehari-hari Alfandi adalah sebagai perajin perak. Dia melakukan kegiatannya ini dirumahnya di Jl.Patih Jelantik Denpasar. Saat ini dia sudah memiliki pelanggan tetap yang siap membeli hasil kerajinannya. Selain menjualna langsung, dia juga menitipkan hasil kretivitasnya di toko-toko souvenir di daerah Kuta. Penghasilannya lumayan besar, tergantung musim kunjungan turis di Bali. Keuntungan yang didapat cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Saat ini dia membutuhkan modal untuk mengembangkan usahanya.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Alfandi E. is a silversmith. He does his work at his home on Patih Jelantik Street in Denpasar, Bali. He has many customers who come to him directly for his excellent craftsmanship. In addition to direct sales, Alfandi also sells his creations to souvenir shops around Kuta, Bali (a prime tourist area). The income he makes from his work is enough to maintain his household. He would like to receive this loan so he can further grow his business.

loans.use: to increase funding for his business

loans.name: Ketut Alit

texts.id:
Ketut Alit C. lives in Jl. Mertsari Suwung Denpasar with her husband and their 5 children. They rented land and built a clean and fine house on it. They sell building materials in a store, 3 km away from their home. They have had 2 trucks to carry sands shoveled from Karangasem (±60 km), and hire 6 employees, as drivers and workers. The income they earn is used for financing their children tuition fee.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Saat ini klien tingal di Jl.Mertsari Suwung Denpasar. Dia tinggal bersama suami dan 5 anaknya dengan meneywa tanah dan membangun rumah diatasnya. Keadaan rumahnya cukup bersih dan sehat. Tempat usahanya hanya berjarak 3 km dari rumahnya. Adapun jenis usahanya adalah sebagai penjual pasir bangunan. Saat ini dia mempunyai 2 buah kendaraan untuk mengangkut pasir yang diambil dari Karangasem (±60 km). Saat ini dia mempekerjakan 6 orang karyawan sebagai sopir maupun sebagai kuli angkut. Keuntungan yang didapat dipakai untuk biaya sekolah anak-anaknya.

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Bebun P.

texts.id:
This proposed loan will be the second loan for Bebun. He has already paid the first. From the first loan, he felt that there is an improvement in his business, even though only a small difference. He still starts to collects trash early in the morning, and sorts, measures the weight, and resells the trash in the afternoon.

Bebun proposes to earn the loan to be able to improve his business that enables him to save to build his own house in Java.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Pinjaman kali ini merupakan pinjaman periode kedua bagi Bebun. Pinjaman sebelumnya sudah dilunasi. Dar pinjaman sebelumnya dia merasakan ada perubahan dalam usahanya, meskipun masih sangat kecil. Kegiatan sehari-hari tetap seperti biasanya, berangkat pagi hari mencari barang bekas dan rongsokan, lalu pada sore harinya dipisahkan menurut jenis kemudian ditimbang dan dijual. Kali ini Bebun bermaksud mengajukan pinjaman lagi untuk bisa mengembangkan usahanya dan bisa ditabung untuk membangun rumahnya di Pulau Jawa.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
Rafoat R. is 38 years old. She is married, and she has 3 children. Her husband is unemployed at the present time, which is why she is the only one who is currently earning money to support their family. Rafoat and her husband are raising their children with love and are trying to ensure that their kids have everything they need as they grow up.  
Rafoat has been running her business already for 7 years. She sells fabrics, which are supplied from Dubai, United Arabian Emirates, and Kyrgyzstan, for the national dresses. The national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and are a very important item for the dowry of any girl. Rafoat has trading spaces in three local markets. Because she is always very polite and has good taste in clothes, she has developed a dedicated and loyal client base in each of her three sales locations. 
Rafoat is trying to develop a wider range of goods to meet the ever-changing demands of her customers and to satisfy the needs of her clients who have different levels of income. Currently Rafoat is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to be repaid over a term of 6 months to order a new stock of fabrics from Dubai. She would like to thank everybody who made the decision to support her and promises to pay the loan back within the 6-month term.

loans.use: To diversify her product line by purchasing new fabrics to better accommodate her clients

loans.name: Hadiyatin

texts.id:
Hadiyatin has sold “nasi campur” (an Indonesian mixed topped rice) since 2001. Her customers are garment factory and construction workers who work around Jl. Gunung Gede, and people who pass her booth. Everyday, she should go to Pasar Sahira at 4 am to purchase the materials that will be cooked, i.e. vegetables, meat, and seasonings. Then she cooks and being ready to start selling the food at 7 am. Around this time, her booth is very crowded with customers.

The revenue she earns is used as the capital that enables her to run the booth the day after, while the excess is used for fulfilling Hadiyatin family’s needs. She expects to earn the loan that will be used to increase the capital of her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Hadiyatin menekuni usaha jual nasi campur sejak tahun 2001. Para pembelinya adalah para buruh garmen dan buruh bangunan yang ada di Jl.Gunung Gede, dan juga orang-orang yang lewat di kawasan tempatnya berjualan. Sehari-harinya, dia harus berangkat ke Pasar Sahira pada pukul 04.00 untuk membeli bahan-bahan untuk warungnya seperti sayur, daging dan bumbu. Sesuadah itu dia pulang untuk memasak dan menyiapkannya sebelum warungnya buka jam 07.00 pagi. Pada jam ini biasanya banyak sekali pembeli yang singgah diwarungnya. Dari keuntungan usaha ini, bisa dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya sehari-hari dan juga sebagai modal lagi. Hadiyatin berharap diberi pinjaman untuk dijadikan tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Marsida

texts.id:
Everyday, Marsida trades various cakes around Suwung Denpasar. She rides a motorcycle to sell the cakes door-to-door. She uses the revenue of the sales as the capital to trade cakes the next day, while the excess is used to fulfill her family’s daily needs. She is expecting more capital to enlarge the business.

Together with her family, Marsida is now living in a rented room in Jl. Mertasari Denpasar.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Usaha sehari-hari yang dijalani oleh Marsida adalah sebagai penjual kue di sekitar Suwung Denpasar. Dia harus berkeliling menggunakan sepeda motornya untuk menjajakan kuenya dari rumah ke rumah. Keuntungan yang didapat kadang dipakai sebagai modal untuk berjualan lagi, sisanya untuk kebutuhan rumah tangga. Saat ini dia sangat mengharapkan bantuan modal untuk mengembangkan usaha jualan kuenya. Bersama keluarganya, Marsida saat ini tinggal dengan menyewa kamar di Jl.Mertasari Denpasar.

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
B. Zamira is an unmarried, 28-year-old woman. Zamira has been operating her own business for 5 years already. Zamira sells clothes for kids and women in a store located in one of the most highly-inhabited parts of the city. Because Zamira is very nice and polite, she has developed a dedicated and loyal client base. Accordingly, the business is quite stable and serves as a significant source of income for her family. 
Currently she is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to be repaid over a 9-month term in order to increase the business' stock of summer clothes for kids and women. She promises to pay the loan back on time and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To increase inventory and to prepare for the summer sales season by purchasing new kids' and women's clothes

loans.name: N.

texts.id:
S. sells cakes everyday. She has sold cakes for more than 7 years. She starts selling cakes from 5 to 9 am and 5 to 9 pm everyday. From her home to her selling area is only about 100 meters that she can do the selling until late of night.

She lives with her parents in a Rp 500,000 per year rented house in Jl. Laksamana Suwung Denpasar. All of the family members are in a good health. Her husband, who is a fisherman, only comes home once in 3 months.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Kegiatan sehari-hari S. adalah sebagai penjual kue. Klien saat ini tinggal di Jl.Laksamana Suwung Denpasar. Usaha sebagai penjual kue sudah dijalani lebih dari 7 tahun. Setiap hari dia berjualan dari jam 5 sampai jam 9 pagi, begitu juga disore hari dia berjualan dari jam 5 sampai jam 9. Jarak tempat dia berjualan dengan rumahnya hanya sekitar 100 meter, jadi dia bisa berjualan sampai larut malam. Klien bersama orang tuanya tinggal dirumah kontrakan dengan biaya Rp.500.000 per tahun. Keadaan keluarganya sehat. Suaminya, yang berprofesi sebagai nelayan, hanya pulang sekali dalam tiga bulan.

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis W. is a 50-year-old husband and father of eleven children. He lives with his two wives in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya. He is a well-known member of the community, probably due to his good work. Francis has trained as a community health worker and has been providing home-based care for people living with HIV/AIDS for the past seven years. He also runs several income-generating activities, including poultry farming and fishing, and also grows various produce on a small scale. His vast knowledge and experience, positive attitude and kindness have earned him a good reputation within his community. His well-established businesses have been quite successful due to his loyal and wide clientele base. Francis requires $700 to further expand his poultry farming.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farming

loans.name: Nanik

texts.id: Klien sudah masuk pada pinjaman kedua. Setelah melunasi pinjaman pertama, kali ini klien mengajukan pinjaman lagi. Profesi yang dijalani masih seperti sebelumnya yaitu sebagai penjual bahan pokok rumah tangga seperti beras, minyak goreng dan lain-lain. Usahanya cukup mengalami peningkatan meskipun terkadang ada kendala karena harga bahan pokok sekarang terus naik. Tetapi hal itu tidak mengurangi semangatnya untuk terus berusaha. Penghsilannya bersama suaminya yang berprofesi sebagai staff pom bensin cukup untuk membayar sewa rumah tahunan dan meemnuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga sehari-hari

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru:
Akbar Q., 42, lives in Shahrinav District. He is married. Akbar has a high school education. He works in the Shahrinav District Department of Acquaculture. Aside from this, he also has a plot of land where he grows vegetables. He has been farming for 10 years. He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. He can repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Каюмов Акбар проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 42 года , женат. Образование среднее. Работает в управлении водного хозяйства района Шахринау. Кроме того имеет участок земли . который использует для посева овощей. Занимается земледелием уже 10 лет. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить удобрения и семена. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Radjab

texts.ru:
Radjab Khikmatovich Bobokhonov lives in Shahrinav district. He is 36 and married with four children. He has a high school education. Radjab has been making a living in agriculture for more than five years. He has a plot of land where he grows wheat. He uses part of the wheat to make flour for his own use, since ready-made bread products at the market are pricey. Radjab sells the remainder of his wheat to his neighbors, and at the market. In order to cultivate good wheat, he needs money to buy mineral fertalizer and flammable lubricant. Radjab has decided to take out a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Бобохонов Раджаб Хикматович проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст 36 лет, женат ,имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Раджаб занимается сельским хозяйством более 5 лет. Он выращивает пшеницу на своем земельном участке.Часть пшеницы он перемалывает в муку и использует в собственных целях. Так как готовая хлебо-булочная продукция на рынке стоит дорого. Оставшуюся часть пшеницы клиент продает соседям и на рынке. Для выращивания хорошей пшеницы клиенту нужны средства для миниральных удобрений и ГСМ. Раджаб решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer and flammable lubricant

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru:
Bunafsha Karamatovna K. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 42, is married and has 4 children. She has a secondary education. Bunafsha is involved in agriculture. She has more than 5 years experience of growing vegetables. She has a small plot of land near her house where she grows vegetables for her family and for sale at the local market. Currently, she needs money to purchase new seedlings and chemical fertilizers. That is why she decided to apply for a loan. She plans to repay her loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Кахорова Бунафша Кароматовна жительница района Шахринав . Возраст 42, она замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Бунафша занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет опыт в этой сфере более 5 лет. При доме она имеет небольшой участок земли, где выращивает овощи для семьи и для продажи на местном рынке. В данный момент она хочет закупить саженцы и минеральные удобрения, для чего ей нужны деньги. Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Ni Luh

texts.id:
Ni Luh is a mother of one. She, her husband and their kid live in Raya Sesetan street, Denpasar, Bali. She works as a snack seller. Her business is quite good even though with the increasing of prices of snacks she has to cut off her inventory level. She hopes that the loan money can be used to add her working capital so she can afford to add more inventory to be resold.

She hopes this can help her to expand her business so she can save more money for her kid's education.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Profesi sehari-hari Ni Luh adalah sebagai pedagang makanan kecil (snack). Usaha yang dijalaninya sampai saat ini lumayan lancar, meskipun kadang karena naiknya harga barang dia harus mengurangi stok jualannya. Tetapi sampai saat ini usahanya masih berjalan lancar. Dia sangat berharap diberi pinjaman yang nantinya akan dipakai sebagai tambahan modal berjualan. Penghasilannya dari berjualan sampai saat ini cukup untuk kebutuhan rumah tangga saja. Dia sangat berkeinginan untuk mengembangkan usahanya untuk sehingga nantinya bisa menabung untuk anaknya bersekolah. Saat ini klien tinggal bersama suami dan anaknya di Jl.Raya Sesetan Denpasar. Keadaan keluarganya sehat.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru:
Safargul Nematovna K. lives in the Khuroson region. She is 38 years old, is a widow and has 5 children. She has a secondary school education. Safargul buys and sells fruits and vegetables at the local market. This business is the only source of income for her large family. All her children are secondary school students. Safargul has been in this business for more than 3 years. Currently she wants to increase the assortment of the produce she sells and has applied for a loan to do just that. She plans to repay her loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Камолова Сафаргул Неъматовна проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 38 лет. Вдова, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Сафаргул занимается куплей продажей овощей и фруктов на местном рынке. Бизнес я вляется единственныи источником дохода ее большой семьи. Все дети клиентки учатся в средней школе. Сафаргул имеет опыт в бизнесе более 3 лет.В данное время клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки для чего ей нужны деньги. Сафаргул решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of the produce

loans.name: Homid

texts.ru:
Homid Halmahmadovich B. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 25 and is married with one child. For over 3 years, Homid has been involved in animal husbandry. Homid purchases young bull calves, fattens them for 45 days and then resells them at the local market for a higher price. This business is the only source of income for his family. Currently Homid has plans to purchase 3 bull calves. After fattening them Homid would be able to sell the young bulls for a profit. He needs money to purchase the bull calves. That is why he has applied for a loan. He plans to pay the loan back in 5 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Бобокалонов Хомид Холмахмадович проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 25 лет, женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Хомид более 3 лет занимается животноводством. Эта деятельность является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Клиент покупает на местном рынке молодых бычков,откармливает их 45 дней и перепродает их на том же рынке по более выгодной цене. В данный момент клиент хочет купить 3 бычков и отправить их на пастбище. После чего он может их продать по высокой цене. Поэтому ему нужны деньги и он решил взять кредит. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 5 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase bull calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nurjanah

texts.id:
Nurjanah is a mother of one. She lives in a rented room for IDR 150,000/ month (around USD 19/ month). Her husband is a sailor and he usually comes home once every 3 months.

She supports her family by becoming a massage therapist. She's been in this business for quite a while. She learns the massaging skill from her parents.

Almost everyday she receives requests from customers. Many of them are regular customers for years. In addition to her work as a massage therapist, she also works in a local food stall. She works from the morning until mid day. She is paid for IDR 500 thousand/ month by the stall owner. After that she works as a massage therapist.

She has to spent money to buy massage oil and also to pay transport cost to commute from her house to her customers' houses. Therefore she hopes that the loan money can help her to buy more massage oil and also to ease her transportation cost.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Saat ini, klien tinggal di Jl.Laksamana Suwung Denpasar bersama anak tunggalnya dengan menyewa sebuah kamar dengan biaya per bulan Rp.150.000. Suaminya saat ini sedang berlayar dan biasanya pulang 3 bulan sekali. Usaha yang dijalaninya saat ini adalah sebagai tukang pijat dan itu ditekuninya sudah sejak lama. Keahlian memijat ini didapat dari orangtuanya. Hampir setiap hari Nurjanah mendapat panggilan untuk memijat baik itu ditempat sekitar rampat tinggalnya maupun ditempat yang cukup jauh. Banyak langganannya yang tetap memakai jasanya selama bertahun-tahun. Selain sebagai tukang pijat, Nurjanah juga bekerja disebuah warung makan dengan bayaran Rp.500.000, tetapi untuk saat ini dia hanya bisa bekerja dari pagi sampai siang hari. Pada sore harinya dia bisa memenuhi panggilan pijat. Saat ini Nurjanah memohon bantuan untuk bisa dipakai membeli minyak pijat dan juga untuk biaya transportasi.

loans.use: To buy massage oil and cost of transport/ commuting  (Membeli minyak pijat dan transportasi)

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru:
Jurabek H. lives in Shahrinav. He is 36 and is married with 2 children. He owns a truck and works as a truck driver. He has been a truck driver for 10 years. Currently, his truck is in need of repairs and Jurabek needs money to pay for the repairs. Jurabek’s job as a truck driver is the only source of income for his family. It also allows local people to use his services at an affordable price. He plans to repay his loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Халимов Джурабек проживает в Шахринау. Возраст 36 лет, женат и имеет 2 детей. Работает водителем грузового такси. Имеет грузовой автомобиль.Работает уже 10 лет. Произошла поломка ходовой части и теперь ему необходимо его отремонтировать. На это ему нужно получить кредит. Его деятельность является единственным источником дохода его семьи, а так же помогает населению пользоваться данными услугами в своей местности по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purhcase spare parts for his truck and pay for repairs

loans.name: Putu

texts.id:
Putu S., 46 year old, is a mother of two. Her husband works as a fish seller. They live in Mertasari street in Denpasar, Bali.

Her husband's income is low and therefore she needs to work to help with the family's finance. She opens a store at her house, selling basic daily necessities such as food, cooking ingredients etc.

The recent gas price increase drove the increase of the price of other goods, including the prices of daily necessities. Therefore she needs more capital to be able to buy goods for her store's inventory. She hopes she can get loan money to add her working capital.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Putu S. , seorang ibu 46 tahun dengan 2 orang anak, saat ini tinggal di Jl. Mertasari Denpasar. Usaha suaminya sebagai pedagang ikan tidak cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Oleh karena itu dia harus ikut bekerja untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga. Usahanya saat ini adalah sebagai penjual sembako untuk kebutuhan rumaha tangga. Saat ini Putu S. sangat membutuhkan bantuan dana untuk menambah barang jualannya. Kenaikan BBM sangat mempengaruhi naiknya harga barang dan sembako sehingga klien perlu bantuan modal untuk tetap bisa menjalankan usahanya.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Hursheda

texts.ru:
Hursheda V. lives in Shahrinav region. She is 22 years old and single. She has a small shop where she sells cell phone cards and accepts payments from cell phone users . She has been in this business for a year. Currently, she needs to pay the rent for her shop several months ahead. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. She plans to use the loan to pay her rent, thereby allowing her to stay in business. She plans to pay her loan back in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Вохидова Хуршеда живет в районе Шахринау. Возраст 22 года. Не замужем. Имеет свой небольшой диллерский центр, где продает сим карты и принимает оплату на телефонную связь. Занимается этим видом бизнеса 1 год. Но в данный момент ей нужно оплатить арендную плату за помещение за несколько месяцев вперед. Но на это у нее не хватает денег. Она планирует получить кредит , оплатить аренду и остаться при деле. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: To pay rent

loans.name: Punito P.

texts.id:
Punito, 57 years old, is a garbage / used goods collector. He usually looks for garbage/ used goods in his surrounding neighborhood, which is in Patih Jelantik street and also around Denpasar.

He can only works until mid day because of his old age. After a quick noon break, he then continues with filtering and selecting the goods collected in the morning. He then brings the goods to the used goods depot and sells them there.

He wants to use the loan money as his capital so he can also buys used goods from others. By doing this he will no longer solely rely to his own work to collect used goods.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan sehari-hari Punito adalah sebagai pemulung atau pengumpul barang-barang bekas. Setiap pagi dia sudah harus berangkat mencari barang bekas untuk dikumpulkan. Lokasi yang biasanya dia lalui adalah kawasan sekitar tempat tinggalnya, di Jl.Patih Jelantik dan juga di kawasan Denpasar. Diusianya yang saat ini yang sudah mencapai 57 tahun, dia hanya kuat bekerja sampai menjelang siang hari. Setelah beristirahat sebentar, dia melanjutkan dengan menyaring dan memisahkan barang bekas menurut jenisnya. Setelah itu, dia membawa ke tempat pengumpulan dan menimbang lalu menjualnya. Harapannya saat ini, bisa diberi bantuan modal, sehingga nantinya dia bisa membeli barang bekas kemudian menjualnya lagi, tidak hanya mencari seperti yang dia lakukan sekarang.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Nazarbek

texts.ru:
Nazarbek M. lives in the Shahrinau area. He is 45 years old, married with no children. He has a community college degree. He grows vegetables as a business on a piece of land that he owns. He has been doing this for 15 years. Right now it’s planting season and Nazarbek needs money to buy seeds and fertilizer. But because prices for seeds and fertilizer have gone up, he can no longer afford to buy them without a loan. He plans to repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Мирзоев Назарбек проживает в районе Шахринау.Возраст 45 лет. Женат ,детей не имеет. Образование среднее.Занимается растениеводством. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает овощами.Сейчас посевной сезон и клиенту нужны деньги для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений .Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет . но всвязи стем , что цены на семена и удобрения возросли без кредита клиент не может купить необходимые для посева вещи. Поэтому клиент решил обратиться к нам за кредитом. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina has an established business selling women’s clothing in the city of Simferopol in southern Ukraine. She currently has five vending locations at a huge outdoor market where hundreds of vendors sell all sorts of items. Irina started her business about 20 years ago. She has an entrepreneurial mind, and she has worked hard to develop her business. Buying clothing inventory from Turkey, where she can get better prices, is one way in which she is able to gain a competitive business advantage. Moreover, she is planning on bringing goods in from China. Irina is married, and she has a 20-year-old daughter. One of her goals for the future is to purchase a house for her family.

Irina is requesting a loan of 5,000 Ukrainian Griven ($1,050) in order to open yet another sales location. With an additional location in which to sell her goods, she will be able to increase her sales and will continue to provide a better life for her and her family.

loans.use: To further expand her business by opening a sixth vending location

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga owns a profitable and growing business selling a popular style of new windows and doors. She started her business about five years ago after she had worked for another sales company. The windows and doors she sells are of high quality, vinyl construction. In general, the windows are very popular as replacements for old, wooden, single-pane windows that are common in many buildings because they offer much better insulation against the cold in the winter and the heat in the summer. Olga is married, and she has one 20-year-old son.

Olga currently has sales offices in three different cities on the Crimean peninsula in Ukraine: Simferopol, Yalta, and Sevastopol. She is working to establish yet another new office, and she has requested a short-term loan to cover some expenses related to the new office. Her goal is to continue to expand her business in the future. We are happy to have this opportunity to assist her in her business endeavors.

loans.use: To open a fourth sales office in order to continue expanding her business

loans.name: Sahara

texts.id:
Sahara, a 28 year old young man, is in the recycling used items business. Every day using a cart used as a tool to bring the used and damaged items he collected. Used items collected are usually, used bottles, cartons, newspapers, plastics, canisters, etc. The areas he usually collects are from Kuta to Denpasar. After searching for used items during the day, he brought his collected items in the evening to a storage place to be weighed and sold. Income obtained is only enough to pay for the household expenses. Sometimes he lacks the capital to buy those used items. Therefore he is hoping very much to be assisted with the capital, so that his business could continue.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sahara, pemuda berusia 28 tahun, saat ini menekuni profesi sebagai pengumpul barang bekas. Sehari-harinya dia menggunakan gerobak yang dipakai sebagai alat untuk membawa barang bekas dan rongsokan yang sudah dikumpulkan. Adapun barang-barang bekas yang dikumpulkan biasanya adalah botol bekas, kardus, koran, plastik, ember dan lain-lain. Kawasan yang biasa dia lalui mulai dari Kuta sampai Denpasar. Setelah seharian mencari barang bekas, biasanya pada sore hari dia membawa barang hasil cariannya ke tempat pengumpulan untuk ditimbang lalu kemudian dijual. Penghasilan yang didapatnya hanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya saja. Terkadang dia kekurangan modal untuk membeli barang-barang bekas. Oleh karena itu dia sangat mengharapkan diberi bantuan modal untuk membuat usahanya tetap berjalan.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul K. is thankful to Kiva for his previous loan. He increased his stock and built his capital. Before the loan, Abdul owned only 60% of the stock while the other 40% of the goods was taken on credit. Now he owns 80% of the business capital, and he is working hard to be 100% owner of the capital. He has a high hope that Kiva will assist him to build his business and is requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000.

loans.use: To increase stock of his grocery

loans.name: Sesay

texts.en: Sesay is very thankful to Kiva for the previous loan she received. She purchased more stock of bottled water and sold it in the market town of Magburaka. Before the loan, Sesay used to sell water in a plastic bag. With the profit, Sesay diversified her business. She purchased agricultural produce, such as rice, palm oil, and peanuts, and sold it to suppliers in Freetown. The family income increased, and they can eat 3 meals a day. Sesay is very grateful to Kiva, and she is requesting another loan of Le.800,000 to increase her stock of agricultural products.

loans.use: To increase her stock of water and agricultural products

loans.name: Betty Nabuuma's Group

texts.en:
Betty is a leader of a group of 5 members. She is 40 years old and is married with 4 children, who are all in school. They are aged 17, 12, 11 and 9. The area in which she operates her business and lives, is low-lying and a slum. It floods during the rainy season and the community is semi-urban.

She displays her grocery alongside a road, where she has a stall, for people to buy. Her main challenge is working in the open and the seasonality of what she sells. When there is scarcity, the prices run so high that the clientele shrinks, and the prices run very low in times of abundance. The short life of vegetables sometimes forces her to sell them off at low prices to avoid total loss. There is a market for her business.

She can now pay school dues on time and contribute to the running of the home. She intends to continue increasing her stock in order to invest more in her children’s education and buy a plot of land for the eventual building of a house. Betty has successfully paid back more than 5 loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock, invest more in her children’s education, and buy a plot of land for the eventual building of a house.

loans.name: Berna Nanyonga's Group

texts.en:
Berna is the leader of a group of 5 members and is the last one on the right. She is 54 years old and is a widow with 4 children, who are 33, 29, 26 and 24 years old. One child and her grandchildren are in school. The community she lives in is semi-urban. She sells babies' clothes in one of the biggest hospitals in Kampala, a business she has done for 36 years. She moves from ward to ward, looking for customers. She has a pool table that she hires out and a retail shop. The challenges include the fear of being stopped from doing her business in the hospital. She says it is more profitable to hawk around than to sit in one place and wait for clients. The challenge at her residence is having very dirty neighbors who always litter the place with rubbish.

Her achievements include the acquisition of a pool table, the retail shop, a house with 8 rooms, and the ability to run her home and educate her children singlehandedly.

She intends to increase her stock with the loan. Berna has successfully paid back 12 loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock .

loans.name: Betty Namutebi's Group

texts.en:
Betty is a leader of 5 members. She is 42 years old and is married with 5 children, who are are 25, 22, 20, 18 and 13 years old. All of them are in school. The community she lives and works in is semi-urban and the area is highly populated.

She has operated the retail shop for 10 years and sells to the people in the neighbourhood. Her challenges include the high transport costs to Kampala to stock the shop especially when the commodities are bulky, unstable prices, stiff competition, and dust that makes the products dirty.

Her main achievement is being able to pay school dues on time, which was not possible before she started taking loans. She also generally contributes to the family's welfare.

She would like to be able to purchase stock in bulk so that she can save on transportation costs to and from Kampala in order to restock the shop from time to time. Betty has successfully paid back more than 15 loans.

loans.use: To purchase in bulk  to reduce on transportation costs.

loans.name: Deborah Nanteza's Group

texts.en:
Deborah is a leader of 5 members. She is 46 years old and is divorced with 7 children, who are 30, 28, 22, 18, 16, 14 and 12 years old. The youngest four go to school. Her community is semi-urban. She has been operating a pub in the area for 14 years. Her challenges include stiff competition, getting payment for what she sells on credit and sometimes losing it, and high transport costs especially when she goes to the rural areas to collect local brew.

She says that the loans have helped to sustain her business for the 14 years, and enabled her to fend for the family. Her biggest dream is to educate all of her children to a high level. Another plan is to acquire a plot of land in order to build a house. She has successfully paid back more than 10 loans.

loans.use: To invest more in her children's education.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a widow and the mother of three children. Two of the children are in school. She has been selling grocery products like evaporated milk, tinned fish, candies, margarine, tinned tomatoes, etc. for two years. There is now a high rise in the price of grocery products and Ama wants to use her loan to buy products to increase her inventory and also to avoid price hikes. Ama wants to start savings to help her children to complete their education. She is a member of the group called Work and Happiness. Members guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a divorced mother with two children. Her children are currently in school. She sells grocery products like toothbrushes, cocoa products, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, tinned milk, slippers, powdered milk, etc. Joyce wants a loan to buy more grocery products to increase inventory and also to avoid price hikes in the products. She is a member of the group called Achirensua I. The members of the group agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Karikari

texts.en: Kwame is a married father with three children. His children are currently in school. Kwame has been selling newspapers and also doing photocopies for clients for 10 years now. He wants to use his loan to buy more newspapers for the community folks to know or read about national issues. He also plans to use part of his loan to buy a photocopier machine to expand his operation. Kwame is a member of the group called Paul Amantem. Members of the group agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more newspapers and papers for photocopying

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is married and the father of two children. He buys foodstuffs like plantain, coco yam and maize in bulk from the nearby villages and towns and sells them to customers in the big towns and cities like Tema and Accra.  He wants to use his loan to buy more foodstuffs and also to buy a sewing machine for his wife to expand her seamstress business. He is a member of the group called Paul Amantem. Members guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan. In the photo, Francis is holding his son in his wife’s shop. Beside him is his wife.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Teopista Namaganda's Group

texts.en:
Teopista is a leader of five members and is the second from the left. She is 44 years old and is married with 6 children. Two of them are married and the others are in school. They are 27, 25, 22, 18, 15 and 14 years old. The community she resides in is semi-urban. She goes to the villages where she collects the charcoal for both retail and wholesale. The challenges are high transport costs and a limited number of clients. This is because many people in that area can afford to buy charcoal from other areas and transport it to their homes. Competition is also quite stiff.

She managed to buy a plot of land where she built some rooms for her to live in and for renting out. These benefits are on top of securing an education for her children and improving their general standard of living.

Her intention is to construct more rooms for renting out. Teopista has successfully paid back more than 14 loans.

loans.use: To construct more rooms for renting out.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is married and she has one child. She has been the pharmaceutical business with her husband for the past 10 years now. She wants to use her loan to buy more drugs like pain killers, anti malarial drugs, antacids, cough mixtures, blood tonic, etc., to enable her to reach more clients. She hopes to buy additional drugs to increase her inventory. Diana is a member of the group called Paul Amantem. Members agree to guarantee each other to repay the loan. Diana’s husband is in the photo since she was at the beauty salon during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en: Kwame is a father of 3 children. All his children are currently in school. He buys blunt cutlasses and hoes and sharpens them for retailing to farmers. Most farmers in Ghana use cutlasses and hoes as the main farm tools to work in the farms and therefore the demand for cutlasses and hoes is high, especially as it is a farming season. Kwame wants to use his loan to buy more cutlasses and hoes to enable more farmers to have access to tools to farm. He is a member of the group called Paul Amantem. Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Kwame is sharpening cutlasses in the photo and beside him is his assistant.

loans.use: To buy more cutlasses and hoes for farmers

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is married and she has three children. Two of her children are in school. She buys in bulk foodstuffs like plantain, maize and avocado pear from the nearby villages and towns and sells them to clients in the big towns and cities for more income. She wants to use her loan to buy more foodstuffs to avoid price hikes in the produce. She is a member of the group called Paul Amantem. Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Diana is in the photo with two of her children.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like plantain, maize and avocado pear

loans.name: Sarah Kigozi's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a leader of 5 members in a group, whose head is leaning in the photograph. She is 48 years old and is divorced with 5 children, who are 30, 28, 18, 16 and 12 years old. The youngest three are in school. She works and resides in a semi-urban slum area, which is prone to floods in the rainy season.

She buys charcoal from trucks belonging to traders, who collect it from the villages and sell in quantities ranging from whole sacks to small heaps. The sacks are piled in a semi-permanent shed that has no lockable door. She also provides outside catering service for occasions like weddings, baptisms, funerals, and any other event that attract crowds of people.

Her challenges include the risk of having the sacks stolen and the high price of charcoal. Her costs are even higher as her area is inaccessible to vehicles, and she has to hire someone to lift the charcoal sack by sack. Also, the floods limit movement in the rainy season.

She has been able to educate her children and cover the family's needs. Her plans include being able to go to the village to collect the charcoal, to buy home assets, and increase her stock. This will be Sarah's fourth loan.

loans.use: To collect charcoal from the village, to buy home assets and increase her stock

loans.name: Susan Kimbugwe's Group

texts.en: Susan is a leader of 4 members. She is 29 years old and is married with 4 children, who are 9, 6, 4 and 2 years old. Three are in school. She lives within a semi-urban community within a slum. She has operated a salon for 4 years, and the main challenge she faces is stiff competition. Her business has provided her with a motorcycle for public transport and the ability to pay school dues. She intends to stock hair oils and weaves to reduce the negative effect of rising prices, and would like to start rearing chickens to supplement her current income. Susan has successfully paid back 5 loans.

loans.use: To stock hair oils and weaves, and start rearing chickens.

loans.name: Rose Baganize's Group

texts.en:
Rose is a leader of four members and she is the first one from the left. She is 42 years old and is married with 6 children, who are 26, 24, 22, 20, 18 and 16 years old. Four of them are in school. The community she lives and works in is in a slum and low lying area, and this area is prone to floods in times of rains.

She purchases local brew for onward sale at retail, which she has done for 20 years. Her main challenges are the rising price of the commodity, which reduces the number of clients and selling more on credit, thus affecting profits.

She has managed to buy a refrigerator for home use, contributes to the running of the home, and is able to educate her children. Her plans are to increase her stock and invest more in her children’s education. Rose has successfully paid back more than 20 loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock and invest more in her children’s education.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married and she has two children. She has been selling used clothing and cloth in her village for 4 years now. She wants to use her loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory and sales and also to avoid price hikes in the product. She hopes this loan will help her to start saving for her children’s education and future. She is a member of the group called Paul Amantem. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is married and the mother of two children. She is a garden eggs farmer and also a retailer of the produce. It is now time for the farming season to begin and therefore she wants a loan to buy more seedlings and also buy more bags of garden eggs to increase her crop yield and sales. She believes this loan would help her expand her farming operations, to add more crops or vegetables during the next farming season. She also hopes to start saving for her children’s education. Beatrice is a member of the group called Paul Amantem. Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of garden eggs and seedlings for the planting season

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and she has four children. All her children are currently in school. She travels to the northern regions of Ghana to buy her products and retails them in her village. Her village is one of the main market centers in the region and therefore trading in foodstuffs attracts a large market. Ama wants to use her loan to buy more tubs of fresh yams, sacks of onions and gallons of palm oil, to avoid price hikes. She is a member of the group called Francis. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more tubs of fresh yams, onions and gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Evas Naturinda's Group

texts.en:
Evas is a leader of 4 members in a group. She is 36 years old and married with 2 children, who are both are in school. She lives in a semi-urban community.

She operates a retail shop selling essential commodities, kitchenware and soft drinks. Her main challenges are the unstable prices of commodities and high rent fees. She has managed to increase her stock and adequately contribute to the well-being of the family. She would like to transform her business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To transform her business into a wholesale shop.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and the mother of two children. She has been treking to the northern part of Ghana to buy tubes of yam, dried fish and dried tilapia and retailing them in her town for the past five years. Due to the current food shortage, the demand for yams and other foodstuffs are very high. Ama wants to use her loan to buy more tubes of yam, dried tilapia and fish, to avoid price hikes, and also to increase sales. She hopes to start saving for her children’s education with this loan. Ama is member of the group called Francis. Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Ama is holding her son in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fresh tubes of yam, dried tilapia and dried fish

loans.name: Ataa

texts.en: Ama is married and she has five children. All her children are currently in school. She treks to the northern part of Ghana to buy more products and retail them in her town. She wants to use her loan to buy more bags of rice, yams and peanuts to avoid price hikes and also to increase her income and inventory. She hopes to start saving to support her husband and take care of the children’s education. Ama is a member of the group called Francis. Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like rice, yams and peanuts

loans.name: Felicity

texts.en: Felicity B. is twenty six years old and she is single. She is very serious with her work since it is her major source of livelihood. She owns a small hair product's shop in one of the busy local markets, with the help from her previous loan. She sells products like weave-ons, hair pomade, shampoo, combs and plastic bows and plates. She wants to use the next loan to buy a variety of weave-ons, hair pomade, shampoo and plastics to increase her stock of goods to meet the taste and preference of her customers, and increase her income. Felicity belongs to the community group called Shepherd Trust Group. Members guarantee one another as social collateral to access a loan.

loans.use: To buy more the assorted weave-ons, hair pomade, shampoo and plastics

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet K. is forty one years old. She is married and has four children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking woman, who is able to combine numerous household demands with pressure from her business. She sells smoked fish in one of the busy local markets. Many homes enjoy her fish because it has a good taste and is moderately priced. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and business. She belongs to the community group called Shepherd Trust Group. Members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish

loans.name: Ketty Nagudi's Group

texts.en:
Ketty is a leader of 4 members. The fifth one passed away. Ketty is 37 years old and a single mother with 3 children, who are 15, 11 and 9 years old and all go to school. The community in which she lives and works is semi-urban and within a slum area. This area is prone to flooding in times of rains.

She has operated a salon and sold second hand shoes for 5 and 6 years respectively. The peak times for the shoes business are in the festive seasons and at the beginning of school terms. The challenges include high taxes, high rental fees, getting paid for what she sells on credit, and the flooded surroundings during the rains, which limit movement from one place to another. She brags of having an improved standard of living, and the ability to look after her family without having to depend on someone.

She intends to increase stock, buy a plot of land, and build a house so that she is relieved of paying rent for her house. Ketty has successfully paid back more than 10 loans.

loans.use: To increase stock, buy a plot of land, and build a house

loans.name: Jameratu

texts.en:
Jameratu A. is thirty nine years old. She is a wife and mother of two children, who are currently in school. She works very hard because she thinks duty demands that she provide brighter opportunities for her children. She is determined to send at least one of her children to medical school. That is her motivation. Mary Prah, her mother, helps her because Jameratu had to go to the hospital for treatment for a minor illness (Mary is in the picture).

Jameratu owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets. She sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, and evaporated milk. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk and vegetable oil, among other items. This will increase her stock.

Jameratu belongs to the community group called Shepherd Trust Group. In this group, members use social collateral to guarantee the loans for one another. They use positive peer pressure to encourage each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth G. is thirty six years old. She is married with three children. The children are currently in school.

Elizabeth trades in vegetables and sells commodities like tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs and onions. She is a very industrious woman who is able to combine her business and motherhood. Elizabeth thinks her business can grow better with the help of a loan. She would use the loan to buy increased stock of tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs and onions to serve her customers. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education.

She belongs to the community group called Shepherd Trust Group. In the group, members support each other help each othe repay the loans.

Joyce Mensah, Elizabeth’s sister, is in the photograph because Elizabeth had gone to take supply of goods when the photograph was taken.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs and onions.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua B. is a fifty-seven-year-old widowed mother of five children. She is a food vendor who sells Kenkey. Kenkey is one of the local dishes prepared from maize and eaten with hot pepper and fish. She has been selling Kenkey for the past fifteen years.

Afua said since her husband died ten years ago, this business has been the backbone to finance her children’s education. She wants to expand her production to serve additional customers and therefore wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize, fish and vegetables. She believes this will fetch her increased income to support her last daughter in completing her apprenticeship.

Afua belongs to the community group called Christ Nti (meaning it is because of Christ). Members act as social collateral for one another to enable each other to access loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina V. lives in her own home in the Villa Fatima zone of La Paz. Marina is retired and lives on a pension from the city of La Paz.

Currently, Marina’s home is in disrepair due to its age and construction (primarily adobe which is deteriorating). The requested loan will be used to knock down a wall in the front of the house and replace it with a brick wall.

This is the first time that Marina has requested a loan and an analysis of her socio-economic position has approved her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marina V. vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Fátima de la Ciudad de La Paz. La señora Marina es rentista del magisterio de la ciudad de la Paz, es decir ella está jubilada. La vivienda de su propiedad se encuentra en deterioro por la antigüedad y por que el material de construcción (adobe) se encuentra en proceso de deterioro. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la demolición del muro frontal y la construcción de un muro de ladrillo. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Replace an aging adobe wall with one made of brick.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana K. is a fifty-two-year-old divorced mother of three children. Her children have benefited a lot since her husband divorced her.

Diana sells maize and cassava, which are two major staple foods in Ghana. She has been selling these commodities for the last fourteen years. She is not able to buy larger quantities of the goods due to low capital. However, Diana believes in the help that a loan can provide. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize for keep, especially in the face of increasing food prices due to the current food crisis. This, she hopes, will increase her income to sponsor her last child in apprenticeship.

She is a member of the community group called Christ Nti Trust Group. Members act as social collateral for one another to guarantee the loans for each other.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to store.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda V. lives with her daughter in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz. Eduarda owns her own home and is retired. Her husband works for the mayor’s office of La Paz.

The requested loan will be used to build a fully functional bathroom for Eduarda’s home and to complete foundation/ground work for the same.

This is the fifteenth time that Eduarda has requested a loan. The socio-economic analysis continues to give Eduarda high ratings. Eduarda has been a client of IMPRO since 2002 and has an excellent repayment history.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eduarda V. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz. Con su hija. La señora Eduarda es rentista de los beneméritos y su esposo trabaja el la alcaldía de La Paz. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en un baño completo y al compactado y traslado de tierra en su terreno.

Esta es la quinta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Eduarda es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002 y su historial de pagos es excelente.

loans.use: Construction of a bathroom and completion of foundation/ground work.

loans.name: Donah Tusiime`s Group

texts.en:
Dona is the leader of 5 members. She is aged 25 and married with 1 child who goes to school. He is 5 years old. She is servicing her first loan. She resides in a slum area, which is vulnerable to flooding when it rains.

She sells cosmetics in one of the taxi parks in the city center of Kampala. She has done this for 2 years.

The main challenges include the effects of weather on her and on what she sells, although she does it under an umbrella. Some of the cosmetics react with the heat and they become poisonous. Some of them look like old stock after a short time and clients reject them. The taxes levied by the authorities push the high prices yet higher. She would like to move to a shop.

loans.use: To move to a shop

loans.name: Philista

texts.en:
Philista A. is a 48-year-old dedicated community health worker (CHW). She lives in Sagam Siaya, Kenya, with her husband and four of her children, and she also supports nine orphans. She was trained in 2001 by KMET in home-based HIV/AIDS care. Through her own initiative and hard work, she opened a community pharmacy at Midhine market in Sagam, the only one serving the surrounding community. Philista has managed to expand her business and build a successful enterprise. People come from from far away to buy drugs from her pharmacy, as it is the only one in the area. She requires an additional $700 in order to purchase more stock of drugs, which are fast moving and in high demand, in order to boost her income.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To buy stock of drugs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 48-year-old married mother of five children. She lives at Ahono with her husband, who is a school teacher. She spent one year learning the art of dressmaking and has been offering her tailoring services within her community in Siaya, Kenya, since 1995. She specializes in making both women’s dresses and men’s shirts. Due to her hard work, many years of experience, well-established clientele base and financial assistance from KMET, Margaret has seen her business grow. She plans to use half of her $700 loan to purchase new patterns and materials, and half for a new sewing machine so as to cope with the growing demand.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses.
