Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Vumiliya Kayirigi`s Group

texts.en:
Vumiliya is the leader of a group of 5 members. She is aged 34 years and married with 3 children. All of them are in school. She is presently paying her sixth loan and has been in this group since she joined MCDT. The community she lives in is semi-urban, within a slum area.

She has been selling local brew for the last 7 years. Her success has been attributed to her two brothers who she has always sent to the villages to look for the liquor or to brew it themselves. Unfortunately, these two died recently in a motor accident in which 4,000 liters of brew was lost. She has been left with the responsibility of looking after the families of her late brothers.

The main challenges she is facing now are the high prices if she is to buy it from other people, and she feels there may be a compromise on the quality. All these are bound to have an adverse effect on her income. She also used to sell at wholesale and employ someone to sell at retail. She had to abandon it after realizing that the employee lacked integrity. She increased her stock from 20 liters to 600 liters and has been able to contribute to the welfare of the family. Her plan is to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: Her plan is to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.name: Sipros

texts.en:
Sipros is a 37-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Sagam Siaya, Kenya, with her husband and seven children. Sipros set up a fruit and vegetable stand near her home in 2007. Her hard work, determination and excellent people-skills have led to her success within the one-year period. She has been able to generate enough income to cover her household expenses. She plans to use the funds from her loan of $500 to purchase more stock of vegetables, and also supplement her current business with the sale of cereals.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase stock of vegetables and cereals

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is married, and he has one daughter. He is a businessman from Zaporozhye. Igor sells sports footwear in the Yubileynyi market. His vending spot is well-known in the market because there are few other locations with the same type of merchandise and because the prices Igor offers for his products are very reasonable. He has been in this business for several years. Currently, Igor has about $2,000 worth of merchandise in inventory, and his gross income is approximately $1,200 per month.

Igor is very industrious and enterprising: he is focused on his business, and he is determined to expand his vending facility. Therefore, he is currently seeking a loan for 5,000 Grivnas ($1,050) so that he may increase his assortment of sports footwear and thereby grow his business. With the expected increase in sales and profits from the loan, he hopes to open an additional vending kiosk and to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To expand his inventory and to further grow the business

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married, and she has one son. She is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye, Ukraine. Natalya sells men’s outerwear in a local market called Yubileynyi. Her merchandise is very high in quality and thus is expensive. Natalya started her venture eight years ago when she could not find other ways to support herself and her family. Over the years, her business has grown significantly, and she currently has about $3,500 worth of merchandise in inventory. In addition, her gross income is approximately $1,200.

Natalya’s husband just underwent a serious and complicated surgery that was pretty costly. As a result, Natalya spent all of her savings to provide the best medical care for her husband. However, this predicament did not get her down. Indeed, as a determined entrepreneur with an enthusiastic personality, Natalya has managed to overcome such challenges and she has been able to manage her business' operations during this tough period. Natalya is now requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas ($1,050) to increase her turnover capital and to further develop her business.

loans.use: To replenish the business' capital and to develop her business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is an experienced entrepreneur from Simferopol, Ukraine. She has a small business selling inexpensive women’s clothing; generally, she sells such clothing at a large outdoor market in Simferopol, but she sometimes sells the clothing in another nearby city. Tatyana has been self-employed for the past ten years. She is divorced and lives with her son, who is 20 years old. Her business provides a good income for her; to illustrate, in a typical month she sells about $2,400 worth of clothing and makes approximately $750 in profit.

Tatyana has requested a loan to help open a new location in which to sell her clothing. She would like to see her business grow and she hopes to increase her profits by opening the additional location. This is Tatyana’s second loan with Nadiya Ukraine. We are glad to have this opportunity to support her business endeavors and look forward to seeing her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: To open a new location in which to sell her clothing

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Ms. Celia lives in the Manual Cossio Street in the area of September 14th in the city of La Paz. She rents and lives by herself. She has a food business in which she has rented a store in the area of Valle Hermoso where she sells 20 lunches per day since she does not have the money to expand her business. The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy supplies and merchandise in bigger amounts that will allow her to prepare special meals so that she can improve her earnings since she has nobody that can support her. She has no loans with IMPRO; this is the first time that is requesting a loan, but the economical and cash flow analysis done qualify her to obtain one.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Celia vive en alquiler en la calle Manuel Cossio de la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz, vive sola y la actividad que realiza es la venta de comida en una tienda que alquiló en la zona de Valle Hermoso lugar donde al día vende 20 almuerzos debido a que no cuenta con mucho dinero para ampliar su negocio. El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos en mayor cantidad y poder preparar platos especiales y así mejorar sus ingresos ya que no tiene quien le mantenga. No tiene créditos en Impro; es primera vez que solicita crédito pero el análisis económico y flujo de caja la califican para obtener uno.

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare and sell more food in her business.

loans.name: Carlos Borromeo

texts.es:
Carlos Borromeo A. lives and works in Sandino, Managua. Carlos runs his own business out of his home. Carlos maintains a full workshop in which he prepares and sells both leather belts and orthopedic footwear.

Carlos fully supports and cares for his one son who is studying in the city. Carlos is requesting this loan to purchase additional materials for his business, specifically various types of leather. Carlos hopes that you accept his request so that he can continue his business and continue to provide for his wife and son.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua, el caballero Carlos Borromeo Álvarez posee su negocio de elaboración y venta de fajas de cuero y zapatos ortopédicos por encargo el cual son comercializados en su casa de habitación donde posee sus herramientas de trabajo.

Es padre de un hijo quien se encuentra estudiando en el municipio por lo que está en el deber y de suplir todas sus necesidades. Es de vital importancia destacar que este caballero está solicitando crédito en Ceprodel con el propósito de comprar los materiales de trabajo como lo son cuero, vaqueta y cuerina. Para esto espera que su petición sea concedida y así obtener el crédito para continuar con su negocio y de esta manera suplir la necesidad de su hijo y la de su esposa en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of leather.

loans.name: Eva Nansikombi`s Group

texts.en:
Eva is a leader of a group of 5 members that has stayed together since they joined MCD. She appears in squatting posture in the photograph. She is aged 32 and married with 4 children. They are aged 16, 11, 3 and 1 years. Three are in school. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban.

She buys rolls of material and designs garments to display to clients. She has had to move from the original working place because of high rental fees and transport costs to a place nearer to her residence. The challenges she is facing now include the low prices that fellow residents expect to acquire her services at, credit sales, and the limited work due to funds.

She has managed to buy 2 new sewing machines and is adequately contributing to the family income. Her plan is to buy a refrigerator so that she can sell soft drinks.

Eva is successfully paying her fifth loan.

loans.use: Her plan is to buy a refrigerator so that she can sell soft drinks.

loans.name: Eufemia Margarita

texts.es:
Ms. Eufemia M. is dedicated to the preparation and sale of food, located in the open in one of the streets of the municipality of Ciudad Sandino, close to a hospital in the community.

She began her business several years ago because the income brought in by her spouse was too low to maintain the home. Today she has come to CEPRODEL with the proposition of being a beneficiary of credit that would allow her to buy the ingredients for food. It is necessary to point out that Ms. Eufemia has been a faithful client of the institution, having paid back her previous loans on time in accordance with the established terms.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad a la que se dedica la señora Eufemia M. es a la elaboración y venta de comida estando ubicada a la intemperie en una de las calles del municipio de Ciudad Sandino cercano a un hospital de la comunidad.

Su negocio lo tiene desde hace varios años habiéndolo iniciado debido a que los ingresos que percibía su esposo eran muy bajos para mantener el hogar. Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con el crédito oportuno que le permita la compra de los ingredientes para los alimentos. Es necesario destacar que la señora Eufemia ha sido fiel cliente de la institución habiendo cancelado sus créditos anteriores en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Corina Del Socorro

texts.es:
In the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, Ms. Corina Narvaez dedicates great effort to the business of sewing. She has her own sewing machines, with which she embroiders all types of clothes, from shirts to dresses for all ages. In spite of her difficult economic situation that has been an obstacle for a long time, today she has improved the living conditions of her two small children, who really depend on her. She needs financial support to purchase tools for work such as fabrics, threads, needles, etc.and for this sensible reason she has come to CEPRODEL to obtain the credit that will give her the opportunity to obtain materials to continue with the business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de Managua capital de Nicaragua, la señora Corina N. se dedica con muchísimo esfuerzo al negocio de costurera teniendo sus propias maquinas de coser con la que elabora todo tipo de ropa desde camisas hasta vestidos para todas las edades. A pesar de su difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado hoy en día ha mejorado la condición de vida de sus dos pequeños hijos que tanto necesitan de ella.

La necesidad atravesada por la señora Carina es que está necesitando el apoyo financiero para la compra de las herramientas de trabajo como telas, hijos, agujas, etc. por esta sencilla razón ha acudido a CEPRODEL para obtener el crédito que le de la oportunidad de obtener los materiales para continuar con el negocio en su localidad de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials

loans.name: Sebastiana Cristina

texts.es:
Sebastiana Ruiz, from the municipality of Ciudad Sandino, has worked for more than 20 years in making and selling food, especially Nacatamales which she prepares with a lot dedication in her house where her customers come to buy her food. It's important to note that she is known as an excellent cook.

Today she comes to CEPRODEL to request a loan that will allow her to buy the ingredients to continue making her foods. Her earnings benefit not only her but also her little granddaughter for whom she is responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sebastiana Ruiz originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino se ha dedicado por mas de 20 años a la elaboración y venta de alimentos especialmente de Nacatamales los cuales los prepara con mucha dedicación en su casa de habitación donde llegan sus clientes en busca de estos alimentos. Es de suma necesidad destacar que ella es una dama que se ha destacado por ser excelente cocinera.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a CEPRODEL para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para continuar con la elaboración de sus alimentos. Por medio de su ganancia se beneficia tanto ella como su pequeña nieta que tiene a su responsabilidad.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for her prepared food

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es:
Adrian Sambrana is a married man with two children and the duty to provide them with everything needed for their development. He has a photography business and his own studio in this house and clients that want photographs for various purposes. He also works outside of the studio if his clients require it.

Since he started the business ten years ago he has managed to improve the living conditions in his family. Today he is requesting a loan at CEPRODEL in order to improve his studio as well as his darkroom where he develops his photos. That's why he trusts that he will receive his loan without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Adrian Sambrana es un caballero casado y con dos hijos con el deber de brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo por ser menores de edad. Este caballero se dedica al negocio de la fotografía teniendo su propio estudio en su casa de habitación donde es visitado por clientes que desean tomarse fotos para diversos fines. Además trabaja ambulante si así se lo requiere algún cliente.

Desde que inicio este negocio hace diez años ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Hoy en día ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para la mejora del local del estudio fotográfico y además para el revelado de las fotografías. Por eso es que confía en que recibirá el crédito sin ningún inconveniente.

loans.use: To improve his photography studio

loans.name: Nicolasa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nicolasa C. has worked for several years making and selling food that she prepares such as tortillas, cheese, cuajada, and beans which are sold in her house in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino. She is a very hard-working woman that has managed to get ahead thanks to her great efforts in her business. She is the mother of a son and also takes care of her little granddaughter and she provides them both with the things need for their development.

The problem that she is confronted with nowadays is that she doesn't have the resources to buy the ingredients needed to prepare the food for her business. That's why she is looking for support at CEPRODEL in order to benefit from a loan that will allow her to buy the ingredients for her food so that she can continue selling it without worry.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Nicolasa C. se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de alimentos preparados por ella misma como lo son tortillas, queso, cuajada y frijoles vendidos en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino. Ella es una dama muy esforzada que ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos en el negocio. Es madre de un hijo y de igual manera tiene a su cargo una pequeña nieta que les proporciona las necesidades para que puedan desarrollarse.

La problemática que ella atraviesa hoy en día es que no posee recurso económico para la compra de los ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito que le permita la adquisición de los alimentos para seguir comercializándolos sin ninguna preocupación.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for her prepared foods

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana Julia R., with a lot of effort in order to provide for the studies of her two small children, has a business selling clothes and cosmetics in her own booth in the Ciudad Sandino market in Managua. She started the business 20 long years ago with little merchandise but as time has passed she has managed to keep the business supplied and thus provide better conditions for her family that consists of two small children and her elderly mother, whom she has to care of.

She has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan that will allow her to buy merchandise from her suppliers. She hopes that her loan will be awarded so that she can continue with her work of selling clothes and cosmetics in the Ciudad Sandino market.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Ana Julia R. con grandes esfuerzos para proporcionarles a sus dos pequeños hijos sus estudios, se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos en su tramo propio en el mercado de Ciudad Sandino en Managua. Inició el negocio desde hace 20 largos años con poca mercadería pero a medida que ha venido avanzando el tiempo ha logrado surtir el negocio y de esta manera proporcionarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia que consta de sus dos pequeños hijos y su anciana madre a la que tiene que mantener.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito que le permita la compra de su mercadería a sus proveedores por esto es que espera que el crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para así continuar con su labor de venta de ropa y cosméticos en el mercado de Ciudad Sandino.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her clothing and cosmetics store

loans.name: Jeymi

texts.es:
Jeymi R.'s business is a beauty salon which is located in a booth in the Ciudad Sandino market. She stands out as a woman that has put forward a lot of effort and with a lot sacrifice has supported her humble home composed of three small children and another on the way.

Today she is requesting a loan at CEPRODEL with the purpose of obtaining the tools necessary for her business such as gels, dyes, perfumes, etc. That's why she trusts that her loan will be approved and with it she will improve the economic situation of herself and her children, whom very much need the support of their mother.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio que se dedica la señora Jeymi R. es el salón de belleza el cual atiende en su tramo en el mercado de Ciudad Sandino. Se ha destacado por ser una dama muy esforzada que con mucho sacrificio ha llevado el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación compuesto por sus tres pequeños hijos y el próximo que está por nacer por estar en estado de embarazo.

Hoy en día ha solicitado un crédito en CEPRODEL con el propósito de obtener las herramientas necesarias para trabajar tales como gelatinas, tintes, colonias, etc. Por este motivo es que confía en que su crédito le será otorgado y de esta manera mejorará su condición económica y el de sus amados hijos que tanto necesitan del apoyo de su madre.

loans.use: Buying materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is a fifty-six-year-old divorced mother of three children. She has been very supportive of her children since she became a single parent.

Akua has sold used clothes at her local market for the past fifteen years. Because of this, she will be able to pay for her two children to finish school. With low capital, she is not able to buy larger quantities of used clothes to sell. She would like to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes that come with variety to increase her stock. She hopes to raise enough income to support her two children to finish school.

She belongs to the community called Christ Nti Trust Group. In this group, members act as social collateral for each to guarantee access to loans. They also help each other to repay the loans through positive peer pressure.

loans.use: To buy larger bale quantities of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia N. is a sixty-one-year-old widowed mother of five children. She is a trader who trades in garment clothes, women's slippers and dressing bags.

Afia says her husband died several years ago but through this business, she has managed to support her five children. All five have finished school and are currently working. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital. Therefore she wants this loan to buy more pieces of garment clothes, slippers and dressing bags to increase her stock. This will increase her income and allow her to build a decent home.

Afia belongs to the community group called Quality Trust Group. In this group, members act as social collateral for each to guarantee access to loans. They also help each other to repay the loans through positive peer pressure.

loans.use: To buy more pieces of garment clothes, slippers and dressing bags.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Mr. Carlos L. is originally from the city of Esterí in the municipality of Condega and is the owner of a small grocery store, which is located in his home. He is a man that has made a great effort to improve the conditions of his business and despite his low income has managed to maintain his home, dealing with the necessities as they come up.

Today he has come to Ceprodel with the purpose of requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase products from his suppliers and very confidently is awaiting that the loan be approved in order to obtain the merchandise to sell in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

El caballero Carlos L. es originario del municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí y se dedica al negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido en su casa de habitación donde ofrece los productos a sus clientes. Es un caballero que se ha esforzado por mejorar las condiciones del negocio y a pesar de sus bajos ingresos ha logrado mantener el hogar supliendo las necesidades que se presentan.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de solicitar un crédito que le permita adquirir los productos de sus proveedores por esto es que muy confiadamente espera que le sea aprobado el crédito para así obtener la mercadería para su respectiva comercialización en el negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for his store

loans.name: Pedro Ángel

texts.es:
In the municipality of Condega in the city of Estela, Mr. Pedro Calderon has dedicated himself to the agriculture business. He grows basic grains and handles cattle as a small farmer. His family is made up of his wife and his three children who he provides with the education that they deserve. It is important to point out that this gentleman has succeeded in this business and has been able to improve the condition of his business thanks to his sacrifices and great efforts.

Ceprodel has been an important factor in his business as it has given Pedro loans which he has used to purchase cattle and to assist in his crops. Today he needs a loan to provide technological assistance to his crops which is why he confidently waits the approval of this loan knowing that it will be of great use in this business and that his family will greatly benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí, el caballero Pedro C. se ha dedicado por mucho tiempo al negocio de la agricultura al cultivo de granos básicos y al manejo de ganado como pequeño productor agropecuario. Su familia consta de su esposa y tres hijos que les proporciona la educación que ellos se merecen. Es de mucha necesidad destacar que este caballero ha sobresalido en el negocio por lo que ha logrado mejorar la condición de su negocio gracias a sus sacrificios y grandes esfuerzos que ha hecho.

Hoy en día, Ceprodel ha sido un factor importante en su negocio por la razón de que ha financiado al caballero Pedro por medio del otorgamiento de créditos que los ha utilizado para la compra del ganado y asistencia de los cultivos. Hoy en día su necesidad es la adquisición del crédito para darle asistencia técnica a los cultivos por esta razón es que muy confiadamente espera en la aprobación del crédito sabiendo que le será de mucha utilidad en su negocio y de esta manera su familia será beneficiada grandemente.

loans.use: Technological assistance for cultivation

loans.name: José Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto is 48 years old, married and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. He has one son who is 14 years old. His wife works as a maid in a private home and helps the family with household expenses.

Ernesto started his mechanical rides business with a family inheritence and he has 15 years of experience. It is difficult when there is no electricity.

He wants this loan to make improvements to his home and plans to enclose a room with plaster-covered brick. He will also build a wall.

His plans are to refurbish and modernize the mechanical rides, be more organized and to help his son get ahead so he can be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Ernesto tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad, su esposa trabaja en una casa particular como domestica, y apoya a la familia en los gastos del hogar.

El negocio del Sr. Ernesto son Juegos mecánicos, que comenzó de una herencia familiar, la experiencia que ha tenido es de quince años. Las dificultades se dan cuando no hay energía eléctrica.

Este préstamo lo quiere para mejoras de su vivienda por que quiere enladrillar un cuarto ,repellarlo y también hacer un muro. Sus planes son renovar los juegos mecánicos y modernizarlos, estar más organizados y también apoyar a su hijo a salir adelante para que sea un profesional.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make home improvements

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is forty two years old. She is married with three children, who are currently in school. Margaret recognizes the fact that motherhood comes with the responsibility of hard work and she works with the motivation of supporting her children.

Margaret bakes all kinds of cakes, from birthday cakes to wedding cakes. She has been in business for the past ten years. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like vegetable oil, margarine and flour to expand her production. This will increase the income for her family. Margaret belongs to the community group called Shepherd Trust Group. In this group, members act as social collateral for each to guarantee access to loans. They also help each other to repay the loans through positive peer pressure.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like vegetable oil, margarine, flour etc.

loans.name: Candido Humberto

texts.es:
Candido has been working for 12 years selling the mattresses he makes himself. He started his small business thanks to a prize he won in the lottery.

Candido lives in the neighborhood of Camilo Chamorro, is 49 years old, single and has three school-age children.

He needs the loan to increase sales and gain a larger clientele by satisfying his clients with his products. His plans are to improve his home and quality of life and to prepare his children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough

Don Candido se dedica desde hace 12 años a la venta de colchones que él mismo elabora, el pequeño negocio lo inició gracias a un premio que obtuvo de la lotería, y fue así como empezó este negocio.

Don Candido habita en el barrio Camilo chamorro, tiene 49 años de edad, es soltero y tiene tres hijos que están en edad escolar.

El préstamo lo necesita para aumentar las ventas, y obtener más clientela, sastifcer a sus clientes con sus productos. Sus planes son mejorar su vivienda, su nivel de vida, y preparar a sus hijos profesionalmente.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials needed to make mattresses

loans.name: Teófilo Ramón

texts.es:
The economic activity that Mr. Teofilo P. dedicates himself to is the sale of food which he does in his own establishment in the municipality of Condega in the city of Esteli in Nicaragua. It is necessary to point out that his business only offered a few food items but through time he has been able to improve his economic condition and increase the variety of food he can offer his clients.

Ceprodel has been a pillar in his business as it has given him loans which he has used directly to improve the conditions of his business and in the purchase of all his ingredients he uses to make his foods. It is for this simple reason that he once again asks for Ceprodel’s support. The loan will allow him to purchase the necessary ingredients to be used in his high quality dishes to satisfy his loyal customers. This will allow him to improve conditions for his family which is made up of his spouse and his young daughter who is of school age.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica el señor Teofilo P. es al negocio de la venta de comida en su propio establecimiento ubicado en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí en Nicaragua. Es necesario destacar que inició su negocio con pocos alimentos ofertados pero a medida que ha venido transcurriendo el tiempo ha logrado mejorar su condición económica ofreciendo más variedades de comida para los clientes.

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en el negocio por lo que le ha brindado créditos que los ha utilizado directamente en el mejoramiento de las condiciones del negocio y además en la compra de todos sus ingredientes para elaborar los alimentos. Es por esta sencilla razón que una vez mas busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita comprar los ingredientes necesarios para preparar los platillos de mas alta calidad para satisfacer a sus fieles clientes en su negocio de comidería y así sacar adelante a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y su pequeña niña que actualmente se encuentra en edad escolar.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make food

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella A. is forty three years old. She is a wife and the mother of three children, who are currently in school.

Stella believes in hard work; she says it is the antidote to escaping poverty. She owns and operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like futu, banku, ampesi, rice balls and tz. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantains, and is taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Ampesi is a boiled plantain or yam and it is taken with any stew.

Stella wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She belongs to the community group called Nkwabin Ladies Trust Group. Nkwabin is the name of the local community. In this group, members act as social collateral for each to guarantee access to loans. They also help each other to repay the loans through positive peer pressure.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Basilia Yamileth

texts.es:
Basilia is 31 years old, married and lives the neighborhood of La Fuente. Her husband is a welder and he contributes to household expenses. She has no children.

Basilia is a seamstress and also works a lot selling cosmetics. She has one year of experience. She started working in a small company called Kazma as a cosmetics salesperson and requires a loan to buy cosmetics that her clients order from her, and in that way have more profit from sales.

In the future she wishes to attract more clients and have a stronger business in order to attain a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Basilia tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, y habita en el barrio la Fuente, su esposo es soldador y aporta al gasto del hogar. No tiene hijos. Doña Basilia es costurera y también se dedica en gran parte a la venta de cosméticos, tiene un año de experiencia.

Ella inició trabajando en una pequeña expresa llamada Kazma, en el cargo de ventas de cosmético. El préstamo lo requiere para comprar cosméticos que los clientes le hacen por encargo, y así tener mas utilidad en las ventas.

En un futuro desea captar más clientes y tener un negocio mas fortalecido logrando así un nivel de vida mejor.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Trinidad De Jesus

texts.es:
Mr. Trinidad Acuna's economic activity is agriculture which he has dedicated himself to for several years. He learned this business from a young age and now has a lot of experience.

It is very important to point out that his business requires a lot of effort which is why he dedicates himself to growing basic grains such as corn and beans. This requires a lot of exposure to the sun as well as moving the product long distances. The reason why he is requesting a loan from Ceprodel is to invest in technological assistance in cultivation. With this loan he will be able to succeed and have better opportunities for the sale of his products after the harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad económica del caballero Trinidad A. es la agricultura dedicándose a esta labor desde hace varios años habiendo aprendido a desempeñarse en el campo desde muy jovencito lo que hasta hoy ha ocasionado de que tenga basta experiencia con esta labor.

Es de suma importancia destacar que su negocio requiere de mucho esfuerzo por lo que se dedica fuertemente al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles y esto requiere de mucha exposición al sol y traslado del producto desde largas distancias. La razón por la cual hoy en día solicita un crédito en Ceprodel es para la inversión en asistencia técnica para el cultivo. Con este crédito logrará salir adelante y tener mejores oportunidades para la venta de los productos una vez que se lleve a cabo la cosecha.

loans.use: Purchase of products for cultivation
